review_body: Booked a single room which was small by western standards but it was very comfortable & had everything that i needed, even including a little kettle to have a cup of tea in the morning. (you get your tea bags from reception for free)I did have a problem when i became ill , and needed a doctor. What a hassle. The night staff had no idea what to do. They ended up ringing me an ambulance, and after attending hospital i had to return home & cut my holiday short after only 2 days. It took the reception staff about 90 minutes to work out what to do. I can not believe that in today's world,in a big city like Tokyo, that you don't have a doctor service on call. Maybe something to look into.

Nishshitetsu- in Shinjuku , walkable to central Shinjuku - checkin was fast and efficient- Hotel room small but ok as with Japan standard- No ventilation in bathroom making it very stuffy snd wet after shower- Staffs are courteous and polite- Beds and linen are fresh and clean- Small single packet of toiletries are placed near to the elevator - Room cleanup was done nicely - Checkout was key drop off box

Exceptional value for money. Spotlessly clean hotel with a nice sized room by tokyo standards. Room had a lot of extras ideal for a trip from overseas. Room was cleaned every day even though i missed the cleaning time and still returned to the room cleaned. If you opt to not have your bed clothes cleaned on a certain day they leave a complementary bottle of water. Stayed in a single room. Perfect size. A bath is a nice touch after a long day walking. TV has no English channels though.Staff were very friendly and helpful.Parking is also available at 2k yen over night. Slept soundly every night. Couldn't hear any room noise even though the hotel is off a major road. 24hr McDonalds across the road if your badly stuck for western food. many 7/11s within a short walk. 5 min walk to shinjuku station. Would stay again for sure.

Excellent economy-class hotel - good quality-price ratio. Small but clean and cozy and quiet rooms, helpful staff. The main attraction is of course the location - 2 min from Nishi Shinjuku subway and 7 min from the huge transport hub - Shinjuku Station. Will definitely return here if I visit Japan again.

I stayed in a single room at this hotel and found it to be excellent. While typically small, it was very well planned out with everything I needed. The bed was comfortable and the room very clean. Our floor had a room with vending machines and a microwave oven. It would be handy to heat up food from the nearby 7/11 and Lawsons. We had western style breakfasts down the road at Jonathan’s which was good. We had dinner in the yakitori restaurant under the hotel which was delicious. The location was great and I would definitely stay here again.

The room is tiny (barely fits one bed and a restroom with tub/shower), but other than that it’s highly recommended. Front desk speaks English and staff was very helpful. We were able to borrow an umbrella on a rainy day and they stored our luggage for us for a couple hours after check-out too. Located about a minute away from Nishi-Shinjuku station, and about 10 minute walk away from JR Shinjuku station. All in all, clean room with excellent service. Free coffee and tea is an added bonus. Coin laundry is available on two separate floors. You can also pick up essential personal items such as toothbrush, hair brush, bath sponge, etc. in the lobby by the elevator. Lastly, the coffee shop downstairs has great coffee and pastries for breakfast.

Comfortable, all necessities are provided ， a smartphone is provided for you to use, is convenient. Near to station however if you need to travel with your luggage before 6 am do note that the elevator at exit 1 is closed.

I can't fault it the location and amenities were all as good as could be expected. WiFi worked great and the staff were very professional and helpful whenever I interacted them. A place I would definitely book again if I was to return to Tokyo.

Hotel’s location is near by train station , and station entrance have elevator can be used . Hotel’s service is very friendly. There is a fruit stand next to the hotel , the fruit is much cheaper than convenient store .

Make sure you book the correct type of room. I’ve accidentally booked a smoking room and the room really stinks. Luckily the room has got a air purifier which helped a lot. Room is very very small. Limited space to open up 2 luggages in a room. Amenities are all provided. There’s a cafe right below the hotel. Getting food around the area is not difficult. 8-10mins walk from Shinjuku Station / west exit.

This is our 3rd stay here. The location is not in the heart of busy crazy Shinjuku, but close enough to walk to it and yet quiet enough to wind down. A good balance. Hotel always look so clean and welcoming. The Reception lady who checked us in was so friendly, professional and willing to help :)

I have stayed in this budget hotel for one night, very difficult to find its location in Shinjuku. Have spent over one hour to find it, and suitable for staying one night only.Staff are polite and clean as the same as other Japan hotels.

Stayed inbound and outbound for our trip. Would stay again. Had our internet router delivered to our hotel. Was in our room the night we arrived. Free luggage storage at checkout time before later flying out. ROOMS - A queen bed (aka large double) non smoking room inbound and then twin bed non smoking room on the way out of Tokyo. Quiet. clean, comfy. Twin room a bit better, but both excellent. Note - most beds in Japan are firmer than NA standards. I contacted hotel directly and they found me twin room several weeks after I booked the large double room. They are very responsive. Paid difference on arrival.GETTING AROUND - Arrived to Shinjuku(JR) station 8PM. Walked to hotel 10 mins max. We actually take the east exit out of Shinjuku where the JR ticket office is, go outside and use the short tunnel and nearly a straight shot to hotel. Less busy and tricky than the busier west exit suggested by the hotel. And the JR ticket office was handy for booking ongoing travel etc. AMENITIES - fridge, kettle, instant coffee/tea. Some floors have microwave and ice machines. Restaurant is really a cafe with cakes and maybe a sandwich - not used. Within 1-2 mins is 7/11, coffee shops, MacDonalds, a few restaurants. Shinjuku action is 10 minutes away....

A great location and small but comfy room is all you need if you are in Tokyo for a short period of time. The Nishitetsu Inn is located within a short walk of a subway station as well as less than 10 minutes from the giant Shinjuku station that will connect you to any train in the city. It's also a short walk to the bright lights of Shinjuku and has a wonderful little cafe on the first floor if you need a pick-me-up from jet lag. There are certainly fancier hotels with larger rooms in the city, but if you are only there for a few nights and require nothing more than a comfortable room at an affordable rate, this is a great spot.

Nice hotel. Great location! 10mins walk from Nishi-Shinjuku Station. Many eateries nearby. 7/11 just next door. Great room! Air humidifier :) Lovely shower and amenities. Comfortable bed. Helpful service from front desk. Special mention to Ms Ito for her most wonderful hospitality and assistance. Definitely will stay here again when visiting Shinjuku.

I booked a non-smoking twin room for three nights through Booking.com. Perhaps because we stayed over a weekend, the price was higher than I expected. Having said that, I think the hotel provided fairly good value for money, especially taking into account its location in Nishi-Shinjuku.In terms of room size, the room was a little larger than a comparable property which I had booked about a year ago. I found it acceptable for Shinjuku standards. The bed was fairly comfortable, but I found the pillow a little hard. As for location, the hotel is about a 2-minute walk from Nishi-Shinjuku station, and about a 10 to 15-minute walk from the main Shinjuku area. We took the subway only when we had our luggages, and found it straightforward to walk to and from Shinjuku otherwise. In my opinion, this was a more economical option than booking a hotel closer to the main Shinjuku station itself, which would either have been far more expensive, or provide less quality.This hotel is a great base from which to explore the Shinjuku/Harajuku/Shibuya area, and if you are looking to take external trips to and from Tokyo, most of which start from the Shinjuku transport hub. For example, the Keio railway line to Mount Takao can be taken from Shinjuku station and the expressway bus to Kawaguchiko can be boarded from Shinjuku Expressway Bus Terminal. Nishi-Shinjuku is also on the Marunouchi subway line and allows for easy access to the Ginza area. The hotel is also near a few convenience stores. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone searching for a value-for-money option near to Shinjuku station.

The location is good but this was the worst of the hotels we stayed at in Japan. The bathroom is tiny and dated compared to others and the the room was not overly big but that is to be expected. There was a smoking aroma in the room even though it was a none smoking room so assume it was coming from the ventilation. I didn’t like this at all

10 mins walls from Shinjuku train station. Very helpful staff. Felt very safe as a solo traveller. Rooms immaculate. Free Wi-fi, Women’s only floor too. This is such a great idea, it’s doesn’t seem to be widely advertised, but should. Floor 14

very comfortable bed, great location, near subway station, convenient store and restaurant. season's decoration is a pleasant surprise and warm. staff was friendly, lobby is comfortable. very clean and quiet.

We enjoyed our stay. We reserved 2 rooms, one small double and one single, right next to each other. We used their washing machines/dryers without problems. The double bed was actually quiet large and fit a plus size lady and medium sized man with room to spare. The beds and pillows are rather hard which was slightly uncomfortable for the lady but comfortable for the man. Housekeeping was good and polite and the toiletry selection adequate. We asked for extra pillows without problems. There is a 7-11 (open 24 hours), Lawson's (with a pharmacy) and McDonald's next door. It is about a 10 minute walk to Shinjuku Station and the subway stations are at similar distances. Safe, quiet, and convenient area. The cafe in the lobby and the izakaya in the basement were nice. English did not appear to be spoken very well by most in the hotel, cafe or izakaya but we never had any problems communicating. It was a treat to be greeted at the end of the day by greeters who smiled welcomingly and bowed deeply after pressing the elevator button for us. Although we did not interact with the staff much they always appeared pleasant and ready to help.

The hotel is right next to the metro/subway station (which is one stop away from the main Shinjuku station). It is next to several eating joints and convenience stores. Room is comfortable though very small even for one person, had a hard time opening suitcase. But I believe that is the case with most accommodations in Tokyo. The breakfast is basic but decent and located in a good coffee shop in the hotel. Hotel staff is polite and helpful. However, they do push a lot to pay for even a little time spent before or after check in time. This is the first time I have experienced this that even if the room is ready and it is 2:00 pm, you have to pay for one hour. I had flown in from long transits and just gave up and paid above what I had already paid to sleep for 2 hours. Same on check out which is 10am! You will be pushed to pay even if a few minutes late. Also, the staff while very polite and helpful struggled with English communication a bit. Overall, a decent and comfortable stay due to location, cleanliness and convenience.

Nice room and facilities. Lovely and helpful staff. I had a 'single' room but had queen sized bed. The room was a bit too small for my luggage but that's probably because I packed too much. Would be fine with a smaller suitcase. Tea and coffee and toiletries are available in the foyer.

We had a very comfort stay at the hotel, also during the typhoon. The staff was very kind. There is a litte coffee shop inside and you can also have japanese breakfast if you like. Wifi is very good and the rooms are small but cleaned up every day.

This is a business hotel in the centre of the Shinjuku area. It is 60m from a subway station (Nishishinjuku) and a 15 minute walk from the main Shinjuku JR station. The rooms are Tokyo small but comfortable and clean. There's very little space for storage but if you are passing through it suits its purpose. There is a breakfast room as well as a coffee shop in the lobby. vending machines, microwaves and laundrys are available of several floors.The position is great for walking into the craziness that is Shinjuku at night, but far enough away from it to have zero noise and disturbance.

We were using our JR rail pass so we got off at Shinjuku station from Osaka. We were lucky it wasn’t bucketing with rain because of the walk to the hotel. The bed was firm but the pillows were horrible. The shower over a small and deep bath had good pressure. The aircon was nice and cool but it seems to change in the middle of the night. There is a train station nearby but for a different rail line and we had to use our ICOCA card instead of the JR pass. I’m not likely to stay here again due to the location. It was too far from Shinjuku station.

Check in staff were lovely and polite. Floor 14 is woman only. It has a vending machine and washing machine rooms which requires keycard access. Floor 10 was quiet, non smoking and had a microwave, ice and vending machine room.A few doors down is a 7/11 which has an ATM (In the lobby of the hotel there is a do it yourself currency exchange machine but the rate was low and I found better rates elsewhere) a Can Do 100 yen shop and MacDonalds across the road if you’re desperate. Couple of minute walk to Nishishinjuku station on the Marunouchi line. About a 10-15 min walk to Shinjuku station West. This is also where airport limousine buses drop off/collect. You can go from Hilton which is a 5-10 min walk from the hotel but pick up times are less frequent. I arrived at Hilton but left from Shinjuku west station. Room was a shoe box, the smallest I’ve ever stayed in. Good for one person, I wouldn’t enjoy sharing. Mini fridge, kettle, small table and bench to sit at to eat. My room was spotlessly clean. One afternoon I even had a member of staff knock on my door to do a housekeeping inspection.Toiletries available from reception area, but not really very environmentally friendly. Lots of single use plastics. Shinjuku geonmae (Gardens) are nearby and nice to walk around to escape the hustle and bustle for a few hours. The government metropolitan building observation tower is within walking distance and has fantastic views of the city. The best thing is it’s free. On a clear day you can see Mt Fuji. Go just before or on sunset so you can see Tokyo both in day and night. Last entry was 10.30pm if I remember rightly. Closed weekends. Kabukicho (Red light district) is within walking distance, I was solo and didn’t find it intimidating to walk around at night. Omoide Yokocho (Memory Lane aka Piss Alley) is also close where 60 or so restaurants and bars are crammed into a few alleys.

I visted third in Shinjuku. The third of visit hotel, there was excellence. Service was very nice. Room condition was very good, and also cozy. I will reservation next visit in Tokyoit had good memory in Tokyo. Check out time so early but it;s OK

I stayed for 1 night only since I needed somewhere close in the area before my flight. The room was small but OK but a night, and everything was very clean, which for me it is the most important thing. The service was great, everyone was very kind and helpful.However, for such a humble place, I think the price is way too high. You feel you are paying for a high end hotel when it is really a very humble one.

My wife and i stayed in this hotel during the Rugby World Cup. 500m walk from the RWC Megastore in Shinjuku, 650m from Shinjuku Station and surrounded by great Japanese food joints and a BIG shopping mall with luxury brands and normal person shopping zones.Welcoming and polite staff. Room was small, but adequate and very user friendly and comfortable. A nice, spacious for the size of the hotel lobby and a coffee shop attached to the hotel. MacDonalds and 7-11 within 2 min walk.Really, a great find and very reasonably priced considering it's location.

I'll start with the positives: Great location, and very clean. Standard tiny room for Tokyo and very friendly and smiley staff however did not deliver the service required when it mattered.What really infuriated me was that I booked a room with double bed and for my friend a room with single bed. I paid 40% more for no reason at all as the rooms were identical. When challenged the staff was advised this is how it is in Japan - I booked for 2 people. I explained the website was misleading and I am travelling single occupant in the room with no much success. Anywhere else that respects itself (maybe not in Japan) I would have got a full refund of the 40%. At the end got to a compromise (which really should have not been the case in any service provider that respect itself) and got about half the difference back where it should have really been the whole amount I paid for no reason.

+ very kind staff+ clean room+ nice big bed (1,92 m no problem)+ clever lightsystem in the room+ free smartphone to lend+ nice bar in B1+air conditioning and minifridge are quietly+ no noise from outside- little cleaning issues in the bathroom- if someone is a little bit loud at the floor or the next room, you can hear it in your room well

My husband and I have just stayed here for five nights before taking an around Japan Princess cruise. We had not stayed in Tokyo before, so it was a new experience. The hotel is in a fabulous location, a five minute walk from Shinjuku station, and surrounded by lots of restaurants and bars. The twin room we had was small, to be expected for Japan, but is very efficiently designed so that you don't feel cramped at all. Very modern decor. The attention to detail is spot on, even the bathroom mirror has a coating in the middle so it doesn't fog up when showering. A stunning bonus is the complimentary smart phone with google maps, lists of attractions and restaurants, which you can take with you on sightseeing trips.There is a counter next to the lifts which has complimentary toiletries, shavers, combs etc. which I've never seen before, and is a lovely touch.. The desk staff are all extremely pleasant, especially Li, who solved a couple of problems for me. Nothing is too much trouble for them, and they are always smiling and welcoming.The coffee shop attachéd to the hotel is great for pastries, coffee and icecream. The Japanese restaurant downstairs is cheerful, with a very reasonably priced menu, and tasty food. There's a McDonalds across the road, and a Seven Eleven a few yards away.A tip: make sure you confirm the room type beforehand, as we did not receive the twin room requested by our travel agent, and had to change to another room the morning after arrival. We would highly recommend the Nishitetsu Inn as a great base for exploring Tokyo.

I have here many times. Super convenient, very clean, really helpful staff. Small rooms but enough for a short visit. A laundry with is also useful. And now they give you a mobile phone you can take out of the room and use while in Tokyo. A great idea. Definitely a good stay.

Hotel has a lot of great stuff nearby (7/11 practical next door, McDonald across the street, Yoshinova a short walk and a bunch of restaurants and cafes).Easy access to the main Shinjuku station (short walk) or Nishi-Shinjuku which is practically next door.Room was great (although may be smaller than you expect) being opposite a main police station you will hear sirens but they didn't affect my sleep etc.Staff are friendly and happy to help.

It was a professional trip to Tokyo, as far as I am concerned the hotel was almost perfect to my purpose. Very well located, quiet and clean.The only concern I would have is about the room left for the baggages with is too small...

Best thing about this hotel: they provide you with a phone in your room that you can use during the duration of your stay. Has google maps. Really saved me when my sim card wasn't working for the first day. Fantastic amenity. The rooms were really clean. A bit small, but like that's how rooms are in big cities so what're you gonna do about it. Great location in central Shinjuku, easy to find and close to Shinjuku station. Very friendly staff, quiet rooms. Strong wifi. Strong AC.

I've stayed at this hotel two times now and have had a great experience each time. Great looking and clean rooms; close to major transportation hub (Shinjuku station) and shopping areas; good price; and friendly staff. I highly recommend this hotel and would most likely try to book here again on my next trip to Tokyo!

The hotel room was small (commonplace in Tokyo) but well formed: no space was wasted and all amenities were covered. There were even slippers and dressing gowns and toiletries: we appreciate that additional toiletries were available to take at reception as required. We particularly loved the cafe on site for coffees and snacks.The only reason I’d mark this down to 4 stars is the lack of choice at breakfast - breakfast was of good quality but sometimes meat was left out and was luke warm on serving which worried me. The food was all Japanese fayre which I didn’t mind but westerners staying should be aware of.

We went to Tokyo for ten days. We stayed in Shinjuku as we thought it was convenient to go to places. We searched Agoda and found this hotel. The location (Nishi Shinjuku) is perfect (a bit away from the hustle and bustle). It’s a five-minute walk from the Hilton hotel, which is one of the limousine bus stops to and from Narita airport. It took us ten minutes to walk to Kabukicho or the Shinjuku station West exit. The price was reasonable (¥15666/night). It’s only about four-minute walk to the Marunouchi subway station. The staff were super friendly, helpful and polite. Most of them spoke English. We tried the Japanese breakfast at the basement of the hotel (¥1080/person), but it was so so. Fortunately, there are many cafes (Doutor coffee, Paul Bassett, the 3rd Burger, Cafe Veloce, Tully’s Coffee) for breakfast near the hotel. For convenience stores, there are Family Mart, Lawson, 7-11 and Can Do (100 yen store) within walking distance. The size of the double room wasn’t spacious. There was no room for us to open the suitcases, but the room was clean and neat. What we liked about the bathroom was that there was a bathtub, and we could have bubble bath every night. The housekeeping services were excellent. We returned to the room with everything nicely arranged. The hotel also offers the use of a Handy phone outside of the hotel. There are coin laundries, vending machines, microwave ovens on different floors. There is a corner with free toiletry items by the elevators for the hotel guests. The check out time is 10am. In general, we had a pleasant stay at the hotel.

We had 5 nights here and we loved this hotel. Fabulous location: a 1 minute walk to Nishi-Shinjuku-Ku subway station or 8 minute walk to heart of the action. The breakfast is a Japanese buffet on the basement level and it was tasty, had variety, and is open good hours for early birds like us from 7 am . There is a cafe next to the lobby. Our room on Level 10 was incredibly quiet. We started to think we were the only guests until breakfast. We went for a twin bed room...double beds are too small for 2 western people to get a decent sleep. Reception couldn’t do enough for us and they always had plenty of staff at the desk. Fast good lift. Money exchange in the Lobby. Toiletries also in lobby help yourself service with cotton buds, Facial lotion, comb etc . Shower and tub in a modular type bathroom complete with tub. Nice shampoo and conditioner and lovely scented body wash. There is a Table and chairs in the room. Very tiny room like all in this city warning don’t bring a clamshell type suitcase. We travel with a small bag and a backpack each and we were fine for space in the room. We would definitely return to this hotel.

I was really pleased with the location of the hotel and think compared to the bigger hotels it was very good value. The rooms are small and compact. Was good that there was a convenience store next door and also McDonalds across the road. About a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku main station. Staff friendly and helpful with directions. Would definitely recommend for a stay in Tokyo.

+have all amenities needed+clean room+near metro station/ walking distance to Shinjuku sjopping area+fast response when replying email+have convenient stores nearby (7-11/ family mart)-tiny size room but standard sizein Tokyo

Good location near the metro station and not far from Shinjuku downtown, so sometimes you also can take a walk.I like the small desk in the room because it’s comfortable to use a computer.Next time I would like to this hotel again.

We stayed here for three nights. Hotel is functional, quiet and used a lot by business people. Reception are friendly and welcoming. You have to collect your bathroom products from the reception area when you run out. Fruit teabags are also available from the reception area free of charge. Rooms are small but functional. There is a good coffee shop at the entrance to the hotel which is worth visiting for a morning pastry. It is about a 15 minute walk into Shinjuku. The area is quiet as it is in a business area. There is a MCDonalds across the road if you do not feel like a walk into Shinjuku. Good hotel for a quick stay.

I stayed in the Nishitetsu with my brother for 3 nights after a 2 week Hakuba snowboarding trip. We walked from Shinjuku station with snowboarding kit and luggage, but learned from this mistake and got a taxi on the return trip. Location is good as it is close to all of the shopping and restaurants in Shinjuku, and only a 10 minute walk to the train station.Room was average size for this budget in Shinjuku, and bathroom was good too. Staff at check-in were very efficient, but their counterparts in the breakfast restaurant were not as good. Breakfast itself was very disappointing, as the variety for a hotel of this size was very limited plus the aforementioned staff.In short, considering the rate we paid for this hotel, it presented very good value for money and the location is also a positive.

Located a 5 minute walk from the Shinjuku train station and the local night life, this hotel is in a great spot. It’s on a main road with metro stops en route and is also close to the Metropolitan Centre with the great views. We researched a ton before deciding to stay in Shinjuku and in the end, it was definitely the right choice. The neighbourhood is casual and fun with as much going on as you want. As for the hotel, we arrived before check in time but they happily held our bags until later. The room was plenty big enough for us and our bags, plus it was super quiet, even in our room across from the elevator. When we requested a late checkout, the staff person explained that we could join the rewards club and get late checks for free - so we did! We had a great stay and totally recommend this hotel.

I stayed 5 nights in this awesome hotel. rooms: size was okay for Tokio. all amenities are provided, even different types of Lipton teas. there is a possibility for ironing, washing machines with detergents, and microwaves.great location: 10 min to the Shinjuku station, 2 min to Nishi Shinjuku Metro, 15 min to gorilla.so I liked it that it was not so loud but central at the same time.The reception team is very very great, my emails before were answered very fast, I could send my luggage earlier and order from amazon as well. English skills were also above average.breakfast: I had Japanese breakfast in the izakaya downstairs. it would have been great if Japanese and western breakfast were both possible. downstairs is also a great Izakaya with a beer flatmate and great food, where you can order by tablet.

Very comfortable hotel. Room configuration and size was good. Very tasty restaurant in the B1 level for evening meal and also tasty breakfast. NIce coffee shop at Level 1.The only thing that I would improive is the pillows they were hard and no variety.

Great hotel close to metro station which was perfect for getting to Tokyo station to catch the bullet train.The room was small and clean . Staff were friendly and helpful. Check in was quick. There is a coffee shop on site which was handy for breakfast.

Service impressed me, and furnitures are really convinient. It would be perfect if the two-bed room size became a little bit bigger. Anyway, it is much worthy the price and I still recommend this hotel.

A convenient location with a subway station nearby and the Shinjuku station is at walking distance. The room is very clean. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The floor of the basement where breakfast is served needs a good cleaning.

I stayed here from April 28 to May 4 of 2019.Then room is very clean and nice. Don't expect a lot of space in the room though, it's typical of western hotel. It is about 11 minutes walk to Shinjuku station. And it is about 18 minutes walk to the Shinjuku Bus Terminal. The hotel offers a free to use android cell phone. It is very useful to get around with since it has data connection. It also has free international calling to certain countries. This is quite good surprise for me.There is a 7-11 right next door to the hotel as well. I visited the 7-11 everyday just to try different snacks. The bed is firm, not saggy at all so I got good sleep every night.I would stay here again if I visit Tokyo in the future.

The twin room was adequately large for Tokyo. There was a bath tub and humidifier. The hotel gives awesome free tea bags and toiletries including facial lotions, face towel etc.The location is 2 mi walk from the M line nishi shinjuku stn and 10 mins from the main shinjuku stn. The Yaitori Alley is a short walk away.

This was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. While the rooms are the usual small size as usual in Japan and Asia, there's a lot of detail you notice in the rooms thanks to the Japanese attention to detail and care. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again myself.Room: Corporate marketing photos are accurate. Small room but laid out well. Twin size bed, desk and mini fridge in the room. TV is only Japanese channels. The windows face next door buildings so there's nothing to look at. Air conditioning fan worked and wasn't loud.Amenities: Wifi was a stable 64Mbps. Only amenities in the bathroom are toothbrush, shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Additional grooming amenities are available in the lobby and laid out for guests to take as they need. Maps of Tokyo, Shinjuku and other popular neighbourhoods are also in the lobby. No bottled water is supplied in the room unless you choose the eco choice and not refresh your linen, but the tap water in the bathroom is clean and drinkable.Vending machines, free ice machines, free to use microwaves and self serve coin laundry are all available in the hotel. The floors they're on are listed on the map in the elevators. Elevators are quick to arrive. The doors for each room close gently and without much noise unlike most hotels. I rarely heard any other guests on my floor due to this.Location: Several train stations nearby (Nishi-Shinjuku, Shinjuku and Tochomae) which makes it easy to get to anywhere in Tokyo. Not much to eat in the immediate area. You can walk 10-15 minutes towards Shinjuku for restaurants and shopping. McDonald's and 7-Eleven are nearby and where I picked up a lot of drinks.There's a cafe on the ground floor unrelated to the hotel. Coffee and food isn't that good here but it seems to be popular with locals. I just got breakfast at McDonald's, 7-Eleven or the convenience/sandwich store by Nishi-Shinjuku station.Service: Staff don't speak much English but try to help. Not much communication is needed during check in and check out.

If you are looking for a mid range hotel in Shinjuku look no further. We chose the hotel based on a location requirement as well as internet hotel info. Close to everything transport and dining wise, we found the room slightly smaller than previous hotels and the bathroom was of course the standard very compact arrangement. Clean with nice bathroom extras, the only drawbacks, no wallhooks to hang articles and no English speaking tv channel at all

Nice standard hotel, good central location in Shinjuku but on the quieter western side of the station. Upon arrival at station can be a bit confusing how to find the right exit and get to the hotel without having to take luggage up and down multiple pedestrian overpasses. Staff are friendly, hotel has a nice coffee shop in the lobby that's great for coffee and a pastry for breakfast before heading out. Rooms and bathrooms are quite small, but fairly average by Japanese standards for a mid-range hotel. Rooms are clean, comfortable with windows that open. Most rooms face the side not the main road so they are not too noisy. Each room provides a free mobile phone with data for use during your stay, which is a great convenience!

This hotel is located centrally in Shinjuku and is very near the subway so it’s really convenient to get around. To get to the hotel from the airport, you could take the airport limousine bus and get off at the Tokyo Hilton, which is about a 200m walk away or so. There are convenient stores and eateries all within walking distance so we opted not to take their breakfast. The hotel room itself is small (which is to be expected in central Tokyo) but its Ok for a solo traveler or a couple. The toilet door could be better placed, but otherwise it’s alright. You even get an air humidifier in the room too, which is nice! There are water and ice dispensers, vending machines and even coin-operated washers and dryers on selected floors, so it’s really convenient. The TV channels only have Japanese programs though. Would definitely return!

Me, my husband and 4 friends stayed here for 6 nights, and we all had a great stay! The hotel is in a great location, about 10 mins walk from Shinjuku station and the busy streets so it's very quiet. There's plenty of shops and restaurants nearby still. The staff are really helpful and friendly.Rooms are small but there was enough room for our 2 suitcases, and are spotlessly clean. Sheets and towels are changed everyday which I personally think is a bit excessive but if you left the do not disturb on they wouldn't be changed! The bed was very comfy, and although we booked a small double we didn't find it small at all. Again the bathroom was small (all hotel rooms in Japan are small anyway) but really clean, with a great shower and small but deep bath. There's plenty of soap and shampoo available to use too, 2 towels plus dressing gowns to use. There's no breakfast included but attached to the hotel is a fab café, perfect for croissants and coffee. We all agreed this hotel was a great find, and would absolutely stay here again when we come back to Tokyo.

Nishitetsu Inn is in a perfect position. 5 minutes walk from the station and the bustling tourist area. It is quiet. The rooms were clean and the desk staff most helpful. Only some spoke English. I stayed by my self and the room was large by Japanese standards. I suggest if there are 2 of you that you book a double room.

Not an ideal location as you have to drag your luggage up and down staircases to get to the inn. Although it is quite near Shinjuku station the walk with luggages makes it feel extremely long. Unfriendly reception who tries to do the minimum, below expectations for Japan. Breakfast spread was pathetic. I totally regretted staying here. I booked another hotel in Gotanda during the earlier part of my trip. The location , service and hotel room was way better at a competitive price. You have been warned. Take your money elsewhere!

This was the second time I stayed here,and whenever I will return to Tokyo, I will stay here again. The location is perfect, its quiet yet busy Shinjuku is just 10 minutes away. There is a metro stop just across the steeet.The rooms are quiet small, but wirh everything that you need. I think irs great value for money.

This is our 3rd time coming back to Nishitetsu Inn..all remain great except that we'd a not too pleasant service at the recept...we'd rental a car and supposed to return the ETC card in a local courier service envelop with advise that the hotel could help us with the delivery service (we did that before at Hilton), but we were rejected by the recept and has to find our way thru for the post office..not big deal but I thought it's just an additional service that the hotel could provide..Thank you.P/S: should give a try for pistachio latte at St. Marc...:)

Modern, clean function hotel, close to transport links and shops. Friendly helpful staff, very high speed Internet, which is free. Coffee shop in the lobby. Comfortable beds, free toiletries, wide selection of teas also complimentary.

The Nishitetsu in is about a 15 minute walk from Shinjuku station. The hotel is clean with everything you need including your power points and usb ports. Just be aware that there are no three-prong charge ports in the room so ensure you have a 2 prong adapter if you need to charge something other than your phone. The staff were super helpful and there is a washing room here too if you're staying for a longer period of time (like we were).Location: Even though it's a 15 minute walk from the station and on a main road it's relatively quiet around the hotel. A 5 minute walk down the main road though and you're in the heart of Shinjuku. If nothing else choose this hotel for it's location!Room: The room's are relatively small so be prepared that it will be cosy if there's 2 of you with 2 large suitcases. The room has everything you need though including a bath, slippers and a clothes brush. If you're travelling with friends rather than your partner I would recommend booking separate rooms (I was travelling with my mum and was grateful we did this).

The reception staffs were super nice and helpful, we have to catch an early flight back home, and he printed out the train schedule with the exact platform number (location) for us. Very convenient location, walkable distance to downtown shinjuku. The only downside is room too small which is very common in Tokyo.

Good location. Well positioned for the Tokyo Subway system. Staff very friendly, they speak little English but are very helpful. Rooms are small but functional and you have everything you need. If you are staying here and need Google Maps, the hotel provide a very handy mobile handset free! There is a handy 7-11 a few metres away from the hotel where you can buy hot coffee, hot meals, snacks etc if you need to keep your costs down. You can catch the limo bus from the airport to the Tokyo Hilton stop, it’s literally 5 minutes walk from there.

This hotel is reachable by walking from the Shinjuku Station for about 15min walk or from the Nishi-Shinjuku Station, which is just opposite the hotel. This location is also walk-able to Kabukicho with abundance of shops and restaurants. The hotel is quite good and we enjoyed our stay. There is also a handset in the room for guest to bring out for navigation.

Rooms were a little small, however we were hardly in them as we were always out and about. Very clean and the staff were friendly. There was a mobile in the room that we could take out with us and that helped us use the maps and also gave great recommendations for food, bars and things to do. The location was perfect we could walk to most places and wasn’t a far walk to Shinjuku station :)

Fast check in operations.Clean room but a bit tiny.Great location near metro station.Really recommended. District full of attraction near shinjuko station. Near there you can find shops, atm. Near the hotel’s lobby there’s a nice cafe where you can have breakfast and you don’t need to go out of the building.

Located just 10mins from Shinjuku Station, this 3* hotel was pretty impressive. Newly renovated, clean and surprisingly spacious for a local hotel in this part of Shinjuku. There’s a cafe on the ground level. Quiet area which is perfect for a light sleeper. Service was fabulous too!

We had the pleasure of staying here during our stay in Tokyo. I booked us a semi double room and as we got closer to our visit I started to get nervous that the room I booked would be too small. It was small, but very efficient and comfortable. We found that the bed was big enough for the two of us, and we are not small people! It is more like the size of a double bed. The location was perfect as it was just a short walk to the craziness of Shinjuku but far enough away that it was quiet, and it was across the street from a metro station. The staff was very helpful and the smartphone the hotel provides to help with local calls and maps was above and beyond. Great hotel!!

sandy t
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here whilst travelling on Tokyo with family - it’s a good basic hotel in a good location. Staff had reasonable English and were happy to help with whatever we needed. Note there is no restaurant (so no breakfast) but there is a simple cafe downstairs that does the job in the morning with coffee and pastries etc

Great location for stay in Shinjuku and visit Tokyo. 10 minutes walk to Shinjuku station and 2 minutes to Nishi-Shinjuku subway station. Very good service, kind staff beautiful and clean rooms. I repeat for sure...

Comfortable and clean hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Hotel near the metro and train station. Comfortable and clean rooms. Good sleep quality. Comfortable bed and pillows. Near a cafe and shop. I liked everything very much. Back again to this hotel.

Stayed for two weeks, couldn't ask for a better location, close to everything but away from the hustle and bustle. Very friendly staff, rooms were very clean. The positives, the laundry room for sure. Only packed half a suitcase as they have a laundry, saved the luggage space for shopping. USB ports in the room, plenty of plugs, nice big tub to soak in. If you smoke there is an ash tray in the room. Bring a washcloth with you though, each day you get a towel, hand towel, toothbrush and paste, slippers etc, but no washcloth. Only complaint had nothing to do with the hotel, on Saturday and Sunday a van drove around the block blasting out music and the sound of someone shouting, really obnoxious. Started at 7.30am on the Saturday, just drove around in a circle for a couple of hours. As mentioned, 7-11 and Family Mart right by the hotel. Highly recommend staying here, helped make my trip to Tokyo a memorable one.

This Hotel is located near Shinjuku Station and nearby attractions can be quickly reached by walk.Subway is at 100 meters. Front office service was perfect and efficientRooms are small but clean and with some useful space-saving furniture.There is a vending machine and microwave oven on almost every floor for personal use.A very good choice both for business or leisure.

Great location, just few mins walk from the JR Shinjuku-Ku station. Two convenient stores nearby open until late. Room was nice and clean and staff very polite. In this hotel you’ll be provided with toiletries so you don’t need to bring anything from home. I definitely would recommend it.

Superb location, near to a subway, quiet at night but still close enough to the buzz of Shinjuku. Near to loads of different restaurants. Clean comfortable room, really good value for money and excellent amenities provided. Wifi in the room plus the handy phone provided are excellent additions. We won't be seeking any different hotel on our next stay to Tokyo!
