London, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is very well located, has all the facilities and the stuff is amazing (they speak english). We stayed one week and we felt very comfortable. 2 min from the metro station, many restaurants close and the room was perfect (maybe a little small if you have big luggages) but you can fit anyway.

We were very happy with our 7 night stay. The room was scrupulously clean, and had everything you could possibly need. It is situated close to a subway station with lots of eating opportunities.We did find the beds and pillows hard, but this is just a personal preference.We were very happy to find a coin operated laundry in the hotel which worked very efficiently.

Stayed for a week and enjoyed it. Overall, a very well situated, well-run, middle of the range, chain hotel with good facilities. It has the chance to be a lot better with only a few, easy tweaks.... Easy to find opposite Mcdonalds just past the Sompo Japan building (I called it "The Atari Skyscraper"- see if you agree!) near Shinjuku Station.Pleasing, clean hotel with sparkling lobby. A good coffee shop on your left just inside! Cheerful reception if a little limited in their powers. Any requests above simple are referred up the food chain...Rooms a reasonable size for Tokyo. I have had much worse in London and Bristol. Good air con and facilities, including a laundry, ice machines and microwaves. "Women only" 14th floor. En suite great. Rooms and bedding spotless except for the odd, strangely habitual blind spots. (See pics).. superb position for everything. I would make a point of returning.

This is a great little hotel, right in amongst all the action in shinjuku. The staff is always very helpful, and some can speak reasonably good English.The rooms, although small by Australian standards, are considered larger than most for an hotel of this size, and they are very reasonably priced. There is a table and comfortable seat by the window, with a good view. The bed is a double even for a single room, but not much room to move around in for the average sized European person. The bathroom was clean and spacious enough, and not too pokey. The toilet was one of those complicated Japanese affairs, with all sorts of buttons and tricks. The instructions are in Japanese, but easy to use once you`ve worked it out. Just a word of advice though ....bring your own loo paper!There is a very nice coffee shop on the ground floor, called `Marks Coffee Shop, where you can also have breakfast and snacks. You have to have a bit of a sweet tooth though, as most of the food consists of sweet pastries and creamy things. There are sandwiches available, but they go quickly, and not often available. You also have to get in fairly early, as a lot of young people grab the tables and set up shop there with their computers for hours on end. However there are lots of eateries and restaurants close by to choose from.I can certainly recommend this hotel, and will be staying there again when next I go to Tokyo.

Location of the hotel is great for exploring Shinjuku and it isn't far from the main Shinjuku Station. The metro station is also very close. Room was clean and comfortable, and there is a cafe on the ground floor. There is also a bus called the Airport Limousine for Haneda and Narita airports which stops at the Hilton Hotel just a couple of minutes walk away from this hotel.

Great location for subways. Lots of eateries around. WiFi was strong and fast. Rooms were small as expected. There’s a coffee shop in the hotel and served nice coffee and breakfast pastries. No problems with English speaking staff.

The rooms were smaller than we expected but what really did not like was the cigarette smell in our floor. As australian we are not use to this smell where we sleep. My wife was having early pregnancy nauceas and found difficult to deal with it. Otherwise, it was clean and well located.

Situated very conveniently just across the road from the Nishi-Shinjuku stationa and a short walk to the heart of Shinjuku, the main advantage of this hotel is its location. My room was modern and very comfortable. My main complain was with the front desk personnel. Not unfriendly and willing to help but I feel that anyone on the front desk needs a good grasp on the English language and if not, a client should be directed to staff who can speak English. One guy I spoke to (I think he was half Indian or something) barely spoke English and what he was saying was gibberish. I asked him for info on train passes and he gave me a map to the train station. Every staff member I would have thought should know everything about the transport system. Very disappointing.

The location is excellent. Close to Metro and main lines. Lots of options for shopping and eating in the area. Room is clean and excellently equipped but small. Make sure you don’t throw your bags about the room and you should be fine. Staff are friendly and will help with making bookings.

After our initial shock at the lack of space in the rooms, we soon began to appreciate the friendliness of the staff and their willingness to help, and then the convenience of the hotel's location. A 2-minute walk gives you access to the Shinjuku station (from Nishi-Shinjuku station, on the Maranouchi Line), from where you can access a host of other subway lines to take you around Tokyo, the JR Yamanote line, other JR line services, and the delights of Shinjuku itself, especially at night. Not being able to cope with the basement restaurant's breakfast menu, we managed to persuade the hotel and restaurant staff to swap our breakfast vouchers with vouchers for the on-site coffee bar/cafe, where we were able to satisfy our more Western taste buds. There are so many good quality sushi and other Japanese restaurants in Tokyo, even just in Shinjuku, so we ate well throughout our 5-day stay. We highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again on any return visit to Tokyo.

Compact room with excellent facilities - comfortable beds and provision of table and chairs which was a bonus for us. Reception staff were polite and helpful - location is excellent with shops and restaurants close by - including a 7/11 and 100 yen shop!Metro station M7 was a very short walk away with Shinjuku Station a little further.Thoroughly recommend for a short visit. Only downside was that the view from the window was the building (close) next door - however this wasn't a problem for us.

I booked 2 nights here - arrival from USA to rest up before climbing Mt Fuji. Ended up booking 3 more nights and then 2 more before returning to USA. NICE beds. Super clean. The coin laundry on the 7th floor was spotless and perfect for traveling with less clothes. Great location for people watching. Decent pricing , definitely felt like I got my $ worth. Only drawback was no TV service w/o paying $10 per 24 hours. Didn't bother me, too much to see and do to watch TV anyway. Free Wifi was fast enough. Far enough from the Shinjuku nightlife to really relax, yet walking 10 mins gets you into the heart of party city.

The Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku is a good mid-tier choice if you want to be in lively Shinjuku. The location is pretty good. Its about a 15 walk from Shinjuku Station, but it is pretty close to Nishi-Shinjuku subway station. Nearby are convenience stores, shopping, cafes including Starbucks across the street (underground), and McDonald's across the street for when you need a break from Japanese cuisine. Checking in was extremely easy, even though I showed up late at night. The front staff is efficient and speaks several foreign languages. I saw many foreign guests, so it seems the hotel is proficient at serving them. Yes, like many hotels in this range in Tokyo, the single room I had was pretty small. However, it was clean and had everything needed for a short stay. It may be a bit challenging if you have a big suitcase. The bed itself was comfortable enough. There was a small fridge, small desk, and small TV. The free Wifi was pretty good, and the AC worked fine. There is no closet, which I found to be a minor hassle. The bathroom is also not spacious, which is on par for most Japanese hotels. However, it is (perhaps just barely) manageable, and the Shiseido bath products were fine. You can hear a little outside noise from the room, but it was never a problem for me in my stay. Checking out was super speedy and hassle free... possibly the fastest hotel check out I've ever experienced haha. Just turned in the room key and I was done. In the end, this is a good choice for this price range, especially for short stays. I may return for weekend trips to Tokyo. Thanks for a nice stay! =)

I stayed here last year, and it is consistently good. You can either take the 15 minute stroll up from Shinjuku main station, or take the Tokyo metro to Nishi Shinjuku Station (with escalator) where it is 2 minutes away. Check in is quick, and there are plenty of free toiletries and amenities in the foyer, as well as maps and pamphlets for sights.The rooms are compact but well-designed. There is a small sofa that (just) fits two as well as a table. There is a fridge, kettle, green tea, flat screen TV and a "Handy" if you want to take this free mobile around town for navigation (and free calls to some other Asian countries but not Europe!)Great location, lots of local stores and eateries, and a good bed with peace and quiet. My second stay was just as good as the first!

There's something when you walk into the hotel and know you're going to love it.After a long flight and getting lost in the train station, the hotel was a sight for sore eyes.From the counter service from a middle aged gentlemen (sorry didn't get your name), to the housekeeping maids and the St Marc cafe cashier. Everyone was so polite and professional.The rooms are a tad bit small for 2 people but very clean and high tech (they even have dimmers!). More than enough power sockets for your gadgets. The room has a humidifier, solid AC, a bath tub, kettle and minibar. Only thing I would recommend is an in room safe.I only stayed 1 night with a friend but due to it's proximity to Shinjuku station and a 7 eleven next door, I would recommend anyone staying from 1 - 7 days to stay here!

We stayed here 7 nights and 8 days. The location, Shinjuku is great! It is close to the metro, nightlife, many other tourist sites, restaurants and convenience stores. The room itself was quite small, but this was expected and we were out all day and evening anyhow. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly. The cafe downstairs is great for breakfast! I would definitely recommend this hotel!

It's a small room hotel room but have everything we needed. It's only 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku West station. It's in the heart of Shinjuku and tons of restaurant to choose from. Only one station away from Shibuya.

Near Shinjuku west, need 10 to 15 mins walk to central Shinjuku. However, restaurant and convenience store nearby. Price is reasonable for new renovated hotel. Staff are so far pleasant. Car park is not exactly near the front door of hotel, not able to unloaded the luggage direct to check in door but 1-2 mins walk. Could be a bit difficult for large luggage on rainy days. The best is they offer free smartphone for guest during their stays with free local calls and international calls. Got laundry services with fees with detergent available automatically.

I have never meet a international hotel which is check out at 10:00 in the morning. otherwise you should pay 2500 yuan/hour. I asked the manager who told me this hotel is not an international hotel, but a local motel.

Stayed for 5 nights. Small but clean rooms. We had a BIG bag (instead of suitcase) and the only place to put it was on the table. The closet has enough hangers but it would be good to have drawers as well.The location is perfect, just a few minutes walk to Shinjuku Station. 7-eleven and other convenient stores very close. McDonalds across the street.The pillows were very hard. You can change it (they have a pillow menu...) but never got around doing it. They have a kind of smart phone you can take with you which has free WiFi. As we had portable router we didn’t need it but great service!

The location here is brilliant, a few metres from Nishi Shinjuku station, one stop from the mega hub station Shinjuku. It’s a hub to everywhere including the Narita express train from the Airport.The walk to Shinjuku shopping is literally 500m.Numerous restaurants, convenience stores and services at the doorstep.We found this location perfect to get to Shibuya and Harajuku as well as direct access across to the Tokyo station to catch the Shinkansen to Kyoto. The Hotel itself has many extremely helpful staff and is the perfect example of the Japanese ability to optimise space. We had a room advertised as “small double bed”. We were worried yet booked because of the location. The room was great, compact yet brilliantly designed and perfectly functional at an amazing price for Tokyo.The room was spotlessly clean and fastidiously maintained as was the entire Hotel.

Clean, comfortable rooms. Very near Metro station. 15 min walk to Shinjuku Station. Great location! Lots of good restaurants around. Helpful staff and the let us leave our luggage for a few days when we went to Kyoto.

The hotel location was fantastic. The staff was very friendly and most spoke english. Good facilities with a very convenient room with vending machines, laundry machines and microwave. The wifi was also very fast. Can't recommend the hotel enough for its price. Have I mentioned how good the location is?The few downsides are that most rooms don't have much of a view as they are facing side streets with other big buildings just a few meters away. Also the room isn't huge, but its space is more than enough for a comfortable stay. But I guess those two very minor gripes must be common place for Tokyo.

Very helpful and welcoming staff, great location with a metro stop and good restaurants nearby, clean and quiet room and we even got a free smartphone with internet to use out on the town during our stay

Walking around 10 minutes to Central of Shinjuku. Very helpful staff, the room is clean and neat. There are many mini marts located near by the hotel. In case that you have a big luggage it would be better if you get off from the sub-way and take a taxi to hotel.

During my travels in Tokyo, I stayed at Nishitetsu Inn. The hotel staff were hospitable, kind and helpful. The breakfast (Japanese Buffet) was ample. The rooms were clean and tidy and room service was great. The location of the hotel was perfect as It was only a short walk to Shinjuku station. I would definitely stay again at Nishitetsu Inn in future if in Tokyo. Highly Recommended.

We stayed for three nights as part of our honeymoon. The room was small but functional. The toilet had some black mould around the edges which was not so appealing but otherwise clean. The bath was nice and deep and perfect after a day out on your feet. It is almost directly across the road from the Subway and within walking distance to Shinjuku station and everything to offer in the area including the Govt towers (well worth it for the views!) We walked to Harajuku, Yoyogi and Shibuya from the hotel too without too much issues and the assistance of google maps. The hotel also provides a free phone which was useful to use maps and such. Smoking room is more of a smoking cupboard but overall great stay.

We stayed in this hotel for about 5 nights April 29 to may 5, 2018. We went to the restaurant in the basement of this hotel. They seated us at the bar and brought a I pad for our order. Since we do not eat meat we ordered two vegetarian dishes. We were surprised to see the bar in front of us filled with dishes we did not order. Since I was hungry and still waiting for our order I ate the yogurt dish. In the meantime the manager came and my wife told her that we did not order these dishes. Very rudely she said eat. We said we cannot eat it for we did not order it. She kept on saying eat it. I asked her for the bill and it was $45. I paid and went to the front desk to complain. After listening to us he came down and asked the woman at the counter. She said we ordered and so we had to pay. The clerk sided with the manager. It is the worst experience I have ever had. Do not ever go to this hotel. They are thieves.

During my business I spent the weekend there which is quite close located to downtown Tokyo like Shibuya or Harajuku.Several coffee shops are close by and to Shinjuku station it’s less then 10 minutes of walk. Bed and pillow are fine to sleep, did not find it noisy but my room was also opposite of the street - maybe good to mention this while booking. I would recommend that hotel for next trip.

The place is very tidy and clean. The staffs were very cordial and accommodating. You can bring out the service cellphone in the room and use it to call your companions staying in the same hotel as well as utilize its google map. The place is very strategic and very accessible to many major destinations in Shinjuku like the Shinjuku Station, Odakyu, Takashimaya, TokyuHands, Isetan. Tokyo Metro NishiShinjuku Station (marunouchi line) is very near. There is a Family Mart , Seven Eleven, Yoshinoya , Ipuddo just nearby.

Everything was good. The location was near the day tour gathering point and 10 mins away from Shinjuku Station. Macdonald was just opposite and there is a 7-11 downstairs. Only if the room was slightly bigger, it will be perfect.

Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku is 5 minutes walking distance to Shinjuku west exit, about 10-12 Minutes to JR southern exit. there are several convenience stores near by and a variety choice of restaurant in walking distance. The clerk is very helpful. room is nicely designed. everything make sense. unlike lots of other hotels in shinjuku's that I've been to. This one got enough space for one person without sacrifices. A high CP staying experience.

Great location, clean and comfortable rooms, very helpful staff. Enjoyed my stay and recommend highly. Take a limo bus from Narita airport to Hilton Hotel. Nishitetsu Inn is 6 min walking distance away from Hilton.

The Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku is conveniently located to Metro station, restaurants, and a park. The room was very clean and provided everything we needed for our 4 night stay in Tokyo. It was a small room, but we didn't spend that much time in our room so that wasn't a problem. The front desk staff were extremely helpful in providing maps, instructions, etc. They also helped us make reservations for bus transportation to the Narita Airport from the nearby Hilton Hotel. This hotel is reasonably priced, very clean, and in a great location. We felt safe walking in the nearby area any time of day or night. This was our first time in Tokyo. There is a 24-hr Denny's Restaurant nearby which came in handy when we needed to eat breakfast early. It is popular with young people and office workers.

Overall satisfied with my stay. It’s a good location very close to (3 min) Nishi-Shinjuku, (10 min) main Shinjuku station, and to the touristic areas of Shinjuku. Hotel was clean and staff was friendly but nothing special. Standard hotel by Japanese standards. No breakfast included but there is a basic cafe on site and a dinner (Japanese style) restaurant in the basement floor. The laundry machines are convenient and came in handy after a week of travel. Washer is 200 Yen per load and Dryer is 100 Yen for 30 min. There are plenty of vending machines including alcohol selections.

For the Japanese standards, the room was quite big, with all comforts (shampoo, soap, tooth brush and everything you need for tea). The hotel is close to the Marunouchi Metro station and 5 minutes walk from the Shinjuku station; there are a lot of restaurants and clubs nearby .

Very convenient location and clean. Close enough to walk to Shinjuku station and surrounds, making it easy to explore Tokyo via the subway. (We purchased the 72 hour subway pass and was worth it). Lots of good food options close by. Hotel rooms were quiet and beds were comfortable. would stay here again.

Loved the hotel, location and neighbourhood. 10 mins walk to JR Shinjuku station and Kabukicho, Golden Gai, etc. Hotel is just far enough away to be quiet and calm. McDonalds just across the Rd if you really need it. 10 Mins walk from Kieo Plaza Hotel where many tours depart from.Staff were accommodating and helpful, though little english is spoken.

Nishitetsu Inn is a very good hotel! Clean, efficient and there is all that we need.Reception open 24 hours and a good cafè at the lobby for breakfast.The room is little larger for Tokyo standards.I’ll come back if come to Tokyo

Staff speaks english. Room is clean and comfortable. There is a laundry room (wash = ¥200 & dryer =¥100 for 30 mins) and ice machineThere is a St Marc Cafe at lobby. Mac is across the street and other local eateries especially behind the hotel. Ask the hotel for a map. Convenience stores and other cafes around. About 1km walk to Shinjuku main station but to the right of the hotel is M07 subway (50m away)Hotel provides a phone for your use (supposedly can be used for international call). We didn't use it. There is a selection of simple toiletries at lobby next to lift.

I spent six nights at the Nishitetsu Inn. Perfectly located for Shinjuku, Kabukicho and transportation, both local and long distance. A few minutes walk from Shinjuku station, the busiest station in the world. There are hundreds of dining options in Shinjuku and the night life of Kabukicho--everything you can think of is here. In the Skyscraper District, so a lot of business people use this hotel when in Tokyo for work/conferences. The 14th floor is reserved for female guests only. Nicely appointed rooms with lots of power points, USB, LAN, built-in alarm clock, 40" TV, even free use of a cell phone which you can take with you on your travels around town--great for Google maps--small fridge and tea making facilities, laundry room and vending machines with beer, liquor, coffee, soft drinks. Optional Japanese-style breakfast at TekeTeke on the basement level (also open for dinner). There is a St. Marc's Cafe at the entrance for a quick coffee or pastry. All in all, a very convenient hotel, with all that you should need for a short or long-term stay! Arigatou gozaimasu to everyone! Hopefully I will return to Tokyo and your wonderful hotel!

3Cs - Comfortable, Convenient and Contented This was our 2nd stay, we still love it cause its like staying in the city with lesser crowd, it's convenient to sub (3 mins' walk) and/or the main (12 mins' walk) train station. Easy travel from airport via airport limo (drop-off at Hilton and walk about 5 mins). Bed and pillow are comfortable, bathroom with bathtub to relax after shopping. Breakfast can be settle at St. Marc, Caffe Veloce, Doutor, Mcdonald all within mins' away, and to our surprise, there are several nice dinning places located at small lane near the hotel..3 Convenient Stores and more..I'll be back!!

The hotel offers a phone with internet and google maps. You can take this out for sightseeing all day long. Unlimited use of internet! This was the best and most useful feature as we walked from place to place in Tokyo. Moreover, the location of the hotel is very central and close to public transportation.

My daughter and I spent two nights here, and the room was very comfortable and clean. The space is small, but quite adequate for two people without a large amount of luggage. The staff was friendly and the location is excellent with easy access to Shinjuku station. Lots of restaurants nearby. My only negative is that the beds are a bit hard.

Smoking rooms were nauseating. The smell of smoke was apparent as you opened the door and overwhelming. We asked the front desk for a non-smoking room and were quickly cared for.Room is basically all bed. Not enough room for two people to walk beside each other. But the room is functional with a small Japanese only TV (you can purchase, for 1000 yen, a card that gets you Western first run movies and many NSFW options :0, a small table and 1 chair which hold backpacks and jackets. Not much room other than that.Staff is nice and English speaking. Location is great, blocks to the metro and great food choices are within a 10 minute stroll. A 711 is up the street, mcdonalds across the street, and a dessert/coffee chain at the ground floor. In the basement is a great ramen restaurant which is super convenient!I would stay here again....just not take to many pieces of luggage!

We had to book three singles here but it is far from a capsule hotel. The rooms are a bit small ( not much hanging space or room to store your suitcase) but if you don’t mind stashing half of your stuff in your suitcase it’s fine. Beds the size of a small double and very comfy. Good showers over a small bath. Lots of extra teabags and toiletries down in the lobby and the kettle and mugs etc are hidden in the drawers next to a little fridge. 2 combinis within a minute’s walk as well as a 100 yen shop for things you didn’t know you didn’t need. Cafe with excellent coffee in the lobby. Wi-Fi a bit hit and miss.

You couldn't ask for a better location. Easy access to Shinjuku station and the hub of Shinjuku.The accommodation was comfortable but the bed was a bit hard for us.When we asked reception for another blanket, we were flatly refused stating they don't have spare linen. What hotel doesn't have spare linen?We weren't impressed with this response and we won't stay here again.

Neat clean rooms with a great location to Shinjuku station, shopping and the Golden Gai. Rooms were cute and clean. I found my room perfect size for one person - a couple may had struggled especially with additional suitcases and the cute bath may have not been so great for a large guy- but I loved it . Lots of family marts (like 7/11s) near by and a coffee shop in the foyer and Macca’s across the road- cheap eats are easy to come by. Washing machine, alcoholic vending machines, microwave and ice machine all available on two floors, makes this a great base for the budget conscious traveller, who wants to be a short walk away from the action.

Ive stayed at Nishitetsu inn twice now and the experience has been great. Its at a good location which isnt too close to the bright lights of shinjuku or kabukicho but close enough for you to have a good time

The location of the hotel was very convenient. The rooms were small but was clean and comfortable. We were out most of the day so the size didn’t bother us. We would definitely stay here again have recommended to others as well.

Centrally located. This hotel is about 10 mins walk from the Shinjuku subway (where all the shopping malls are located), and 15 mins away from the bus terminal (if you take the bus, or they called it a limousine there, to any one of the airports, you will board the bus at the terminal). As the hotel is opposite to a police station and near a hospital, the siren noise may be slightly more audible in the suites near the street than the ones half way or at the back of the building. The staff speak English and helpful. Our rooms were clean and spacious, for Japan's standard. My children's room that had two twin beds was quite spacious. My children loved it. No worries about checking in late and not finding any restaurants nearby to eat. There are convenient stores, where you can buy food, Mcdonald (across the street) and a ramen place (5 mins walk) that opens 24 hours to feed you.

The hotel is in well location in Shinjuku, close to the metro but not clouded, all you need is in walking distance, shopping, good food and the transportation hub to anyway, we looking help to keep our luggage 5 days before we stay and was good arranged by the hotel

Stayed five nights over the xmas perios and loved our stay. We love being in the thick of things but also like to have quietness to escape from and this is exactly what his hotel offers. If you want to be right in the middle of all the madness then stay in Shibuya but if you want a good, clean ,mid range hotel in a great area that is quiet and offers and great comfortable night sleep then this hotel would be perfect. It is a fantastic location with Nishi Shinjuku subway literally right outside the hotel and a walk into the hub of Shinjuku. The rooms are very small but it had a sofa seat and bench so we had our luggage on there and a small area to hang a few items of clothes.The only drawback we found was the wifi in our room was very slow at peak hours but really good in the reception area. The beds are super comfy and you could open the windows in the room for fresh air. There is a lovely coffee shop in the lobby that whips up fantastic coffees and a good breakfast option (mailnly pastires and sandwiches). The free toiletries you can help yourself to from the reception area where amazing as where the products. All in all i have nothing negitive about this hotel. If you are super picky and expect tip top service then stay in a world class hotel otherwise you will not be dissaointed this this hotel.

I found a hidden gem in Tokyo (Shinjuku area) and highly recommend it. Not only was it very reasonably priced, the rooms were spotless, the bed linens high-quality and the staff lovely. It's so conveniently located, with a dollar store, convenience store, restaurants and a McDonald's all right within the same block. Easy for foreigners to feel comfortable in. They even have laundry rooms for guests to use. Big thumbs all round up from me!

The hotel is located in an extremely convenient location, being less than 5 mins walk from Nishi Shinjuku Station and 10-15 mins walk from JR Shinjuku Station.There are many restaurants, bars and cafes within a 2 min walk. Downstairs you will see 7-eleven, a 100 yen shop and a St Mark's cafe. It is also a stroll away from all the department stores in Shinjuku, Omoide Yokocho, Kabuki Cho. You can spend two full days wandering around Shinjuku alone.The room itself is basic but sufficient. Everything is neat and clean. The room size is pretty standard for a Japanese hotel (we stayed in the double room). We had one large suitcase and one small suitcase. There is not a whole lot of room to walk around with two people staying (sometimes we had to hop over our suitcases), however we had booked with that expectation and it didn't bother us at all.The staff are friendly and helpful. They were able to assist us with bus and train times as we were leaving for Nagano on the day we checked out.Overall I think this is a fantastic hotel for the price we paid. The location is perfect as a base for Shinjuku and the rest of Tokyo.

Small room We came with friends altogether booked 2 rooms via same travel agency website, the room rate we paid higher rate than our friend but the room we got was much smaller. We brought ski gears after skiing at nagano , the room we got were hardly sufficient space for us to open our two big luggages properly. Bad service & unfair policy When we checked in, they did not provide any information about check out time at 10am, there was no notification board at the check in counter, though they claimed that there was a paper indicated such information inside the room. We found out on the day of checking out time was 10am , we rushed to have packed our luggage and we were informed to penalised by JPY2200 . It was not huge amount but it was extremely unfair and unsatisfactory. Would not recommend family and friends to stay there

Stayed here for 6 nights. It is 15 minutes by foot from Shinjuku station. There is an undergraduate station near by which makes it convenient as a base when travelling. Restaurants and convenience stores are all near by.Rooms are adequate with all needed amenities (the humidifier in the room was a blessing)but do note it is not big, similar to the nishitetsu inn i stayed in Osaka.

Good location - train station on your doorstep and shunjuku 5 mins walk away. Room size was slightly larger compared to most Japanese hotel rooms. Service was great and cleanliness was top notch. Was a slight sewer smell in the bathroom.

The hotel is less than a 5 min walk to the Shinjuku subway station (which is basically the heart of the Tokyo subway system). The room is relatively big compared to others in Tokyo. The room is very clean. You have all the basic amenities. The staff is very helpful, even if some of them don't speak good English they will make a huge effort to answer your question or cater to your need. I highly recommend this hotel, it is a good location, clean and definitely great value for money.

Saw several good reviews before this trip hence we decided to go ahead with this hotel for our 6 nights stay in Tokyo.The pros: 1. Location - 2 minute walk from Nishi-Shinjuku station. Shinjuku is a huge district by itself so you can take a walk, about 5-10 mins to the start of the action. 7-11 and Family Mart are very conveniently located near the hotel.2. Amenities are available for guests to take on the ground floor (main lobby). The hotel uses Shiseido products which I like!3. Memory foam pillows are available upon request (subject to availability)4. Staff were generally helpful when we seeker their assistance 5. Comfortable bed The cons:1. Security - The hotel lifts can be accessed by anyone as they do not require guests to tap their room card before pressing the floor button. I find this odd after having stayed in 3-star hotels across APAC with the similar security function yet this hotel doesn’t have.2. Cleaning service - 2 times our trash was left in our room, we had to clear ourselves. 3. No preset seat warmer for toilet - ugh!4. Check-out is 10am. Didn’t really affect us though.5. Overall service - Not consistent. I felt our hotel in Osaka was much better as all the staff we met were consistent in their service attitude and friendly whenever they met the guests (including us). Some of the staff don’t greet the guests and some returned items/money with one hand. The moment when we entered the hotel we knew. Quite disappointed with the inconsistency, considered the price we paid.This hotel is quite popular with tourists. But to summarise my overall experience, I wouldn’t return. I had a superb experience during my stay in Osaka before checking in to this hotel - hence the comparison (unfortunately). I would try other hotels if I were to visit Tokyo again.

Well it's small, but that's the norm in Tokyo. Hotel is very clean, the staff is very friendly and the location is within walking distance of everything you need. We only took a taxi when we arrived and again after check out; the rest of the time we could walk whereever we needed to go. Only complaint is the smell in the bathroom, sometimes the drain was quite stinky which was strange because the city is extremely clean. Regardless, it didn't affect our stay. Great hotel!

We had an enjoyable stay- the only let down was that the room was very small. However location is good and next to station and walking distance to all the great areas for tourists. Not much to eat close by apart from Mac Donald’s. Hotel staff very helpful all of the time. We arrived at hotel at 6am and we paid for an extra night as needed to rest and was going to cost to check in early. Really liked the location but as I mentioned you really can’t move in the room and there is no space for luggage at all.

This is the 3rd time I choose Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku. The good location near metro station and friendly to children are two of reasons I choose this hotel. I will choose it next time I visit Shinjuku.

This hotel iz actually suitable 4 biznuzmen/women whoz in town 4 abit... Bt uz,trvlg az a couple found diz hotel gd enuf 4 our full week stay. Room wuz small,toilet tiny bt whole hotel wuz clean n proper. Theres a cafe near da lobby,mac d across the street n 7 11,family marts and otha stores on the rite n left...near train station which iz a pluz point..near hilton tokyo hotel where u can get the airport limo buz transfers...near hospital n police station..(sumtymz bit noisy) walkin distance 2 shinjuku...veri gd stay we had...ohhh did we mention our rm iz smokin rm too...n derz a floor oni 4 women guests n derz laundry room az well....

The Hotel adress is near by Nishi-Shinjuku Station, around 2min to Station, and 10 mins to Shinjuku Station and Odakyu Shopping mall...The Room is very Comfortable and Cleaning, but It is small。But room is

This hotel is just a few meters away from Nishi-Shinjuku station which is a station away from Shinjuku. Very convenience and the room is spacious compare to the other hotel in the area. I love the coffee and bakery shop at the entrance!

This hotel runs more like a typical Japanese business hotel than a real hotel. The online booking service made a mistake (perhaps my mistake) by making a reservation for a smoking room. The front desk claimed there were no non-smoking rooms for the entire duration of my stay. There is a rule that if the room is not cleaned before1 pm, the guest has to ask to have it cleaned. The checkout is 10:30 AM, when it's 11 or 12 for most hotels in Japan. Too many rules to maximize efficiency at the sacrifice of comfortable stay.

Everything was great. Staff was very helpful to provide us details to go take the limousine bus to the airport. Close to eateries, and an Izakaya and coffee shop at the ground floor of hotel. Very good!

I spent some (three) days in this hotel. The feeling was generally good (clean rooms, good receptionists) but maybe something better could be found in the nearside. The room is not really quite (noise from other rooms).

Great location and is about 10 minutes from Shinjuku station (bear in mind to take west exit from the train station). Room is clean and fairly quiet. Just bear in mind that the hotel is right near the police station so one night we heard police car sirens go off in the night. My wife was fast asleep and didn't hear it but it did wake me up. We stayed a few nights and the other nights were peaceful and quiet.

I booked online and got a very good rate as this hotel does book up so best to plan in advance. It was great to be in Nishi-Shinjuku with close proximity to Shinjuku station and just a couple minutes from the Marunouchi subway line - which connects to Tokyo station if you are taking the Shinkansen anywhere. This is an easier option - especially if you have a suitcase! The staff were extremely helpful and polite and also offered us a good rate for a friend who wanted to extend his stay! The cafe on the ground floor was perfect for our early morning coffees and there are also laundry and microwave facilities in the hotel! (the washing machines automatically dispense laundry powder too!!) As a frequent visitor to Japan, the Nishitetsu Inn was a really nice surprise. Great location, clean and well-appointed rooms and great customer service! I'll definitely stay here again.

Excellent position, with metro station and railway station 10 min by walk. Excellent clean room and hotel. Small room, as usual in japans hotel. Staff excellent. Wifi coverage and speed very good. Coffe bar at the entrace.

close to Shinjuku - 1 stop from Nishi Shinjuku station. It is only 10 min walk to Shinjuku so you don't need to take a train anyway 10 min (towards the right from the hotel) has a supermarket and lots conv shops nearby.

Hotel location is quite a walking distance to Shinjuku West area. On the plus side, hotel is quite near a metro station. Room size is just about adequate. Room charges during travelling period of October is fair.

Very good location, close to the best area of Shinjuku. Room is small, but every room in Tokyo is small. Staff is awesome, very friendly and always willing to help. Price is good (we booked very early so we had a very convenient rate). I would definitely come back in a future trip to Tokyo

We stayed here for 5 nights during our visit in Japan. Located just 100m from the Nishi-Shinjuku station, hotel is super convenient to access even if you are hauling multiple luggage. My most favorite thing about the hotel was the welcoming vibe and super clean feel. It was very inviting after a day spent roaming around Tokyo in crowded subways and streets. The floors are tastefully designed and while the rooms are small they are very comfortable with a water boiler and good quality bathing accessories. They also have a coffee shop at the ground floor which opens early and stays open till late. We also left our luggage here for 4 nights when we travelled outside Tokyo and the staff was super helpful. They also have Laundry and vending machines on a few floors. Overall - great place, great location and I whole heartedly recommend this hotel.

Unfortunately we were being assigned a smoking room as the hotel was full house. We tried to request for a non-smoking room during the booking and guess no luck.the corridor has terrible ventilation and the smell was chokingly awful. The room was initially bearable. However when the air con was on, I could not stop coughing. I guess the irritants from cigarettes have circulated through the ventilation. We had to switch off the aircon for the stay and open windows even though it's cold outside. Thankfully they did have an air purifier in the room though it did not help much. I tried calling the staff at night again to see if they could swap us to another room the next day as we were staying here for two nights. But he told me this is the only room for you.Other than this, we booked for two people but when we arrived into our room, there was only one set of amenity in the room. But the reception staff was helpful, apologetic and rearranged the amenities immediately. The room itself was clean but small. If you were travelling as a couple, you need to make ways for each other to move around the room. It also has little room for you to open your luggage (we only have one big suitcase with us and we could not keep it opened as there was no space). This issue could have been resolved if they have rearranged the furniture a bitTo be fair, its location was good and that was the reason we picked it in the first place. In fact the check in staff was polite and spoke ok English. However the irritation I got from the poorly ventilated smoking floor has heavily discounted my experience with this hotel.

Rooms are not huge but clean and comfortable. Very coveniently located 10 min walk from Shinjuku station. Multiple convenience stores close by. Very nice and professional staff. Everything I could ask for in this price range. I did not try the restaurant in the basement or the café in the lobby.

It is a pleasant and very basic hotel - good for the price. The only drawback is that it is not as close to Shinjuku Station as I would have liked. It required a taxi ride to and from the hotel. For younger more energetic people it would be a pretty brisk but lengthy walk.

Some can say that the room was clean, reasonably priced and in quite good location. However, the room that I got was nowhere near resembling the actual room that I got. It was absolutely horrible. I had two really big piece of luggage with me and I could not even open them inside of the room due to the lack of space. What is more, quite a lot of hotels in Tokyo have small bathrooms, but this one was truly tiny. The only plus I can give to this room that it was clean, had TV and was in reasonable location. To conclude my rant, I am not glad of my experience in this hotel. Honestly, for this price you will be better off finding some Airbnb. By the way, the fact that they are advertising this room as a spacious room for two is just outraging.

The reception staff was very friendly and efficient upon check-in, granting my request for a room on a high floor. The single room was compact (as are all hotel rooms in Japan as space is at a premium) but very well-designed. The single bed is larger than a European size single bed (half way towards a double) – it was comfortable with a good duvet. Room lighting is very good - there is a ceiling-based spotlight as well as uplighting from behind the headboard. Plenty of power sockets (including USB), good kettle and green tea, fridge, drink glasses.There isn’t much storage space but it was fine for a 5-day stay. The air con is very responsive which is great in hot weather! There is a desk with a small sofa that could seat up to two people facing the television, and well-designed for the available space. There are liquid toiletry dispensers in the bathroom (shower gel, conditioner, shampoo and hand wash) as well as toothbrush/toothpaste. There are more toiletries in the reception that you can help yourself to as needed, as well as various types of tea. The bath tub and shower is nice and deep.Breakfast is available for a fee, but there are plenty of breakfast options locally, even a McDonald’s over the road, and a coffee shop in the entrance area to the hotel. There are also several convenience stores just moments away. The location is perfect for exploring Tokyo with Shinjuku JR station only a 10-minute walk away. A great choice for a good-value hotel!

Nice business hotel on the West side of Shinjuku ward (where more of the skyscrapers seems to be, for example the Metropolitan Government Building with it's 2 free observation decks on the 45th floor ), less then 200m from Marunouchi Subway Line ( Nishi-Shinjuku M07 Exit ), close to the Shinjuku JR Station (less then 1000m), so reaching the more lively east side (Goldengai, Kabukicho) is easy even on foot. The hotel room (I've got a single non-smoking room) is small but I'd say is quite standard for this hotel category, but if you bring very big luggages it might be hard to manage them. Room was clean and many amenities/accessories were provided (some you can get at the 1st floor near elevators). Air-Conditioning system worked fine, you can control the temperature and other functions from a wall-mounted remote control. The bed mattress is not too hard (good for my tastes), the pillow is quite peculiar (for me at least), but still confortable. On some floors They have coin operated washing machines and dryers (soap was automaticly dispensed from the washer), micro-waves ovens and vending machines. Room Wi-Fi works fine, but an ethernet RJ45 plug is provided too if needed. Unit bath/toilet is a little small, but not a problem for me (average size, 173 cm height). Staff was nice and helpful and the members to whom I've talked to, speak good english. The rooms are cleaned every day starting from 10:00 a.m. , unless you stick on the outside of the door of the Do Not Disturb "tag", if they can't clean the room due to that, they'll leave by the door a new set of towels, toothbrush and other accessories. I've stayed at this hotel in 2016 and 2017 and for both stays i didn't have any problem or particular complaint, so if I'll ever come again to Tokyo, I'll probably stay here again.

Based on generic hotel in japan.Pros:1. Max comfy bed. we got the double bed and it was relaxingly soft yet retain the bounce that let you unwind all tiredness.2. Friendly and Xtra helpful staff. Professionally done too. from rexeption to the hotel maids.3. They have xtra amenities at the lobby for you to take. Try the aromatic bath powder. It brings the spa to your hotel's bathtub.4. Convenient stores so close to the hotel. You wont go starve literally.5. Great Cafe in the hotel. 3rf party cafe " St. Mark" I think. Try the Choco-crossant! superb!Remark:1. Good for those who use subway its just within clicks.2. Quite a distant from Shinuku Station though walkable. May be a bit of work if you have huge luggages.

This is probably the best hotel in terms of price per performance in Tokyo. At roughly $200 a night for a standard 2 twin beds this is considered good value already in Shinjuku which is a very expensive neighborhood. You can reach Kabukicho easily at a leisurely walk of 20 mins. Many casual restaurants nearby as well as reasonably close to Shinjuku station and closest to the Tokyo Metro Nishi-Shinjuku station. If you're somewhat on a budget and want a decent size room (for Japan standards) and is clean with complete amenities. You can never get wrong with Nishitetsu Inn.

The hotel was fantastic. It was near Shinjuku Station. The staff was polite and resolved my doubts completely. The room was clean and nice. The incovenient, my room was too small for four nights. We have been a little bit uncomfortable a cause to the space.

Rooms are small but accommodating. Staff was very helpful and courteous. I highly recommend this hotel. This is my second time at this hotel and I will stay here on my next trip also. You can walk to most places and the train, subway bus stations are within 5 or 10 minutes awayk

First time staying there. Great location. Clean and modern rooms. Good size room with all the nice small gifts and teas. Staff are nice and professional. provide free water bottles if you comply with Eco policy. Would recommend to anyone.

The rooms are clean, the staff is very helpful and the hotel is at a good location. However the rooms are very small and I could barely open the big luggage in the room!also there is almost no space to hang or place your clothes

The room is a bit small, but you can get all you needed. The location is a bit far from the main Shinjuku station. Maybe I'm not good in finding the Inn, I need to climb up and down the bridge. However, I have to mention that a high quality sashime shop is near the Inn with low price. You can go to enjoy the fresh seafood whenever you want to!

Spent 3 nights in a standard double as a base for travel around Tokyo and nearby cities. Closest to nishi-Shinjuku station via underground walkways, and about 8-15 minutes walk to Shinjuku station (pedestrian bridge and luggage included). Hotel staff were polite, amenities conveniently placed in lobby, modern and inviting. Room was small, but both modern and well organised to partially live out of suitcase.Compensated by couple of USB ports, lots of clothes and bag hanging space, suitcase stand, sofa and study table, single empty small drawer. Lighting was a nice touch; focused and ambient lighting for work and relaxation.Bathroom: Clean tidy standard Japanese style (bathroom/wet room hybrid). 4/5Room: Small for couple 3/5, but as mentioned above optimised well, and made comfortable when utilised by a savy traveller. Sofa and table are conveniently placed for both work and relaxing. Bed was semi-firm and comfortable. 4/5

The staff is very friendly, they provide any assistance needed, like parcels received in advance, luggage storage for our trip to Mt. Fuji so that we can simply come back and check-in again after the short trip. It's a convenient location too with convenient stores and many restaurants nearby.

*English is spoken but not hugely* so please try to learn a Japanese phrase for anything very specific! Obviously a very business orientated hotel so stood out a bit as a tourist but don't let that put you off. It's a short walk 10/15 mins from shinjuku station and the bus drop off from haneda (can't speak for narita). The is an overpass that runs from the station to the road the hotel is on! Room, standard Japanese size... So small. For a big suitcase you will be living out of it! But this is expected. The room was clean, modern and well maintained. Plenty of plugs and even 2 USB ports for charging in case you forgot your adaptor!The cafe is the well known St Marc's offering ice cream, cake, coffee etc. Not a bad price. Upon checkout they held our bags as our train was later in the day. *however* I had some trouble connecting to the WiFi, my friend who travelled with me in another room did not (I was in room 1038), was a little annoying but didn't affect me overall. Would use again!

This was a average hotel in a good location unhelpful staff just outside the hustle and bustle The gripe we have is check in We emailed the hotel to let them know we would be arriving about midday and could we check in early, they replied that we could at an extra cost , they told us the price that's ok we thought , we arrived and everything changed we were told that the charges had changed it had nearly doubled we were not happy at all, the staff didn't care (after traveling and being awake for nearly 24 hours )we just wanted to sleep so after getting a little upset we paid it Then we were told that the room wasn't ready and we had to wait for another 40 mins not a great start to our holiday Given this we had a good time in Tokyo

We spent 4 nights at the Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku and appreciated our stay.★ Staff: check in was quick and efficient as we arrived way earlier than the regular check in time. We resorted to fork out for an early check-in as we were tired and wanted to get some rest before enjoying our first afternoon in Shinjuku. Check out was extremely quick and easy at the counter. We realized it could have been even easier by simply dropping the keycards in the box. ★ Location: 1 minute from Nishi-Shinjuku subway station and about 10 minutes from Shinjuku station. It was our goal to be within walking distance to Shinjuku station as you can reach pretty much all destinations from there. A few convenient stores around open 24/7 in case you have the munchies or need toiletries not offered by the hotel.★ Room: as everywhere in Japan, it's very small. I however found the bed rather smaller than at previous hotels I have stayed in Japan. The fact one of the bed side is against the wall isn't particularly convenient when needing to get up or during the night if you need to move.Wifi is free and very fast. There is a TV but we have not watched it so can't say what channels are available. On-demand movies (including the sexy kind) are available with the purchase of a card at a machine on the same floor you're staying. I think the card costs 1,000 yen. The movie guide is provided in the room.An empty fridge is available in the room if you would like to store your loot from the convenient stores downstairs.Bathroom is small. Inside are Japanese automated toilets (commands are in English), bathtub and sink. A few amenities are provided when checking in. If you need more toiletries, they are available in the lobby.Vending machines are available on 2 floors if you are too lazy to walk to the nearby conbini.All in all, the stay was pleasant and the location very convenient for a fair price. I would consider staying there again.

Upon check-in front desk were trying to be quick and swift but lacked English to communicate. This is a business hotel and definitely not catered for tourists. Having said that, if you're in Japan for a holiday I would recommend you look elsewhere to save yourself any mishaps like we experienced. As our stay was towards the end of my month long holiday in Japan I had quite a bit of luggage. The hotel does not seem to know how to accomodate for this. When asked for a luggage trolley the tiniest flat wheelie came out - enough to put 2 backpacks on it (bit of a joke). However front desk personnel helped us to our room with all our bags so that was nice of him. The room is a typical Japanese sized hotel room - small. I'd grown quite accustomed so it didn't really bother me. However you really do have to live out of your suitcase in this case. The room itself was clean and tidy, no complaints. With ammenities, you have to restock yourself from the lobby (there's a selection of shavers, toothbrushes, cleansing oils, body scrub towels etc.). If you want Lipton tea, they place a box selection right on the front desk counter, so help yourself. The location is not too bad, it was a short stroll to Shinjuku station -10mins. There's subway stations entrances scattered a long the street so transportation was a breeze. Connected to the hotel is a coffee shop downstairs so it was convenient for when you wanted a coffee first thing in the morning. There's 7/11, Natural Lawson and Can-Do (100 yen shop) literally a few lots down from the hotel so that was very convenient for when you want a late night snack or drinks. It's basic, no fuss, mediocre kind of stay. The stay itself I had no problems with. However if you're there for service - forget it! Upon check-out my partner and I lugged all our stuff to the lobby and asked the front desk lady if one taxi would be able to fit all our stuff. She said there's no way. Which was fine by me, I asked her to book us two taxis. She did so and advised us that it was going to be a 15 mins wait. My partner and I happily waited but by 40 mins we grew impatient especially when we were only going 20 mins away. I then approached front desk to enquire about my taxi bookings. Told him I've been waiting for 40 mins. He looked shocked, told me he was checking and picked up the phone. I gather he was checking with the taxi company. There was a lot of confusion but none of the 5 to 6 people behind front desk told us what was going on! Communication people. They just looked at me, while talking in Japanese amongst themselves (probably about the situation but how in gods name I'm I meant to know anything if they don't talk?). I get that Japanese people aren't accustomed to confrontation - I fully understand but hey what the heck was going on? I got fed up and demanded someone give me an answer, are the taxis coming or what?! Still nothing - no one said anything and one by one they disappeared through a door behind the front desk. I tell you, I'd have better luck if I had just waved two down myself on the street! Eventually after checking out at 10am, I was on my way at 11:20am. Absolutely ridiculous! What should have been a no brainer easy transaction became a nightmare! And that's just ordering taxis going locally - good luck if you have a flight to catch! On top of this when I was riding one taxi and my partner the other with our luggage spilt half and half the taxi driver told me "you didn't need two taxis, you can fit all in one"...Great. So thank-you Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku but no thanks to next time!!!

The location is near to metro station for just 5 minutes walk, but a bit far away from the JR station which required 15 minutes walk. I particularly love the cafe which is at the G/F of the hotel. The room is small and comfortable and with wifi available. The staff is friendly and helpful. Definitely will come again next time when visit Tokyo.

The hotel was comfortable, clean and reasonably priced. It is within walking distance from many attractions such as the Samurai Museum and Shinjuku Park. However, my room did not have a microwave which is a must have if I am going to buy foods from the convenience store regularly.

We stayed 2 nights in your hotel and we enjoyed the great service the staff provided. Your hotel was very centrally located so it was easy to get around Shinjuku.We would definitely stay again when we return.

Rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable.Price/quality OK for central part of Tokyo, next to Shinjuku station.Few facilities, breakfast in adjacent restaurant, convenience stores nearby.Friendly professional staff.

5-6 employees working front desk, none of them have a clue, even though a Few spoke english??!! Seems to be more a business hotel and dont cater well for foreign customers. Plenty of hotels to stay at in shinjuku area, which are more friendly and with great service. so save yourself the headache and dont STAY HERE, unless their prices drop substantially.

On Saturday, May 20, around 6:15pm, I asked the reception staff how to get to Narita Airport and he directed me to take Limousine Bus. But I found out the last bus of the day departed at 3:45pm! I could have gone for Narita express train directly. This made me missed the 6:38pm Narita express train and the next one won't depart until 7:38pm which will be too late for my flight! I had to take Yamanote line from Shinjuku to Nippori then transfer to Keisei line which made several stops in between. I made it to check in counter just about 30 minutes before the counter closed. Make sure to save some cash in yen!

We stayed at Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku for 3 nights while visiting Tokyo on holiday. The hotel is conveniently located a 15 minute walk from Shinjuku station and a few minutes from entries to the metro and easy access to other parts of Tokyo. The hotel itself is functional and clean with a room size average for this type of hotel. The double bed is accessible from one side only but the room is well laid out and the capsule bathroom very usable. Staff were efficient but not engaging.

I recommend this hotel. Absolutely. Room not so big but fully functional with all you need: fridge, windows, desk to work, small sofa, USB!Comfortable bed and quiet room despite the location. Tube is very close included train station and a lot of markets, etc..

I actually took the airport limousine bus since it was more convenient for me from Narita airport. Bus dropped me at Hilton hotel and it is about 5 mins or less walk from there to this hotel. I didn't realize how great this location is. As others have mentioned, JR and metro stations are in walking distance. Small rooms but comfortable. They have lot of toiletry items in their lobby that you can take for free like toothbrush, razor etc. There is St.Marc's café near the lobby and there are good restaurants near by(Sushi and other Japanese food). There are fast food and western restaurants near by as well. Infamous red light area is also within walking distance. Even the Govt. building that has the observatory on the 47th or 48th floor is in walking distance as well. In short, perfect location. Hotel and the room itself is very clean. Staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations. I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is very central in Shunjuku . the room is small , well it is Tokyo!, but you have a little refrigerator, a kettle, even a small table, and mini coach....very convenient. There is a Family Mart, a 7/11, and a Mc Donald close by. Also a little temple, with picnic tables ( in fact it is a cemetery!) Very peaceful! is about 12-15 minutes'walk from the train station and from the limousine airport transfer counter (actually, it is a regular bus but they call it limousine).The transfer is very convenient and easy to get to both airports. For Narita, it is about two hours , it cost 3,100Yen, or 2,000, if you have grey hair, +over 65, no need to show your ID They have many departure time,from 5.30 am , last one 17.45.. but it is best to book one day in advanceBe aware that the hotel' s checkout time is 10 am....and the checking is at 3pmNot very convenient, if like me you arrive early on a rainy day!There is a coffee shop at the entrance of the hotelIt is an easy to walk to the Shinjuku Gyoen national garden (200yen).So beautiful when the cherry trees are in flower!

Hotel has a great location and staff are very helpfull despite the lack of english, but sleep quality was very poor due to air conditioner that was extremly noisy and didnt cool enough, room felt stuffy and hot.In addition there is a building office right outside the window (few meters away), had to keep the window blocked at all times.TV had only channels in japanese.For a couple of days shower didnt have hot water.Wifi was slow and disconnected, problem was solved by staff with private device

The location is perfect, just 10 minutes walk from south exit of JR Shinjuku station or 2 minutes walk from Nishi-shijuku metro station (M07) exit E8. Room is comfortable and very clean. Microwave and ice making machine on 10th floor are free of charge.All staff are friendly and willingly to help.

This is one of the most convenience hotel in Shinjuku. 2 mins walk from subway. Nearby shopping area. Family Mart is just steps away. Been coming back to stay after 2 trips. Highly recommended for all. However, rooms are relatively small.

The title pretty much tells it all. The location is excellent, its just opposite the Nishi-Shinjuku subway station (Marounochi line) and 10 minutes away on foot from Shinjuku station (for JR lines and several subway lines). Its quiet, as its not right in the centre of the entertainment disctrict. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and shops in easy walking distance.The rooms are small but with everything that you need, including a comfortable bed and the bathroom is "normal sized". Staff is very friendly.Its excellent value for money and I would there again.

the hotel is just 5 minutes walk from Nishi-shinjuku, 15 minutes walk from the hotel to Shinjuku, the room was small but clean and comfortable, can't open the 29"luggage.There is many restaurant around the hotel and some is good. I will stay it again next time!

The hotel is located close to the Shinjuku station. Is totally renewed and the rooms are very confortables. The hotel was a surprise for us. If we go to Tokyo again, we'll stay there. The receptionists were very friendly. Thank you

The hotel staff and reception are very welcoming, helpful and receptive, The hotel location, is near every thing you think about, it is in the hart of Shinjiku, near Shinjiku station, near Nishi-shinjiku metro station, a lot of shopping centers and malls, steps from bus terminals, where you can take limousine bus to airport or to Mount Fuji, many traditional restaurants around. all in all it is perfect location.

A comfortable hotel in a convenient location. The room was small but adequate and the bed was very firm. The breakfast was very good with both western and Japanese food. And the bath was large and well appointed.

The Hotel is being progressively renovated and represents great value and quality at every level. Terrific service and a great Shinjuku location. I would not stay anywhere else. The rooms are small but ingenious in how much is packed in. Clean and comfortable. Just great

I recently stayed at the Nishitetsu Inn for five days. I was impressed w/the hotel and the room. The room was perfect for me as I was a single traveller and did not require too much space. As is everywhere in Japan, the service was top-notch and everything was spotlessly clean, all the time. First time using a Japanese style toilet...loved it. The staff were helpful whenever I needed something. The location is good as it's very close to the metro and a 7-11 is nearby. It's walking distance from a lot of restaurants and stores, and nightlife. The only complaint I have is that in order to turn off the room light at night to sleep I had to take the keycard out of the slot, which cut the electricity to the room. That meant I couldn't charge my phone, batteries, tablet, etc. So, after the first night I had to sleep w/the lights on. Perhaps installing a light switch in each room would help. Other than that, there's nothing negative I could say about the hotel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Tokyo.

We stayed at nishitetsu hotel for 6 nights and it was a very pleasant stay. The hotel is very close to the train stations and places to eat and explore. The staff was helpful and very attentive. Our room was comfortable and cleaned everyday. Thank you!

Always good service!!!!! This is my second visit. I think the hotel was okay. It was very clean and confortable. Also it was good accommodation for a hotel of this class. l'll choose again Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku the next time.

Room looked a bit outdated but still nice.Nice location very close to Marunouichi Line 2 mins walk, but walkable to Shinjuku Stn 10mins. Hotel amenities good! Cafe downstairs. Vending machines for drinks, self service laundry room wash and drying was very handy! Breakfast (Japanese) was very nice and healthy makes a change!

Very good hotel, clean and confortable in a really good ubication, 5 minute walk fro shinjuku station! Super market, mcdonald 24/7 and all the ramen that you can want. I have only one problem and was that my go pro hero 3 dissapear i advised after y left japan and i cant contact the hotel ( there no mail or costumer service that i can find)

Near Maruouchi line (Nishi Shinjuku), walkable distance to Shinjuku area, but situated just away from the hustle and bustle. Not a bad location.The room is small but that is expected for most Tokyo hotels, though i wished they at least had space for me to fully open my luggage.

PROS:Convenient location in Shinjuku, at about 10 minutes from the metro-train station and about 100 meters from a Marunochi line metro entrance (the actual stop is actually farther).The bed is comfortable enough, the room is clean and the cleaning service is OK.Quiet neighborhood w/o noises at night.CONS:Room and bathroom are very small and cramped (it was difficult to fully open my luggage).Breakfast not included. There is a café at the ground floor and an izakaya at B1 where you can have breakfast at about 800-1500 yen (at the time of writing).No view from my window (another tall building across a side alley at about 50 meters).The interiors and furniture are on the old fashioned side.Basic amenities, no frills.

Clean business hotel a short walk from main streets of shinjuku (restaurants, shops, bars, kareoke, bowling etc.). Short walk from shinjuku station and also another little subway station close by the hotel. Rooms aren't that big but that's just Tokyo in general. Hotels laundry room was being refurbished but laundry room is handy.

Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku has a good location. It is near the Tokyo Metro, just only walk for 2 minutes and you could access it. 7-11 and McDonald are near by. And the servers of reception are nice! They allow me to leave my luggage before I check in and after I check out. It is quite convenient for me.

Well located a few minutes walk from Shinjuku station, this hotel is perfect if you're traveling on a budget and need a clean simple place to stay. They don't offer much more than a very small room, but it was spotless and, I think, newly renovated. Good value for money in expensive Tokyo but a bit tight.

I stayed for one night on business trip. I found the hotel locating in convenient location (walking distance) from Shinjuku station. The room rate is reasonable. The staffs are very polite and helpful.

Compare with other hotel, ur check out time is 10am is very earily & ur staff is insist on imposing our fine as we have asserted that we don’t know the earily check out time & ur staff promised to release it by phone before. In fact, it is inconvenience to all traveler, & also let us not visit ur hotel again.

Downtown Randwick, close to restaurant and stores. Walking distance to subway. Breakfast cafe on 1st floor. Teke Teke resto in the basement superb. Mint condition, very clean and updated accommodations. Quiet occupants, friendly staff.

Fantastic location very near to Shinjuku for a reasonable price, helpful staff (the clerk was very kind and changed my reservation at the last minute without additional charging) and the room was very clean, with a water boiler and space to hang my coat. I slept very well despite the hotel was undergoing a renovation (no noise during the night). The only con I can find is that my room was slightly small as I was travelling with a lot of luggage: I had to put my largest bagagge on the bed to be able to open it. My suggestion is to try and ask for a slight larger room if you have lots of luggage!

The hotel was located in a convenient location - 2 minutes walk from Nishi-shinjuku metro station and 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku station. The room was tiny but not any tinnier than most commercial hotel in Tokyo. The room was clean and equipped with moisturizer, very considerate! The bed was comfortable. Above all, the counter staffs were the most friendly and helpful I have ever met. They would come up to you to give you suggestions as long as you show any hint of uncertainty. I enjoyed my staying there and will definitely choose it again if I come to visit Tokyo again.

The room was pefectly clean with a comfortable bed and small bonuses like complimentary tea and kettle. The personnel was very helpful and the rate is great taking into account the location of the hotel

quite camfortable stay in Tokyo, access to Shinjuku station is just 12m walking, many restaurant and electric shop. I don't need to go other cities. Staff in hotel are very kind enough, room is clean and comfortable to stay.

I had a ten days trip with only myself in Japan. I stayed in this hotel twice, one before they re-decorated their rooms and one after. The re-designed room is quiet simple but well-organized and comfortable. The whole experience is perfect. The room is clean and has everything you need.

We like the fact that the hotel is within reasonable walking distance of not only the Shinjuku station, but also the Nishi-Shinjuku station. Our room was small but clean and pretty compactly designed. Amenities are good (including Shiseido toiletries). One area of improvement is the breakfast. While not included in the room rate, guests can either go to the western-style cafe by the entrance for a pastry and coffee, or buy a voucher for a Japanese-style breakfast in the basement. We only tried the Japanese breakfast, and felt it was the fly in the ointment. The proteins (pieces of fish, chicken and pork) were overlooked and cold. Items that ran out were not replenished (including a pot of rice porridge that ran out more than an hour before the end of the breakfast service). Having said that, these are certainly things that can be fixed quite easily if management would like to do so. Otherwise, there are plenty of other dining options within a stone's throw.Overall, we still give this property a thumbs up and would consider it again for a future stay.
