New York City, New York

review_body: If you don't mind a basic room with a very small bathroom at a reasonable price and just a stone's throw away from Shinjuku station (literally 4-5 minutes walk), this is the Hotel for you.There are no luxuries here, except the Toto toilet that is very common in Japanese toilets (cleans your bum). The Yukata that is provided as a robe is also comfortable. I didn't try the slippers.I did try to borrow a USB charger from the Reception/Concierge (mine had somehow broken during the flight there) but was unsuccessful and was instead pointed towards the nearest Electronics store (around Shinjuku station).You won't be able to lay down and relax in the bath-tub. At the most you'll sit uncomfortably with your knees bent. I opted for showers, which were fine.Soap, Shampoo and Conditioner is provided in dispensers. No little bottles here.There were renovation works happening during my stay but I didn't hear any noise (when I arrived at 1AM for check-in, workers were quietly tiling the reception area floor), the only noise that I heard during the day was from outside, where I believe there was construction going on. But I was out all day most days so I didn't really bother me.There is a café on the ground floor which serves breakfast/cappucinos etc.

Just finished a 3 night stay at this great hotel. From check in to check out the staff were friendly and accommodating, especially the cleaning staff. I was pleasantly surprised how spacious the room was, given the usual standard of smallness with Japanese hotel rooms. Prime location with a 10 minute walk to the main Shinjuku station and 2 minute walk to the Nishi-Shinjuku subway station on the Mauronchi line. All in all, a great experience. I will definitely be back! :)

We stayed at Nishitetsu Inn for 6 nights and were extremely pleased. Albeit cosy like all Japanese hotels, we found the room to be extremely functional and well thought out. It was also very child friendly, i.e. No sharp corners at all! It was also pleasant to receive a pack of essentials for our toddler, towel, slippers, toothbrush in a nice bag upon check-in. I love the fact the the shower mirror has anti fog sprayed on it, which goes to show the amount of details Nishitetsu looks into the comfort of their customers.Location wise it is only 5-10min walk to the shinjuku JR or subway nishi-shinjuku, and there are convenience shops nearby 1min away and a 100-yen shop ard the corner at 1min.It was our favorite lodging of the entire 16 day trip and my family and I would highly recommend Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku to any visitors to Tokyo, business or family travelers.

Fantastic little hotel to stay in busy Shinjuku! The area in which its located is quiet, however you're only 10 mins walk from the major station. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were exceptional! Would love to stay here again next time I'm in Tokyo!

It a very nice place to stay as it not to far to get around but for first timer it a little hard to locate this hotel. But once you know the place well it easy. Across the road there is a 24 hrs mac donald.

Nice place to stay, good value quality/price, highly recommended! It is in Shinjuku district,many restaurant, shops and clubs. It is nearby the train station, useful for any one-day train trip or just for metro.It is not included breakfast in the hotel fares but there are many cafè in the surrounding!Good hotel both for vacations and for business,

Location is perfect close to Shinjuku station, the rooms are pretty large for the rate and location, cleanliness is perfect, receptionists are efficient and check-in very fast. For breakfast various options outside the hotel at very reasonable price. Excellent overall.

Nice and quiet, located closed to the Nishi-Shinjuku station on the Marunouchi Line. Family Mart, Lawson and 7-11 nearby. MacDonald's across the road. The shower water pressure was fantastic! The room was very cosy and comfortable. The staff were very patient, friendly and polite.

Great choice for someone looking to stay within the vicinity of Shinjuku station! Not only is it a short walk to the major station, you also have a choice of konbinis at your doorstep and spoilt for food options around the hotel!The room was clean and comfortable! Being Japan, we cant expect too much for space (without paying the price) however it was spacious enough for a single traveler! Best part was even though it was only a short distance from the hustle and bustle of Shinjuku Station, it was pleasantly quiet enough for a good nights rest! The staff were exceptional and will definitely look to stay here again when I return to Tokyo!

Pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms. Has enough space for 2 of us to open our luggages fully and move around. Small wardrobe but has hangers and even air freshener so that's fabulous. And it even has a foot massager and water boiler that keeps the water warm, and a water dispenser so you can boil and keep the water cool there and dispense later. Has a bar fridge as well. Probably because of the month of our travel (Oct), the air-conditioner is now a heater, so the only way to get the room to cool is to open the window (which only opens a crack). Though it does cool the room after awhile, it's not the best way to get it to cool quickly or to ventilate the room. Had food smells coming into the room in the morning too. But that's probably the only con. Location was fairly good too. Near a minor Tokyo subway stop and just about 3-4 streets away from the major Shinjuku train station.

The location near Nishi Shinjyku station is. Wry central, allowing easy access to metro stations linking to the main attractions. It is close but not too close to the nightlife of Shinjuku and there are .plenty of reasonably priced restaurants close by. The rooms are small but well equipped and the staff very helpful and accommodating. The laundry facilities on the 7th floor are very helpful.

My partner and I stayed at Nishitetsu Inn for 3 nights during our first trip to Tokyo. The hotel is conveniently located in Shinjuku with lots of restaurants and pubs as well as a number of convenient stores next door. Rooms are extremely tiny (probably the tiniest that I've stayed in compared to others in Japan) but was extremely clean with 'help yourself' complimentary amenities (there's a table by the lobby elevator). Best advice as a tourist is to pack light as we struggled to open 2 suit cases inside the narrow room. Bed was ok (although you can tell that the mattress is quite old and saggy) - I think the hotel is currently undergoing renovations. As the location is situated in busy Shinjuku (with the red light district around the corner) I was impressed at how the room was able to keep out the hustle and bustle of city noise. My only criticism is that our floor reeked of cigarette smoke. Even though we were given a non-smoking room, the neighbouring smoking rooms gave off a very strong stench in the hallway. Although an ideal location (the Nishi Shinjuku station is around the corner) we were coming from the Shinjuku JR line and found it very very exhausting dragging our suitcases to the hotel. Not every street corner has a cross-walk and so we had to take longer detours which made a 10 minute walk more like 30 minutes. There's also heavy construction going on near the hotel so it's not the easiest streets to navigate so if you are coming from JR Shinjuku I highly recommend jumping into a taxi which would set you back around 800 yen. All in all, we had a good stay and would recommend it to visitors traveling on a budget.

Stayed here as a group of seven for nine nights and was able to get rooms and dates booking about 4 months in advance. Twin rooms are limited so was only able to get singles. Location was great for konbini and Maru line access, about 10min walk to Shinjuku Station and JR lines. Clean, surprisingly quiet at night, friendly staff. The lobby has some couches which was convenient for brief group gatherings. Bedroom was smallish but had dedicated space for suitcase and a few hanger items. The sliding window shutters work pretty well for keeping the room dark. Comfortable, no frills place for getting a good night's rest. The lobby has bookcase of local guide maps and airport access info. Like many business hotels, the room amenities does not include lotion.

Really love the place, location, room and staffs are all great. Room is clean and nice. Near shinjuku station and nishishijuku metro, near shopping area, Isetan, Donki, -and many stores. Nignt life is also great!

Excellent customer service, very clean room, large room space and washroom. Bed is very comfortable, you will love it. Mcdonald , convenience store, coffee shop just cross to street and downstair, don't worry about hungry. Only complaint is not locate at central area of shinjuku. It take 7mins to JR station and 10-15mins for department store. Highly recommand.!!!!!!

Overall room was very nice, very happy with what I paid. Staff were very friendly. Hotel was in a prime location only five minutes walk from Shinjuku. The hotel was also very easy to find. I would recommend coming back here.

This is a really good value hotel, located 2 minutes walk from the Nishitetsu metro station. The staff on the front desk are very helpful - gave us directions to nearby restaurants, cinema and general travel tips. The front desk staff all speak good English. We booked three single rooms and they were clean and a reasonable size with a 3/4 size bed (larger than single bed). The coin operated laundry was really useful. The only thing I found awkward was that I had to buy a telephone card to use the phone is the room. I guess most visitors have mobiles ( ours did not work in Japan) so room phones are rarely used.

Located in Nishi-Shinjuku and a 5 minute walk from the Marunouchi line, this hotel is easily accessible from practically everywhere in Tokyo.The rooms are spacious (In Japanese standards), clean, with comfortable bedding and well equipped. The hotel also offers a laundry service (for a fee), and has a coffee shop and Iskaya (Japanese pub) on its premises. The Isakaya also offers breakfast for an additional fee. The staff speaks good English and goes out of their way to be helpful and informative about anything and everything.Unfortunately, although the hotel offers free Wi-Fi connection in all rooms, the connection in my room was slow, and kept disconnecting. That could be due to the renovation of the hotel.All in all Nishitetsu Inn is a good place to stay when in Tokyo
user_name:
Daniel B
Tel Aviv District, Israel

review_body: Staff are friendly and any request or or question I had was professionally and promptly dealt with. Good central location, close to everything but still in a nice quiet spot. For a two and a half week stay there's nothing I can fault with this hotel. Unless I want to stay in a different area, I would come and stay here again.

This is definitely for business travellers only, not for tourists.Although the walk from Shinjuku station to this hotel is only 8min, but with big luggages, it is still pretty inconvenient, especially when the road is not made for dragging luggage.it is located in a quiet side of Shinjuku but with 7-11 & Lawson nearby. I would say it is on the opposite side of the Kabukicho area. In future, I would stay in hotels that are on the same side as Kabukicho. No complaint on room cleanliness & front desk services. Just my personal preference that prefer Kabukicho area.

We booked 5 nights into this hotel. Surprisingly, the rooms are bigger than expected in Japanese standard. We got a twin bed, 1 single and 1 double bed which can actually accommodate 3 person. Staff are very friendly and it's just in a happening place in Shinjuku. Food is everywhere and subway is just a stone thrown away. Would recommend to all.

We stayed here for 6 nights and it was pleasant. Our room was on the 11th floor and unfortunately was very close to another tall building so there was no view at all and the room was tad dark. This didn't bother us as we didn't spend much time in the room! Pros - Staff were great. Whilst some don't speak english, they were pleasant to deal with. The bed was comfortable and the cleaners were lovely.Cons - The bathroom was tired and and the fittings really needed to be changed. Bathroom size is as with other Japanese hotels so we don't mind at all. We felt a little dizzy in the bathrooms so not sure if it's because the floor is uneven? We didn't enjoy the cafe downstairs - they're not associated with the hotel so this is not a criticism for the hotel. The cafe staff are difficult to deal with and a bit rude. Tips - The closest station is the Nishi-Shinjuku station and there's several subway access points around the hotel. The closest is to the right of the hotel when you exit (on the same side of the road). There's a 'Can Do' 100 Yen shop to the left of hotel when you exit which is extremely useful for all your daily needs during your stay (i.e. umbrellas, socks, food)

Stayed here for 4 nights, the hotel itself is perfectly situated close to all the action of Shinjuku. The room was probably one of the smallest rooms I've stayed in, but it was clean and comfortable and WiFi was fine. The staff were helpful and there is a cafe built into the hotel with a great selection of hot snacks and pastries. There is also a yakiniku restaurant called Taijuen right next door.

Good location, directions map on website lacks detail, front desk staff officious. Small rooms, toiletries at reception under stern gaze of desk staff making you feel like you're stealing them. Air conditioning average as windows don't open at all

A get away trip with my wife. the bed is comfortable and not too small. Room can easily fit 2 of our large suitcases fully opened for packing. Staff is super helpful with good English. We rare stay at the Inn, spending most of our time outside. Room is clean but does not provide free bottle water (they say that the tap water is drinkable). Close to Metro and Railway lines. Would consider staying again.

It's very central yet it needs not only a renovation from outside(which was already happening) but from inside as well. The room seems a bit old yet the coffee shop downstairs was a happiness source every morning!

The service is excellent and the location is convenient, 10 mins walk to Shinjuku station and many amenities nearby. The single room is a bit bigger than Tokyo business norm so all in all, a very pleasant stay.

This is the first time i live in Nishitetsu Inn Hotel, the room is very clean and comfortable, when i have question and leave the note on the desk, when i came back at night, the staff has print the answer on a paper for me, feel so nice.i find the hotel in booking, but i don't have visa card to pay, so finally i find that your hotel has the official web, and can use union pay card, this help me so much.The hotel is a little far to the shinjuku station, but very near the nishitetsu shinjuku station.This trip is very good and nice, like your hotel, there is no big problem, i will chose to live here next time!

Not far at all from the heart of Shinjuku, this Hotel offered us a clean, decent sized room, comfortable enough to spend few days two people. Great service from the staff every time we enquired about the things we wanted to do (Tsukiji Market, Sumo...)

It's clean and quiet. Just a little bit far away form shinjuku station. It takes me 10 minutes to walk there. It's comfortable and convenient. The price is still litlle high. I will consider this hotel for my next trip in Tokyo.

Great location in close proximity to conference venues and the never quiet central shinjuku neon streets. Spoilt for choice for food in a 5 block radius but don't miss what is just under you. Great restaurant immediately below Inn, underground. Close to everything you need especially subway system. Poor Wifi in room.

Close to the main Shinjuku Station and shops but quiet and tranquil, the hotel is modern, clean, has free internet and small but comfortable rooms. A struggle for two without storage space but twin beds were very comfortable. The staff were wonderful: so helpful. Arranged an audiologist for post flight ear pain, sent on our suitcases to Kyoto. Flawless service.

Got the limousine bus from narita to shinjuku West exit Make sure you walk with Road to your right. There's a walk way over the road with lots of steps which is difficult with suitcases. Clean pleasant hotel would use again now I know where it is. I checked in an hour early and paid y2000

We booked a non-smoking room, and supposedly got one (it was on a non-smoking floor). It was at the end of the hallway. The room reeked of smoke something terrible. And the bed was very hard and uncomfortable as well. I don't know why this hotel is so highly rated. Needless to say I won't be back to this hotel, and will stay away from this hotel chain for the rest of my life.

The Nishitetsu Inn has a great location just a few steps from the Nishi-shinjuku metro station, so is a superb base for your stay in Tokyo. Also the major Shinjuku station is close to the hotel (15-20 mins walking or next stop from Nishi-shinjuku by metro), so in general you will not have any problem to move around the city. The Narita Express from the airport stops at Shinjuku Station, so that an other plus for this hotel.The staff at front desk is very polite and helpful, fast check in and check out.Rooms are small but well distributed and with all the basics for a comfortable stay, with all the amenities you need and even a little fridge to chill your drinks. Everything look clean and in good conditions, functioning without any problem. Just 2 issues, first the AC is to wick, not really enough to cool the room (considering that in summer the temperatures in Tokyo are really warm and steamy, is necessary to improve this point) and the other issue is that the WiFi doesn´t work well in all the room (even it is really small we have to be close to the door or at the bathroom to get well connection), we stayed at 2 different rooms at 11th floor having the same problem... of course at the lobby WiFi runs very fast.If you are in a hurry, there is a coffee shop just at the entrance of the hotel to grab something for breakfast, so that is really convenient and there is a 7eleven a few steps from the hotel with a ATM that accepts international debit cards.Near, at Shinjuku you could find plenty of great options to eat and drink, and at night is full of life. Try the little izacaya at the alleys beside the train bridge for a delicious casual dinner and some beers.In general it was a great stay at Nishitetsu Inn, great value.

The Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku is located very centrally in the Shinjuku area, only 5 minutes walk or so from the West Gate of the Shinjuku station (if you use the overpass foot bridges). The room is a good size for Tokyo. The English website is difficult to use if you want to know what size/number of beds you are getting - I wanted a twin room, but got a double room instead. The bath/shower is spacious and deep (great if you want to have a proper bath).

The hotel is very well located. The room is small, but the bed is very confortable. The wi-fi didn't work well in the bedroom, but it is good in the lobby. We didn't try the breakfast. I can say that is a good hotel to spend a night in Tokyo.

Near to the metro, surrounded by convenience stores, banks and restaurants in the beautiful neighborhood of sky scrapers and parks. The Choco'Cros integrated to the hotel lobby and accessible from 7am to 10pm is a good place for breakfast if you miss the regular time for breakfast.

the room is clean and the staff can speak enough english. it is convenient as there are restaurants and 7-11 and family mart around.it is near MRT too.i would love to come back and stay here again if i come to tokyo again.

Great location just around the corner from a train station, pubs, night spots, restaurants and the business area on the other side as well as gardens as viewing towers. Hotel staff were friendly, the rooms were small but big enough and the queen bed was of good size for my 6'4 frame. Rooms are basic but serviceable with good water pressure in the shower. My only complaint was that the mattress was too hard and meant on some nights I didn't get a great sleep. Finally, I loved the fact they had vending machines with cheap beer and other drinks as well as an ice dispenser that you could use at any time. Given the cost compared to other hotels in the area I think it is great value in a great location if you don't mind an extra firm bed.

For the most part for wanting something basic it was quite interesting. A washing machine on the 7th floor open for everyone with a woman only on a different floor, so I felt like a bachelor in a bachelor apartment building while washing some clothes. LOL. (bring coins) One shopping area and eating area with bars is very close by, but be careful of some since they have a sitting fee per hour. The entrance to the metro is only about five minutes away. The staff was very helpful on trying to help me get to several sites even with some being closed because of the August 15th holiday and events that were happening. They also gave a bit better directions to get to some of the places since many of the metro stations were under repairs and the signs were practically not existent or difficult to find. They also pointed out the local shops. (What is sold in one convenient store has a good chance of not being sold in the others. You may have to be flexible if you want certain drinks or food.)

poor Wi-Fi，room is small，good location，check out time is at 10am which is the earliest I ever experienced. Easy to access subway and very convenient to shopping area and train station. Easy to access the restraint nearby

We chose this hotel for the 5th time because of its position and quality/price but, to be honest, the hotel (the rooms) begins to be a little bit overlooked and for the first time in Japan i found dust and mildew in my room

Good place to stay. Convenient location. Close to railway stations. Hotel services are good. If you can speak little Japanese, you will not face any problem anywhere. Generally Japanese people are very helpful.

Good location, The hotel is 2 min walk from Nishi-Shinjuku station. When coming with suitcases, it is advisable to take this station instead of Shinjuku station which is 8-10 min by walk.There is a Mcdonalds opposite the hotel and 2 convenience stores which help.Not all staff speak English, something to be mindful of.

Good place, good location and rooms are reasonable and spotless. Shinjuku station is nearby and the neon vibe of Shinjuku a short walk.One gripe: we checked into our room 3 hours early and we were quoted 1600 yen extra to do so. The receptionist wrote the amount down for us.... She did not say it was an extra hourly charge. We were charged 4800 for the added convenience which was not explained at the time. I've never paid to check in early before in any hotel and we travel frequently.

Great hotel, clean, professional, very helpful. Excellent location, short walk to the heart of Shinjuku's clubs, restaurants, entertainment strip. The staff were helpful in suggesting sites to visit and see.

Location is good, staff are friendly and helpful. Room and toilet are small but for the price paid, it is good enough. No breakfast but there is a St Marc cafe but staff are not able to communicate in English.

The location, room is bigger than usual hotel in Tokyo, the bed is very comfortable and clean. Staff is very friendly and speak English very well. I really had a good sleep here before next trip to Kyoto.

First time arriving , I would recommend the subway,(Marunouchi line) as its very close to the hotel. Get off at the Nishi-shinjuku station, take exit 1. At the top of the stairs, when your on the sidewalk, turn left, its about 30 meters away on the same side of the street. Look for green sign at 2nd level. The rooms are OK, comfortable bed and pillows, everything works. The window is frosted which is bit dreary, but it does open a crack. The wired in room internet was very fast (not sure about wifi), refrigerator, kettle,tea, supplied, (no safe in room). The TV had no real English channels to speak of, but you can buy a daily movie/ satellite card in the vending machine. There are lots of supermarkets, restaurants and food courts in the abundant malls close by. Shinjuku is not an area of the city I would recommend for tourists, there are many more interesting (and cheaper) alternatives in my opinion but it's a good location if you want to be in/explore Shinjuku.The staff were gracious and spoke English.

This is about a 3 minute walk from Nishi-Shinjuku station. This is actually a plus point, as the station only has one subway line and isn't as confusing as the main Shinjuku station, meaning you won't be walking in circles for an hour trying to find the right exit. It's near the government buildings (Kabuki-Cho and the nightspots are on the other side of Shinjuku station) and you can actually walk to the main Shinjuku station through the network of underground tunnels, should it be pouring.The room is slightly bigger than average, as there is space for you to actually to open a luggage case. The decor is plain but functional. I washed my laundry there as the washing machine would automatically add detergent. The lobby is spacious and bright, so it's a nice experience to check in. Check out is by dropping your card into the box by the elevator in the morning.

The rooms are very clean. not too big, but I heard it is like that in most hotels in Tokyo.Service was great. we even had a bad smell from the bathroom one night and they immediately changed our room no questions asked.The metro is very close which is convenient in Tokyo.There is a 7-11 very close by and some nice cafes for breakfast. There is a laundry room and vending machines for drinks, which is also nice.

I booked a single room for three nights and my experience in this hotel was pretty good. The location is perfect, near the city hall and there are many shopping streets around it. Furthemore, the rail station connects you directly with airport Narita. Subway station is also very well linked with all the city.The only bad things were the little expensive price and the bad wifi power but this problem appears in the rest of the city, not only in the hotel.I highly recommend this hotel!

The Staff was really kind and very helpful. Hotel is in great location, 2 minutes walk from Tokyo Metro (Marunouchi Line) and 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku JR station and east side of Shinjuku. The Single Room was big enough for one person with standard luggages. Room was clean and tidy and all amenities were provided (some at the front desk).

The Staff was really kind and very helpful. Hotel is in a great location, just 2 minutes walk from Tokyo Metro (Marunouchi Line) and 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku JR station and east side of Shinjuku. Single Room was big enough for one person with standard luggages. Room was clean and tidy and all the amenities were alredy provided in the room (some at the front desk).

Stayed here for 5 days and was very comfortable. Various metro stations are within short walking distance. Nice restaurants all around. Comfortable bed, nice bathroom. Small but not that small for the price. Staff very helpful. The breakfast in the basement is pretty good, 1080 yen for a Japanese buffet and limitless coffee.. no fruit though. But kind of dark in the basement. I would suggest Royal Host around the corner near the Hilton for American and Japanese style breakfast for about 1000 yen with lots of coffee refills. McDonalds is across the street, and I tried it once for comparison.. great service and quality up to if not better than US standard. There is an amazingly good soba noodles restaurant out the door to the right (100% pure buckwheat noodles), and a super good ramen restaurant in the metro station to the right as well. I would definitely stay here again.

Great location , clean, rooms were a bit small but this is common in Tokyo, would recommend it, staff was really helpful kept our bags, send our bags to Kyoto , great , best was location so close to shinjuku station

Very clean , very smart room , polite employees, near metro station Nishi-Shinjuku. Nice coffee inside to have a breakfast before to begin the wonderful adventure of Tokyo. No deficiencies. Alessandro

Great localisation close to metro and train station, 7/11 right on your dorstep. Rooms small but after reading reviews I excpected smaller room and was positively suprised. Bed linen changed daily as well as towels. Highly recomended for the price paid.

We stayed here for the 3 days while exploring Tokyo, and were very happy with the experience. The room was big compared to the typical Japanese size, and represented good value. The bathroom was excellent and clean, room was well equipped. Free wi-fi was very useful indeed, and the bed was big and comfy - all in all, everything you need.The staff were also exceptionally helpful and friendly - i would recommend this place to anyone.

Small room but tidy. Very friendly and helpful staff. Walking distance from Shinjuku-station and from there you can go anywhere =). Very nice breakfastrestaurant in the basement (Teke-Teke), not included in the hotelprice, but a authentic japanese breakfast buffet.

This is my 2nd time staying in this hotel. I do love the location and the fact that it is so affordable. It is located at most 10 minutes away from shinjuku Jr. Station. There is a st. Marc cafe located on the checked-in floor, a 2-stories ¥100 (shop name is 'can do') right next door, 1 medium size 7-11 and a small size Lawson on the left. The best part is that the police station is just a Road across-100% safe and secured. The staffs were friendly and prompt with our calls. Eg: we called for extra towels and within 5 minutes, they were at the door! The down part with this hotel is that the room was pretty tiny but well, this doesn't bother us as long as you adopt a systematic approach to retrieving your personal stuffs from the luggage.Checking in took me merely 5 minutes and checking out took me 5s. Will DEFINTELY come back to stay again.

Great location! 5 minutes walk from shinjuku station.The staff was very kind and helpful.The overall feel was Clean and Organized hotel.It was very easy for me to get almost anywhere I needed in Tokyo from this location.The only downside I can think about this hotel is that the check out was early in 10:00But overall I think it's a great choice for tourists in Tokyo.

Very clean! Great Lobby the staff were ever so helpful. There is a yummy little cafe down stairs too. The rooms are small but hey it's Tokyo. It was comfortable enough and we really didn't spend much time in the room any way. The pillows were the best I have had in any hotel room. I usually get headaches if I don't bring my own but they put a layer of beads or something on the bottom which you can remove if you don't want the pillow too firm. Shinjuku station is a 10 minute walk but there is a station directly out the front of the hotel. So handy but we really enjoyed the walk to Shinjuku station anyway. I would definitely stay here again. Great value for money!

This is a really good place to stop over in Tokyo. Its near the Nishi Shinjuku station on the Marunouchi line- 1 stop from Shinjuku. If you come by JR it's probably easier to walk (unless it's raining and you donm't know which exit to take). The staff were good on check in. We checked in and checked out- otherwise had no contact. The bathroom was good- shower and bath- the room big enough by Japan standards- there was a kettle, free Wi-Fi, fridge- green tea bags supplied. Vending machines on some floors. Laundry facilities and plenty of OK places to eat. We tried the restaurant on B1- it's more of a bar with food that a sit down meal. I would stay here again.

Its a good location in Tokyo, a short walk from Shinjuku station and very close to Nishi shinjuku station. It is 10 minutes walk from all Shinjuku shopping and Kabuchiko. The hotel is clean and felt safe. The customer service is excellent and they cope well with english speaking tourists. The single room is small but the bed was very generous and the bathroom, while also small, is very functional. I am over 6 feet I could still take a bath. The only downside would be the airconditioning which I am not sure could cope with a hot humid day. This was a great place for me to stay and I would recommend it, especially to first time visitors.

This place did what it said it would do: small, well designed rooms. I get the feeling it's meant more for business trippers than tourists. There were plenty of staff but they werent very enthusiastic and they didnt speak much english. But rooms were clean, and the location is great - a minute away from the underground and five minutes walk from the hubbub of shinjuku. Good internet, peaceful.

Good service of front desk staff. Some daily use stuff is not available in room, i dont know when I arrived. it is better to remind me in advance.Hotel is near Shinjuku Station and easy to find the loaction. I will choose this hotel next time.

The hotel was ok for the price you pay. Close to the middle of Shinjuku. Only issues was the bed was hard and the wifi in our room didn't work that well. Maybe a room closer to the lift may be closer to the wifi box. But the wifi in the lobby was perfect.

Customer services were excellent, room facilities are acceptable, reasonable with the room rate. Only one thing that can be improved is the bed a bit hard, if it can be changed to softer ones would be great.

Hotel should have been very easy to find as it was 2 minutes from the subway station but the English sign was so small we walked by it twice. The room was very small, the bathroom reminded me of the toilet in the airplane, a plastic shell! To be honest we booked this hotel again for the last two days of our trip but the thought of staying here again had me running and searching for a new hotel, which we found. The staff was ok, check in was easy.

A rather good hotel, clean, comfortable at really very well placed near shinjuku station (for JR and metro and other lines) (about 10 mn by walk) and less than 100m from the Nishi-Shinjuku metro station entrance by foot (that is connected to shinjuku also)The hotel is surrounded by commercials such as seven eleven and many others... (small restaurants in the street, even one Mac Donald's nearby), etc... this street is busy.My room was pretty small and this is japanese style... but everything was working well. My bed (mattress) was a bit hard anyway...Price is acceptable.In the same building, you have a little nice restaurant at B1F for breakfast : TekeTeke, with typical japanese food in the morning.There is a laundry service and massage.This hotel is a very good choice if you want to be near Shinjuku.

Too hot inside the room and poor ventilation made me suffocated and also after bath. No temperature setting by customer. I only felt better to open the window to breathe. Never stay here again. Could not imagine if I stay in summer. Poor wifi. could not get it inside the room. It is good I had my own wifi egg.

Clean, quiet, efficient, approximately 15 minutes to walk from Shinjuku Station West Exit. Far from the flashing neon lights and noise in Shinjuku East Side.The single room size was above average for Tokyo standards, with space to put your luggage, and the bed was comfortably wide.The only drawback is the early check out at 10 AM, and a late check in at 3 PM.

Come to this hotel ,clean rooms great staff room was amazing no issues and free wifi . Close to get bus from airport which nearest point is Hilton hotel :) which is only 5 min walk to this hotel :) 15 mins to walk to Shinjuku station which isn't bad if you enjoy walking.

Very good location, close to Shinjuku Station and quiet. There is coffee shop on ground floor and restaurant in basement. Also there is 7-11, Watson and even McDonald's within few meters. If you need to do laundry there are coin laundromats on some floors.

I recently stayed here with my partner and it was so terrible that I honestly don't even want to remember by writing it. But hopefully people read this review so that some decide not to stay. I went there with my foreign partner but the introduction was the worst. There was a stranded family when we were checking in. Unfortunately, we understood the situation and felt very angry by the way the hotel was handling the problems. Basically they were racist and we felt very uncomfortable not just because we loath racism but my partner is from their country. We thought the general manager (?) was not helpful and blaming the situation on foreigners in general. If we didn't have so much luggage and had more money and time, we would have left to look for another place. The room was just ok - typical Japanese small place with no soul. Wifi was not working well in our room and because the lobby was not a place to hang out, we had to go look for a place to use the Internet. Not worth the money at all. This place was a true shame for Japan. I mean, no hospitality nor technology? It completely ruined our anniversary and we wished we never went there.

This is a good-quality big hotel located in Shinjuku district - 10 minutes walk to Shinjuku Railway Station or just 3 minutes walk to local subway line.It was wierd to get to the hotel for the first time because Shinjuku station is huge and when you finally come out, you have to use google maps to find the hotel. And google maps a little bit incorrect about the location.Everything was great - reception, rooms. They have a smoke booth in the lobby. Many shops nearby. No breakfast included but you can eat downstairs at a small cafe just right in the lobby.The only drawback I found - they to not provide rent of AC adaptors. You can buy it at the reception for 600 yen.

The hotel is in a great location, but keep in mind it is mostly designed for travelers on the go or businessmen. Rooms are very tiny. This is a good place if you're here on business and just need a place to sleep. The wifi was not that strong in the roms, it is stronger in the lobby. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

I found the room quite large compared to the other hotels I stayed at throughout Japan. Definitely more than enough room for a solo traveler. Quiet, exceptionally clean, with various amenities in the building including laundry. Half a block from Nishi-Shinjuku station; about 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku station and 10-15 from Kabuki-cho and Golden Gai. Cafe downstairs. No complaints whatsoever.

So convenient to everything. Clean. Quiet. Had everything you need while away. Be aware the rooms are small as its in the heart of things. That said it was fine for 2 of us for 4 nights. The cafe down in foyer was lovely and the staff very friendly

Stayed there for my first night in Tokyo. Modern and in a great location (5-7min walk from Shinjuku station - although if you are arriving at night and are dropped off at the station, it is not so easy to find...). Check in was very smooth, and the staff were very pleasant. Free maps available at the lobby. The room was small but comfortable, and included a small fridge, a TV and towels. Wifi worked great throughout the whole hotel. Overall did the trick for the first night, and was very well located in Shinjuku.

3 minutes walk from nishi-shinjuku station and 12 minutes walk from shinjuku station. The room was quite compact but good for our needs, very clean and tidy. There is a coffee shop on the lobby floor, the staff was very helpful and the price is reasonable.

A pleasant hotel, but the rooms are very small.I recently stayed here for a week and i first chose a smoking room, but i quickly swapped to non-smoking, the smoking rooms stank!!! the walls were yellow too!The non-smoking room was much more acceptable. If you're only staying for a few nights, then this hotel is perfect, but don't stay here for a week, a window looking out onto a brick wall, gets to you after a while.Starbucks, Mc Donalds were both very close and Shinjuku was a 5 minute walk away

We found this Inn to be very modern, clean and has coin operated laundry facilities. The rooms are very small but the fantastic location made up for that. We were within walking distance to the Shinsabashi area. This area is great for shopping and restaurants. Part of the area is covered so you can shop and eat even if the weather is not cooperating. Make sure to walk around at night and see all the lights. If you are looking for beautiful Japanese dishes go to the Dogu Market.

Nothing to point out about my room.The street outside is very busy, so there are convenience stores and 100yen shops nearby.I chose to walk there from the Shinjuku Station. Do NOT do that if you have luggage, the overpasses are nightmares.Mind that the checkout time is 10am.

Good price, very close to Shinjuku Station, so excellent communicated. We did not include breakfast in our room, but there is a cafeteria in front of the lobby with good prices.There are a lot of restaurant near the hotel as well as 7eleven or Family martBad WIFI in room.

Lost my mobile phone in the train. Staff very helpful in contacting train station in getting my phone back.Hotel location is very convenient, nice cafe at lobby & room is clean. Will recommend friend to stay at this hotel.

Great value! Fabulous location just a short block to Nishi Shinjuku station from which we could get to any place in the city via an easily navigable subway system. Very clean, well maintained, several places to eat nearby, nice to have the 7-11 nearby for convenience items and international ATM. Bed wasn't soft enough for us so we were grateful for extra pillows provided by front desk.

The hotel is about 7 min walk from Shinjuku station, the heart of Tokyo, easy to access transport. However, my room is quite.Beautiful lobby, friendly reception(from checking in to picking up the suitcase), well equipped hotel...... make me feel comfortable.Shame to book another hotel for the rest of days in Tokyo.Strongly recommend this hotel.

Nice Location near Subway and convenience storesRoom is small but clean and comfortablewe can deposit our luggage before check in and after check out we can walk to Tokyo metropolitan government building which is very good for the runner of TOKYO Marathon

nearby the shinjuku station,just about ten minutes. it's very easy to find way to any place in Tokyo and near city.附近便利店多，有药妆店，小田急百货，bic camera等等，离原宿涉谷等日本潮流地带也很近，总之出去玩，交通便利很重要，可以忽略他房间小不含早餐等缺点，和所有的连锁店一样，麻雀虽小，五脏俱全，10点check out，可以寄存行李，，，，，

The hotel location are great, just 2 minutes walk from Exit 2 Metro Minorouchi Line and 10 Minutes Walk from JR Shinjuku Station West Exit. The room are good, compact, clean, with some amenities and toiletries. Breakfast are serve with additional price. We can early booking with additional budget. There's a great coffee shop inside the hotel and 7-11 store and 100 coin store just a walk away from the hotel. Its good to stay here

comfortable but wifi is not workable at room, i need to use myself rent wifiLocation is good but still some distance from JR shijuku Station, it needs about 10~15 mins to walk to main StationOverall, this is good hotel,

I stayed here for around a week at the end of a long trip across Asia. The location of the hotel was excellent- it is in the heart of Shinjuku and very near to the Golden Gai- an area with lots of very nice restaurants. I mostly got around using the Tokyo metro (which was very easy to do despite speaking no Japanese) and the Nishi-Shinjuku tube station was very nearby and made getting around Tokyo very easy. There are also many of convenience stores near the hotel and the hotel has a very nice cafe. Also of note is the 100 yen shop nearby which sold surprisingly good umbrellas which were invaluable as I visited during typhoon season.The room was fairly small but a good size given the location of the hotel and it was comfortable. The staff were pleasant and helpful though I didn't have a great deal of interaction with them and they were able to get me my room a few hours earlier then the normal check in time. I would happily recommend this hotel, I had a comfortable stay and the hotel was in a good location.

This hotel is really simple and nice.Clean, friendly staff and good breakfast. The location is not really close to downtown but you can easily move with subway and train station is really 5 minutes walking, so no problems.Not that excited but it was an easy stay.

Nice hotel, good acommodations, ac was not as could as expected, but overral good place to stay, shinjuku station is very close as the shinjuku downtown, check out is kind of early but this seems to be the standard in Tokyo

Absolutely excellent hotel with wonderful service and very hospitable staff. The price was amazing and the room was more than adequate. Great bath tub as well! I will return here on my next visit. Fantastic stay!

The hotel was conveniently located across from the Nishishinjuku stop for the Maronuchi line, and the JR Shinjuku Station was a 5 minute walk away. Staff were friendly and eager to help, the cost of the room was in line with expectations, and there were a lot of places to eat and shop - also very close to the Robot Restaurant! Only negative being the bathroom was on the small side, and there was no breakfast service... however the izakaya downstairs had a Japanese-style breakfast buffet every morning.

Good location just 1 mins walk to subway but room too small for 2 people with big luggage! Inside hotel have laundry room and it's cheap Front on this hotel can speak English too cafe under hotel too tasty

Very centrally located in Shinjuku, the hotel is very clean and convenient. Room and bathroom were big enough for me. The staff is very professional, friendly, helpful and efficient. I would book again at Nishitetsu Inn, despite the very weak internet connection in the room.

Stayed here for 2 nights in a tiny single-room which was practically furnished, except enough place to hang-up your coats etc.Bed was very comfortable, healthy pillow to sufficiently support your neck.Mini-bathroom but fitted with Shiseido-products, like shower-gel, shampoo, conditioner.Very good hairdryer inside drawer of desk beneath window.Individual temperature setting of A/C not possible. Very warm in winter, but too warm for most people from the West. Had to switch it off during night.Staff very friendly and helpful.Cafe´ inside entrance hall of the hotel, good for a quick breakfast.

Great location, about a 5 - 10 minute walk to the town Centre of Shinkjuku and exceptionally close to the great Isetan food court and shopping precinct. 10 min walk from JR Shinjuku Stn. Close to a Lawsons Natural where you can buy Studio Ghibli tickets. Close to other hotels in order to catch the Airport Limo to the International Terminal. Great, efficient staff. Quick check in and check out. Quiet on all floors (even near the elevator), no presence of smoke in the hallways. Baggage hold for entire stay.Sufficient room in a double standard room. Clean and modern facilities. Larger than expected bathroom and also modern! Good lighting system. Breakfast provided at the lovely cafe downstairs. Great value for money at ~$150 AUD a night!A great place to stay, highly recommended!

Stayed at this hotel during New Years for 2 nights. The location is very convenient as it is just next to Nishi-Shinjuku subway station and also a short 10 min walk to the Shinjuku station. Didn't have any breakfast.Was visiting my friend in Tokyo and just needed a place to sleep. Good thing about this hotel was that the check in was lightning fast. Also lots of electrical sockets and excellent wifi. Fairly clean room (except some chocolate paper trash stuck behind the desk and a stained bed cover).Only bad thing was that my non-smoking room smelled quite smoky. Had to open the window during night which solved the problem. I don't bother too much about it, but can imagine others do. Would also be nice to have some face cream or similar for amenities. The "do-not-disturb-sign" is attached to the door by magnet I think, so it took me a little while to figure out where it was ^^

I am new to staying in Japan as an American from the USA. The room was neat and clean. It was a bit small compared to what I am used to. The water was good to drink and the shower pressure was good. The hotel was near public transportation and food.

Service is good. Location is good. It was a very pleasant experience. At first I was worried that it is far from Shinjuku JR station, but then I found out it was really not that far as I thought. Of course it is very convenient if I take the Marunouchi line.

The room was rather small with only enough room for the bed. Good luck lying your suitcase out to unpack! The bathroom was very basic and felt like a camper van. The front desk was pleasant, location very good.

Great for business, in the business portion of ShinjukuExcellent location in quiet location, near a busy area.Surprisingly good café downstairsVery helpful staffDull interiorSmall roomLimited EnglishWeak and bouncing wifi in room

Stayed here for 3 nights in a double room. The room was so small we had no room to move and no where to put 2 suitcases and the bed was also small. The hall ways were very low but the cost of the hotel is cheap which is good as its close to Shinjuku Station and main strip.

Nearby office buildings. Besides that, it is really close by Shinjuku station and there are many restaurants within a 5~10 min walk. Hotel room was good but only one pillow if you are travelling alone.

Staff speak good English and were very helpful. Room was a bit small but expected in Tokyo area. Location was very close to the metro and convenience stores. Cleanliness, location and facilities was top dollar. The only downfall was the internet connection
