Celine C
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: From the reviews and pictures on this page, I can tell that this hotel is of good quality despite its low prices. But I want to know more regarding the room policy here. I am a high school student planning to travel to Tokyo with my friends during our summer break, and I was wondering if the twin room could be shared by 4 people. Will there be extra charges? We are on a tight budget, so if any of you have other suggestions, please feel free to comment. Thanks :)

Reasonable hotel at low cost with a great location. However, if you're frequent user on the JR line, you might want to stay somewhere nearer. It's a 10-15mins walk to the JR line. However, the metro line is just nearby. Room is clean and not as small as some describe. One of the biggest bed for single user. Reserved a non-smoking room and it's really pleasant without smoke smell unlike the previous reviews which made me had doubt when making a reservation. Do make online reservation for a cheaper price. Needs to work on the WiFi though. living on the 10th floor and couldn't connect at all... only once did I successfully connect through my 9 days stay. Staffs are polite and helpful with your doubts and request.

The hotel deserves better scores than the current one! In a strategic position in Shinjuku, where you find whatever you need at whatever time of the day, close to the most connected underground/train station of Tokyo but relaxingly away from the infinite mess of kabuki-cho. The rooms are equipped with everything you need (washlet <3), the guys at the reception speak a good English (quite rare in Tokyo) and everything is super clean. Only bad point: it misses a huge hall with sofas for relaxation and (my room) missed a proper closet (but I was on a discount price, so...)

Located very close to the Shinjuku train station, and lots of restaurants. Clean, tidy and comfortable room. Not very spacious but fine if all you need is a place to sleep. Front staff were helpful and nice cafe in the foyer

I 'm happy to find Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku, for 8 days with good services and nice price for Tokyo. Good situation, next Shinjuku station and nice staff for help and informations. I must return in Tokyo the next year, and I'll try to rent another room in your Inn .Thank very much, and happy new year 2016

Sons partner pre-booked for us being Japan first timers for four nights and was well suited to our modest (budget) likings. Conveniently situated to lots of transport options and would be happy to stay again in the future. Cafe eatery downstairs but lots of close by options. The rooms were tidy and clean and had a laundry on level 7 but you can them to do your laundry if you choose.

Our 7-day stay at this Inn was comfortable & without mishap. The front office staff were helpful in letting us keep our baggages in their office before check-in as we arrived on an early morning flight. Overall, everyone was efficient & accommodating even though some front office staff speak only a smattering of English. The rooms were nice and warm even on the coldest night we were there which was 3 degrees Celcius.

I stayed in a single non smoking room which was comfortable and quiet and just enough space for a solo traveler. Located in a quieter part of Shinjuku, with a few local amenities. I stayed for a quick overnight arriving at 2am and leaving by 8am so didn't get to see the hotel and check on it's amenities.

The hotel is 8 minutes walk from Shinjuku station and of adequate size (I booked a normal double room). Service is superb and decor is new. Everything is very clean. We had a very nice stay with good sleep.We can check in at 2pm and the check out process takes only seconds, to save time for our morning flight.

Nishitetsu inn is located in Nishi-Shinjuku, a 5 minute walk from the subway station and only one station away from Shinjuku Station, all around there are numerous restaurants and shops.The rooms are spacious (in Japanese standards), sparkling clean, comfortable and, as usual, well equipped (Wi-Fi, TV, kettle for making hot drinks and so on)There is a coffee shop with excellent prepared food and drink and an Isakaya (Japanese pub) on the hotel premises, the Isakaya also offers breakfast for extra charge. The staff is very friendly and speaks English, there is also a possibly to have your clothes dry cleaned for a fee. On the downside: the hotel and its services are quite pricy (Tokyo after all), there is no closet and if you bring a lot of luggage you might have a problem finding a place for it in the room.All in all Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku is an excellent accommodation option and as such receives and coveted rating on 9 on the Daniel scale.
user_name:
Daniel B
Tel Aviv District, Israel

review_body: I was pleased to return to the Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku. I love this hotel as its easy to access by transfering to the Maurrichi Line M - Nishi Shinjuku Stop. Away from the madness of Shinjuku station but very close to all the action. Been here in December 2twice the hotel is a little too warm for my comfort so I travel with a mini fan. Hotel is very clean, rooms are small, you can open the window to get a flow of air. Staff is very friendly, Laundry on site! Lots of things to do around the hotel. This is my Hotel to stay in Shinjuku without braking the bank. Would stay again! Wifi is now available in all rooms and not just the lobby!Thanks for a great stay!

Only 5-8mins from the Shinjuku JR station.Good to hv convenience store and coffee shop at G/FIt is opposite to police station ,sometimes there will be alarming at night. But still okay if you close the window.

It had everything you needed for a solo holiday trip with a quality room and accessory items. The hotel is also very close to the subway and train station and ample food shops are within walking distance.

I must say that it was an excellent hotel, nice staff, clean rooms, spacious and with lots of conforts. Beds are huge and cozy, the toilet, although is small, it has a lot of commodities. It is an ideal place of town with lots of train stations not dar away

Although typically small room known around Japan and a little difficulty to house 2 luggage comfortably, it is highly recommended for its clean and affordable room around the area of Shinjuku. Train station is just a around a 10mins walk.

We traveled by train and had trouble working out just which way to walk so we caught a taxi - best 720 yen I spent in Japan. The rooms were fine but we found the room temp too hot - so much so that m husband found it difficult to sleep. Service was great and the staff very helpful. Location was good and not far from te train station after all.

Good hotel, close to train station, 5 minutes walk. Quiet rooms.Breakfast was ok. Good room, comfortable bed, ac you can adjust (november), internet worked well, friendly staff, clean. Close to reastaurants and supermarket.

I stayed here for three nights, had a wonderful time, staff were very helpful, took time out to help me navigate the Japanese universal studio site. It's located next to a train station (nishi-shinjuku just take the marunouchi line) so makes getting around very easy. Cafe downstairs was perfect for breakfast each morning

The biggest problem with this hotel is its location, it is a good 10 - 15 minute walk from the Shinjuku JR train station. It is not intuitive to find on foot either. In addition unlike most hotels I have stayed in Japan, there are few restaurant and retail choices here, other than the ubiquitous convenience stores.The hotel is a typical business hotel with tiny rooms and the usual amenities. The staff is very pleasant and efficient and the cafe downstairs has good coffee!

clean ,comforable .feeling good and the bed size is big .but a little bit hard .very good service but the location is not far ,every day need walk around 10 mins anyway , i will come next time . and good price

The check in staff was so friendly and helpful. I got a clea big room with comfy bed and with a window and also a nice bathroom.Slept very well in the bed.You can get good cake, ice and other snacks and also hot and cold drinks at the Cafe next to the lobby.The Hotel ist in a good location, just a short walk to the subway and you have some restaurants, stores and shops around the hotel.Will come back again :)

near Shinjuku Station,nice service and suite room type.It is easy to get there by Tokyo Metro Nishi Shinjuku Station.I recommond this hotel for vistors.reasonable price.Best location.Near 7-11,family market

Really great location as there is a subway station just a block from the hotel, and a quick walk to where all the action is. If you're worried about staying around Kabukicho due to it being a red light district, I wouldn't worry too much. The hotel itself was very nice and quite large. The room was definitely the biggest I've stayed in, in my couple of trips to Japan. This may be because we had to choose a twin room (No others were available at the time). But it was nice and clean with the amenities you'll need.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room was too hot. Aircon did not work so we had to sleep with the window open all night with a lot of noise from the cars outside. The room was not the cheapest category so the size worked fortwo persons.

Nice location only a 5 to 10 minute walk from shinjuku train stations south gate,Internet speeds insane for free WiFi 50mb/ps, friendly staff, vending matches available for drinks, launderette facilities available

We selected the hotel because it was not too expensive and because it was conveniently located close to Shinjuku station and a couple of metro stations. It is by no means a luxury hotel; it is quite small with small but clean rooms. Wifi was really fast. In Tokio good hotels are quite expensive so this was a bit below the quality we would select in most European cities. The price did not include breakfast, but there were many good breakfast options close by. There was also a nice izakaya (" Japanese gastro pub") in the cellar of the building, with good grilled food, good sake and beer. The restaurant was frequented by local businessmen. There was also an English menu available.

Where else can you find a $85 hotel room near to Shinjuku that is safe, comfy, clean. Small yes but you just need comfy space for the night when most of the time you are out sightseeing. If you like large rooms, lots of cupboard space, spacious bathroom, big cafe, this hotel is not for you.The nishishinjuku station on the maronouchi line is just 50m away or if you dont mind a walk the west exit of Shinjuku station is about 12mins. I have tried other small hotels in Tokyo but this one is my preferred. There is a nice little st marc's cafe at the lobby for your caffeine fix and sweet tooth. Great pastries they serve for breakfast.

Clean rooms with good service in a great location, 5 mins walk away from the main hub of bars and eateries. Aside from this, also a good location from the main station, which is again 5 mins away. Only downside is check in for the hotel is at 3pm which is the latest we have experienced in Japan. Value for money at this hotel with a useful 7 eleven next door.

So this is not a luxury hotel. It's not midrange. But if you're travelling on a budget this place is hard to beat. I paid less than $80 USD a night and it's in the heart of Shinjuku. Be sure you get a non-smoking room as the smoking floors smell like a bingo hall in Thunder Bay circa 1962. But it's clean and the included Japanese breakfast is excellent. Also a good western-style cafe in lobby. Rooms are teeny tiny but you get a bathtub and an electronic toilet.

The rooms are small but super clean and efficient. The hotels location cant be beat, Shinjuku is 10 mins walking and Nishishinjuku is like 1 minute. That being said... The beds are hard. And I mean like the floor might be softer hard. What a shame. You need a good nights rest after all that walking and then you have to come to rock hard beds. Other than that the water is hot with amazing pressure, free tea, blowdryer and clothes refresher.

Stayed four nights in the Shinjuku in whilst being in Tokyo.The Inn is centrally located a 8 min walk from the Shinjuku train station (take exit 13 and walk in West direction).The rooms are rather small (Japan) but very functional and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. I told the recption that house keeping shall not disturb me as I stayed in European Time Zone. Worked out very well and new towels were delivered right in front of my door all day. There are several vending machines on tenth floor, 7/11 and Family Mart as well as Mc Donalds are just next door.Given the location and the price you pay, you should definitively go for this hotel!

I went for a weekend in Tokyo after my trip in Osaka. I booked this hotel for a good price, considering its location, which is near the shinjuku station. It also has a Mc Donalds in front of the hotel, I think its 24hours, not sure thought. I got a problem with my laptop and had to use their computer. The staff were very helpful. They can keep your lugagge if needed. The room is big compared to another hotels in Japan and its very clean and quietly.

Loved this hotel in terms of the location - close to Shinjuku station, less than a 10 min walk. Also really close to the Kabukicho district. Rooms were fairly spacious for a hotel in Tokyo! Will definitely recommend friends and family to stay here.

It is in a quiet location but near enough for a walk to the Shinjuku station and shopping areas. Staff are helpful. The rooms are small but comfy enough for 2 persons. It is a no smoking hotel but there is a smoking room at Tully's coffee shop in the ground floor.

I was very pleased with this hotel where we stayed 11 nights during my recent trip to Japan.I stayed in the room with facilities for disabled with one daughter and my other daughter had a single adjoining room.Room was immaculate and remained so for all of our stay. It was a good size especially for Japan. Beds were a little hard but ok. I asked for an extra pillow.The bathroom was very roomy and easy access with plenty of grab rails throughout. Very deep bath available but I used the shower (not over bath) which was easy to use. Shower stool provided.We went to the cafe downstairs most mornings for a chocolate croissant and 711 close by as was the 100 yen shop - excellent!Hotel very close to station and we used trains everywhere. As we were 3 women we used the women's only carriage which was less crowded, also had wheelchair area.The hotel area is excellent as it is close to everywhere by train. Trains are cheap and very plentiful.There is a coin operated laundromat which was very handy.

The Hotel is very good situated in Shinjuku. It is about 10 minutes walk away from the shinjuku station and 2 minutes away from another metro station. The room was clean and had everything i needed. The most important thing was the very friendly and helpful stuff at the reception. The hotel has a good price / value relation.

Good business style hotel. Polite, respectful staff, quick check in, very relaxed atmosphere, no unnecessary attention, I felt very good as no one bothered me. Room was decent size, very clean, good value for money. Good location, minutes away from the metro, also very close to lots of restaurants and bars, I was very pleased with this hotel.

Apart from poor signage in English,a good-value,well-located hotel.Room was a good size for Tokyo.Very good breakfast in basent and good value at a little over 1000 yen.Hotel is clean and very well run.

I travelled alone and stayed for 6 nights at this hotel. The staff go above and beyond what they are paid to do. Service 11/10. Nice clean hotel rooms. Only problem is that there is only 3 washing machines for males and 3 for females to be shared amongst all hotel guests.

stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, very nice service, convenient location just ard 8-10 minutes walk to the shinjuku station, quite clean, this is a coffee shop downstairs and a convenience store nearby

Very good choice, as for value for money. Drawbacks are the small rooms (all rooms in Tokyo are small though). Very polite staff, ready to help. A bit more knowledge of english wouldn't have been a bad idea. Next to cheap shops for food and to a tube station!

Very good,well-located hotel.Friendly and efficient staffOnly problem was poor exterior signage in English.Very close to Nishi-Shinjuku Metro station.l-and Police Station!Good value and I would return.

Good location descent room,was hard to find hotel because their name not properly displayed in English, location is good , room internet is good, accessible any time , they should provide power adaptor

Clean room nice service near station a bit walk to jr about 10mins Value for money staff can speak English well Room with foot massage machine never since before Thanks for staff patience and nice sevice Good to stay

Clean rooms, good positioning. Quiet but yet in the centre of Shinjuku. Spacious enough for Tokyo, very good price quality. If you are sick of rice and sushi for breakfast, in the hotel there is a French bar where you can get coffee and croissant. shinjuku station is at walking distance, and metro stops the other side of the road. We would return to this place.

Adored the location! Not so centrally located that you'd be pressed into tight corners with crowds and the like but not far off that you'd miss out on what Shinjuku has to offer. About an 5-8 minute walk to/from Shinjuku Station. I liked the professional aspect of the staff members, who spoke relatively good English (all had a basic understanding and some spoke it very well) and they have two on-site dining options: an underground restaurant and ground floor coffee shop/cafe. The room was neat and clean, exactly what I was looking for. I'm not too fussed about room sizing (as I'm used to London and Paris offering compact spaces) but I know others might be. Very local to Konbini (Convenience Stores) (but when aren't you in Japan?). They allowed me to keep my luggage there when I checked out which is always a BIG plus from me!

The location is perfect for a short stopover in Tokyo. Best to get there from Haneda airport via the airport limousine bus (the package with the one-day subway pass is a good deal), get off at Hilton Tokyo (Shinjuku) and it's a 5-minute walk. Alternatively you can take the subway and the hotel is a very short walk from the Nishi-Shinjuku station. Shinjuku and Shibuya are just a few subway stations away when you want to explore the city.As Tokyo hotels go, the room is reasonable is size, very clean and quiet (room facing inner courtyard). Our package did not come with free breakfast but there's a Family Mart and a few eating places nearby. It did come with free wifi in the room.Staff is very friendly, no problem communicating with English, and very professional. A very good experience.

convenient location, english conversation is fine, transfer/receive luggage service is also good if you want to visit other place nearby Tokyo few days. no breakfast but some lawson and 7-11 around here that you can get breakfast there.

Well Tokyo hotels are not exactly cheap especially not in this location, but considering everything it's well located 2 Mins from the Subway and several places to eat are available too. It's also in walking distance of the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building where you can enjoy a free view over Tokyo. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is perfectly satisfying for a 3 star hotel.

One night in Tokyo. Super easy to find very smooth check in staff all extremely helpful. Needed to have my suitcase held after check out for the day this was very easy and very helpful. Rooms are a little bit older style but really not a problem at all

I visited Tokyo with my friend one week ago and this hotel was our safe haven after a long day of walking around the different areas of the city.We stayed in a twin deluxe room (non-smoking). The room was fitted with lightswitches for the three room lights, two power sockets, a settable alarm clock and the control for the air conditioning all in a small board between the beds so they were easy to use comfortably.There's also a water heater to make tea and a foot massaging machine in the room, which are both great after a long and exhausting day!Toilet had a bidet function as is typical in Japan. Shower was fine also, although a little too low for us tall Europeans. Body Soap, Conditioner and Shampoo are all provided.The Roomservice would come every day unless you put a sign out that said you didn't want it. They clean up the room and bring fresh towels and packs of green tea to make with the water heater.We always had breakfast in the little Café that's practically built into the Hotel lobby; good food, very friendly staff. We sometimes had dinner in the excellent Teke Teke restaurant under the Hotel (reachable via the Hotel Elevators, although we recommend taking the main entrance in front of the hotel as it is more likely they'll notice you there). Food is amazing and the Japanese atmosphere is really great too.Location of the Hotel is next to a convenience store and really close to the Shinjuku train station west entrance; which is really useful.All in all I loved this Hotel and would definitely recommend it.

The hotel provided excellent service from the front counter to room service. The deluxe twin room was spacious and the bathroom had more than enough space. The location of the hotel was excellent as well from a short walk to Shinjuku and the train stations.

exit 1, nishi-shinjuku, subway, red colour, M07. Go straight ahead on left hand 2 minute. small toothbrush and toothpaste. no water bottle but can drink from faucets in shower room (message on plate).

I stayed here on the last night of a three week road/rail trip across Japan, and I was blown away by the hotel and the location. It is only five minutes walk from Shinjuku and the busiest station in the world.. Shinjuku Central Railway Station. Where do I start?? Well to begin with, if it is night-time then you head straight into Shinjuku central, which is the place you see in movies with all of the billboards and lights. If you are after the quiet backstreets of rural Japan stay clear. This is an anthropologists delight with all manner of Bohemian types parading around the maze of streets. The choice of restaurants is almost endless and the psychedelic lights mesmerising. You should wander for a while taking in the sights before you settle in for a meal. There is even a fruit market if you want a vegetarian meal. I am not a big fan of the urban, over-populated city, but this is different; an experience not to be missed.Back at the hotel everything is really nice and comfortable. It is on a busy street so ask for a back room say about 5-6th floor, but don't fuss too much as the street noise is not that bad. Most of the traffic is on foot and I did not hear any trains. If you are in Tokyo for the trip home then you are well placed near the station to get either the train or the transfer coach to the airport. I went down the night before I departed and pre-paid for my ride by coach just outside Shinjuku station. That guaranteed me a seat on the bus for the time I booked. I recommend you do the same.

We stayed at this hotel for only one night before heading to Hakone. The room was decently large (at least by Tokyo standard). It's really close to Shinjuku station and is in a nice and quiet area. The staff were really helpful and let us store our bags for two days.

As the title says, it ticks all the 3Cs for a one night stay in Tokyo. It is a 5-10 minute walk from Shinjuku station, and it is close to many restaurants and shops. Most hotels in Tokyo have a check-in of 3pm, but by paying 1000 yen/hour, you can check-in a little bit earlier. Otherwise, the check-in process was quick and efficient, friendly staff who communicated with good English, the room was bigger than other similarly budgeted hotels, and the bathroom was a typical Japanese tub for averaged height Japanese people! Alas, it was clean, quiet and suited all the needs for an overnight stay.

This is a rather basic hotel, but it has everything one needs (good wifi, easy to use laundry machines, good location, helpful staff). If you are looking for a sensible, easy, reliable solution look no further!

Clean rooms, friendly staff, room (kettle/tea, shampoo, lotion, toothbrushes, bottled water, gowns, slippers). 2min from subway, easy walk to Shinjuku. Coffee samples in room would have been nice too.

Good location and clean room. Room is small as expected. Shower is good.Staff are nice but limited English .Didn't try their breakfast , Because McDonald is just opposite of the hotel.Will definitely stay again .

Hotel was a bit further from things than we thought but most were within walking distance for us, and the hotel was opposite a Metro station for everything else. Quiet room and, compared to other Tokyo hotels, a reasonable size too.Good wifi connection for planning our daytrips and decent cafe at the entrance for breakfast.Free baggage storage the day you check out if you have a late flight.

Good location by Shinjuku, rooms bit small if you carry two 20kg suitcases, no electric sockets in bathroom, boring design, good bfast if you are in love with japanesese food. Comfortable beds, poor English of receptionists.

This is a no frills hotel: rooms are small but clean and the front desk staff is helpful. The beds are indeed hard - which I like - and the frames are made out of laminate. Again - clean bathrooms. It feels like a bit of a matchbox but it's a very value when you consider the fantastic Shinjuku area and train station are so close. I recommend this hotel for those who need a clean and convenient place to sleep.

Booked with a great deal as I intended to stay near Shinjuku area and expect not much as the deal I got is really cheap compared to the hotel around Shinjuku west side. Surprisingly a single room has quite a good size bed and space for Tokyo business hotel. Room equipped with compacted but full function bath room and toilet and even a small bath tub (too narrow to stretch your leg fully though). In the room have an extensive amenities ranges from toiletries to hair dryer, hot water kettle and even a humidifier. The room even have the small luggage stand to store your luggage to pack or unpack, which is very rare amongst a usual limited space hotel in Tokyo.Space and function of a single room is good compared to the size of the hotel.There are vending machine and other facilities such as coin washing machine or a mcrowave provided in a common room in some floor but can be access by all guests.The location is perfect if you use the Marunouchi line on Tokyo Metro as the Nishishinjuku station is a minute walk to the entrance and the underground walk way can lead up to Tokyo Government building. However, walk to Shinjuku Station for JR trains is possible for around 10 to 15 mins depending on how crowded or not and whichever on ground or underground path you are using.Staff is really helpful, even lending me luggage weight to use in the room without me have to carry the bag to the reception on the last night I have to pack.Overall, it is such a pleasent stay!

Located about 10 minutes away from Shinjuku station and the airport limousine bus stop, it was a good location to stay such that you are close to the action at Shinjuku, but still able to enjoy the relative peace and quiet when you want to rest.The room and hotel was clean and simple. Size was small as is typical of a hotel in Japan but the room was comfortable enough for one person. Wifi connection was fast and stable. Many convenience stores, fast food and cafes located downstairs so food and snacks were always available if you got hungryIt is also about a 5 minute walk to Paul Bassett cafe located in the basement of Shinjuku Nomura building if you want a good cup of latte or 10 minutes walk to the Tokyo Metropolitan government building if you want an unobstructed skyline view of Tokyo

This hotel is in an excellent location, just about 5 minutes away from the train station. The wifi works well. Not a big room, but big enough by Japan standards. Staff is efficient and very nice. Speaks English. Was nice and quiet in a BUSY, busy area! The breakfast was okay, but the best thing was the ladies who attended us, not the food, which was a bit sparse--a roll and a sandwich, and coffee or tea.

This affordable inn has staff which makes it stand out from the other budget lodgings. The staff showed extraordinary patience when asked about ditection to places. One even helped booking airport transport. The place is clean and modern with free coffee and bath salts in the lobby.

The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk away from Shinjuku. We were satisfied with the hotel, be it the rooms or the service. It's a plus point that they have pretty fluent English and Mandarin speaking staff who were very helpful in giving us directions to places we were unsure of. We will definitely consider staying here again.

This is not a family hotel but for business people. Rooms are made for one person with very little luggage. Very clean and new looking. I loved the small elevators. A lot of places to eat right outside the front door. Close to the JR and subways. This place rocks.

Very comfortable and convenience; location is near JR station and metro; good wifi performance; big bed and easy to sleep; nice staff and rapid check-in / check out; and okay to keep luggage after check-out.

Excellent value for money with a very central location. Clean, tidy, functional.Very friendly staff - would definitely stay here again. I was with a group of 14 friends for a football trip - some senior travellers in the group, and no one had a bad word to say about the accommodation.

Very clean, excellent position, only 2 minutes walk from underground station. Staff very helpful. Rooms and toilet very small but with all comforts needed. They don't have a restaurant so no room service is possible

We got here right after arriving, so we just wanted to relax. Check in went smoothly. The staff spoke a little bit of English but enough for what was required. The room was fine and clean. The only observation is that there was barely enough room to open one suitcase, so if you're traveling with two large suitcases, try to book a bigger room, if possible. Regarding breakfast, we didn't include it, but you can always go there and pay it separately (app. 1000 yen pp). The cost is the same. I would recommend you not to include it, since it's "only" Japanese and you might want to have the freedom to go to one of the many cafes with western bread.

I like special the location. And the room is clean.But I can't use free phone in the Japan.And the food market is small. But the shinjuku station is very near. So i don't care the food. And the hotel is famous. So I can delivery anything

Hotel was good for short trip stay, Japanese hotel are neat and prefect, located very close to station. Very convenient, I have not taken the break fast so could not comment, over all good hotel to stay in budget price.

Nice Hotel, very close to the subway station, and at 10 minutes walking from shinjuku.Nice rooms, not that big but enough for a week end, excellent bed, shower and toilets are OK.Excellent choice if you don't plan to spend that much time in the room.

Such a great location. Super close to many train and metro stations. Good price. Very clean and tidy room. Room quite small but normal for Tokyo standard. The only thing is is that the bed and pillow was incredibly hard and uncomfortable. I stayed for 4 nights and got very little sleep because of this. Not sure if this is normal for Japan.

You really cannot expect more for the price. Good and central location, very friendly and helpful staff. The room was clean and very small, but I did not need more. I liked the (hard) matress, but had some problems with the special pillow. On request it was no problem to get anoter one.

Nice and clean. Great location and friendly staff. The beds are a bit hard though. The wifi was not working very well in the room, but they were installing a new system during our stay. So it might have changed.

It was my first hotel in Japan and in Tokyo.It's a very clean and well organized hotel with a nice staff.The room is quite small but included all comfort you need exept USB port that i think nowadays it's necessary!My room doesn't included breakfast but you can find a bar in the hall of Nishitetsu Inn and a lots of bars close to the hotel.I think that the price was a little high considering my experience in Japan.

- booked a non-smoking room but room smelled of smoke..... As did the entire floor and hallways ; didn't think it would be worth complaining about as they probably don't have anything that wasn't smoke-filled - rooms and bathrooms are dated- a little far from Shinjuku station (in fact, should transfer on subway to another station that's closer); can be cumbersome if you have heavy luggage as there's stairs in subway stations- nit convenient with JR pass, so will need to use subway instead

Location very convenient near Shinjuku JR about 10 minutes walk, subway just abu 2 minutes walk at your left, staff friendly & helpful, as we are going to Niigata for 3 days they allow us to keep our laugagges at the hotel after we come back to tokyo and collect our laugagges, room is big enough for twin sharing & bed is comfortable, clean & good

this is the 2nd times i stay there and i think they are improving and very good service. everything make me feel good.Staffs are helpful and able to communicate in english. they are trying to assist me to solve some problems and make my trip smooth.

Nishitetsu Inn Is in very good location in Nishi-Shinjuku section one-half block from Metro station. Inn caters to the Japanese market as rooms are smaller than usual hotel rooms in Japan and extremely tiny for western market. Western breakfast consists of toast and coffee for 80 yen whereas full Japanese breakfast is 1080 yen. Hotel lobby is something from the 40's and laundry has to be reserved for women only for their protection. Rooms are well equipt for the Japanese traveler including a wide variety of Japanese TV Stations. For the westerner who wants location and a good price for one night, this may be an option as there are restaurants nearby where a reasonable breakfast may be purchased.

Don't take a smoke room if you are sensible. We had no smoking room but finnaly we had taken a bad choose and change in two individual rooms, i was traveling with my brother.Finnaly they kindly change me the room, because ican't breath normaly throw the smell of the room.

alvarol955
Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain

review_body: Nice and clean room. Excellent service! Smart location: near Shinjuku train and metro stations. Good breakfast buffet! Your luggage can be serviced to be sent to and from airport. Reception staffs are helpful.
user_name:
luongnh
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: This hotel has everything for a comfortable stay. Only doenside is check in is strictly after 3pm. I work as guest services and at our hotel, we don't see how it benefits either guests or hotel to keep them waiting til official check in time. If the room is ready. Guest will appreciate it more after a long journey to be able to check in early. Subject to room being ready at that time of course.

it was a good stay but a bit far away fm JR west exit at the end of the day. The breakfast in the basement is good if you like Japanese style BF. The St Marc coffee shop downstair is a plus, whenever you get in and out the hotel, you smell the best coffee in town. it only comes with two pillows for a double room, would be nice if they have extra.Room is small as usual in Tokyo, whenever you need to open baggage, you have to put on the bed. One person has to sit on the chair whereas the other has to sit on bed if you are not sleeping. So, I really recommend if you have two people try to get two twin beds room. After all, the stay was still good. The receptionists were helpful. Try to get a city map fm them. I got the info fm map there's the hop on and off bus for city tour that brought us to sky tree, tokyo tower, asakusa temple, odaiba rainbow bridge and gundam museum etc etc just spent USD25. The bus stop is at Tokyo Station, the fee is good within 24 hrs.
user_name:
Alice L
diamond bar, United States

review_body: Close to subway station (with an elevator at the exit)Nice and helpful staffClean room of reasonable sizeMany facilities nearby (convenient stores, fast food shop, coffee shop...)----------Sometimes my iPhone could not connect its wifi (but my laptop did)

Close to Shinjuku station allowing for easy access from Narita airport and the subway. The most difficult part is to navigate Shinjuku station to find the west exit, from there it is an easy 5minute walk. Once you have mastered this you will have no trouble getting to and fromthe hotel

10 minute walk from Shinjuku JR station or a 2 minute walk from another subway/metro line, the hotel is conveniently located for weather leisure or business traveller. Except the WiFi connection is not very stable for our room, the hotel is generally clean and staff is friendly.

The room was very dated looking. Closer to a motel quality by North American standards. The front desk staff was friendly but difficult to communicate with. Since there were no non-smoking rooms left I had to stay in a smoking room. The room smelled very bad to the point it was difficult to be in there and sleep there. I checked out early after 1 day for this reason. I have stayed in other hotels in Japan that were much better quality for a similar price.

good location, nice staff, room facility's not great but ok. also i left my DV camera and they contacted me on time so i can get my friend to pick it up, thanks so muchif i ever go to tokyo again i'll probably stay with you guys again.

Spotlessly clean and efficient in all ways. Very decent room rates. Receptionists very helpful going out of the way to help you. All ameneties, shopping, train stations nearby yet far enough from the crowds and noise. Airport Shuttle to & from Hyatt Regency - 5 mins away walk. Near Perfect!

the room is nice and comfortable, not that small as other stay in Japan. The staff speaks good English and willing to help if we need anything. And the walking distance to Shinjuku city center. Highly recommend!

Great location to start to two week trip to Japan. Excellent location; easy walk to major station for journeys to Mount Fuji & Tokyo City, plus Shinjuku city sights. Room size adequate for couple, facilities good and well serviced. Very comfortable bed. Staff friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend for a good value stay.

Advantages: price affordable, clean, helpful staff. At west Shinjuku, quite quiet at night.Disadvantages: If you like me an Asian girl carry a big luggage and walk 20 mins from Shinjuku station, it is a pain. The nearest station is Nishishinjuku Station however you need to walk through a long and multi-step staircase.For a single bedroom the toilet seat no heating system, in winter time is a pain.

I booked this online for 5 nights at the start of May for a bargain price so I wasn't expecting too much but I was extremely happy with my stay. Rooms are small but clean and functional. As some have mentioned, the beds are extremely hard but this was perfect for me. The bathroom was compact and so functional. I loved how part of the mirror was heated so it would not fog up after a shower. I had plenty of room for my bags and didn't mind the size at all.To top it off, the location of the hotel is great, a mere 10 minutes from Shinjuku station. The subway stop on the Marounchi line is even closer which is useful for day to day sight seeing. If coming from Haneda airport, you can catch the airport limousine bus which has stops outside Shinjuku station or even the Hilton which isn't far from Nishitetsu Inn.The hotel also has 2 coin operated laundries which are great for travelers !

Perfectly clean place just 10 minutes away from Shinjuku station. Plenty of nice towels and shiseido toiletries are provided. Has a coin laundry. Luggage long term storage is provided for free, wich can be very very handy!

This is the best hotel for the price. Nice clean room. Small but efficient. Bed was a little hard. Window opens a little for fresh air. Front desk was very quick at check in and check out. Staff was very friendly and spoke English. Nice Japanese breakfast buffet in the basement restaurant.

very good travel! good location (about 10-15 minutes for walking at Shinjuku Eki)Very good service. The staff was very nice but don't speak english very well.The room was calm and pleasant.I recommend this hotel!

- hotel near to shinjuku station about 15 minutes walk from west gate- near to nishi shinjuku station - Marunouchi line, one stop from shinjuku station. Walk about 2 minutes.- room small but enough for 1 people.- clean and tidy.- check in time at 3 PM. Need to early check in because arrive at 9 AM, so tired to wait.

Everything was in order. Room and toilet was a bit small but i guess its normal in Japan. The receptionist are very kind even some of them can't really speak english. However, they make an effort to help in any way they possibly can. They have a lot of facilities and it is very convenient for us. Overall, I guess we had perfect vacation and thank you for the kind hospitality. Furthermore, it is very near to Shinjuku Station and its easier for us to travel from one place to another.

I wanted a simple, reasonable price, clean, good location near Shinjuku station. This inn was the perfect answer. It meant all my needs even though it is compact in size. It's away from the crowds in Shinjuku area and yet it's only 10mins walking distance to enjoy everything that Shinjuku can offer. You can take the high speed train from the airport to Shinjuku. I took a taxi to the Inn for the first time. On my return trip, I walked to the station. Recommendations:- If you shop in Shinjuku, bring your passport to enjoy tax rebate. - I recommend two great restaurants - Isomaru which sells very fresh live seafood. This is near to the Inn. In Shinjuku, if you like Unagi, Kobayashi is a Must! Enjoy.

The hotel is in a very nice location which is convenient to everywhere, the rm was nice and clean and quiet. The hotel staff offers very nice service, we are very satisfied.But, if the bed and the pillow can be softer, it will be much better.

Service and location is very good. About 5-10 mins walk from shinjuku station. With a McDonald's opposite and 3 convenience stores nearby, location is excellent. Likewise, service is pretty decent too. However, cleanliness is average for japan's standard. Had stayed in cleaner rooms prior to this. Bed is stone hard (may be a pro for some, but really uncomfortable for me), pillow is small and flat. Aircon don't have temperature control, just fan speed, which is not very helpful. Some times it can be very cold, other times, too warm and i had to open the window to allow cooler air to come in. Rooms size is small (but for the price, it's considered average.). Overall, a pretty average hotel with fair shares of pros and cons. Can consider it if the pros suits your need.

We stayed at this hotel for two days. We enjoyed that it was on the quieter side of Shinjuku (Skyrise district on the west side of Shinjuku Station) and was relatively easy to find. The reception staff were great and very efficient. We had some packages delivered to this hotel and they were ready for us when we checked in. The room itself wasn't too different from other hotels that we stayed in around the Shinjuku area. However, our room was a little outdated. Mildew could be found near the AC/heat vents and the fridge was a little old but functioned. I don't have any complaints about the hotel or room per se except that air is centrally controlled. In April, the weather isn't especially warm in Japan but the little hotel rooms can get hot and while we were there, the AC hadn't been activated yet (there were notices)! So, we had to open the small window to allow the cool air in. It was quite uncomfortable because it still got quite hot at night with the sounds of karaoke spilling out from across the station making sleep not particularly pleasant. Please update your AC/Heat system! Offered WIFI but no coffee in the room (only tea). Otherwise, it was an overall average nice stay. Good for the price we paid (under $100).

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: As the title says, it was small but we stayed three nights and were not in it for long. It was a quiet, comfortable place to rest our heads after a busy day. Japanese breakfast was very good and buffet style with the addition of cereal and yoghurt but the coffee was very strong. People at the front desk were very helpful though they didn't all speak much English, even so, more than we spoke Japanese. They provided extra pillows after a couple of requests and were very apologetic not to have done it before. This Inn is situated in a great area for transport, shops and food outlets and a Family Mart near the Metro station.

It has a good location, close de the subway and the train stations. Have many shopping and dinning options on the vicinity. The room is not very big but confortable and ckean. The problem is the late chack-in time, but it is similar all over Japan.
user_name:
Vlad T
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: The room is small but this is acceptable in Japan, room is clean and simple, however, due the air-conditioning system is centralized, hotel only offer "warm-air" for every room, this is bad I don't have cold air, I opened the window to have fresh air, and listened traffic noise every night.Wifi is very bad always disconnected and weak signal.Also, check in time is 3pm (it's ok) but check out time is 10am - extremely unacceptable, I'm fine if check out time is 12:00 but 10am is a problem.A Japan local SIM card can settle the wifi issue but the check out time is so unreasonable.I gave 3-stars to this hotel just because of their price is very value for money, however, here is many choices at the same price range so I don't recommend this hotel.

This hotel was quite good, staff were friendly and the rooms were clean. The one aspect that was a little odd was the pillows - a big pillow divided into a section with beans and the other with feathers - which made for an interesting combination while sleeping. I ordered another pillow to be sent to the room so that I could sleep better, but that is just me.The air-conditioning in this hotel is set as a group - which means if you are hot you need to open a window to cool the room down. The beds were ok and there is an option to by a VOD card from the vending machine to watch unlimited movies on the tv. There are 2 restaurants at the hotel (the cafe at the front or the Japanese one in B1). We found that the best restaurants were across the road and near Starbucks.Would stay at this hotel if we went to Tokyo again.

Excellent quality hotel. Thoughtful and efficient staff. Convenient location to JR and subways. Impressive breakfast options. Clean. Laundry facilities excellent. Close to the delightful Shinjuku Gyoen garden. Wonderful selection of restaurants and cafes. Close to tour departures. Safe neighbourhood. Loved it.

I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Location is great, about a 10-15 minute walk from the main Shinjuku train station and 1-2 minutes walk from Nishi-Shinjuku station which is on the Maranouchi line (the red one) - aim for this station if you're carrying heavy bags. Our room was small as was expected but functional and spotlessly clean. Beds were firm but comfortable and the shower was powerful and hot. There was also a hairdryer. Our room was quiet and we slept well. Wi-fi wasn't great and kept dropping out unless we stood by the door. No LAN cable was provided in our room but I'm assuming that we could have asked for one if we had wanted it. Check in was efficient and staff were friendly. The hotel agreed to look after our bags for an extra night while we spent one night in Hakone - great service. Breakfast wasn't included but there was a cafe in the basement for breakfast or a Starbucks a block or two away. Lots of eateries and the lights of Shinjuku were nearby. Would stay here again and recommend - good value for money in Tokyo.

A really good location to stay in Tokyo at a reasonable price. The room was clean and tidy with excellent and helpful staff. Very close to Nishishinjuku metro and a good location to the heart of Shinjuku night life.

Stayed in this good hotel from late March to early April. It was one of the cheaper accommodations I could find online, but I wasn't worried at all! A local told me that hotels in Japan are generally quite nice—including budget/business ones.Staff are very nice and spoke english quite well. Toiletries are provided/replenished and rooms thoroughly cleaned daily. You'll be given everything you need to have a comfortable stay in Tokyo.The location is great, too. Plenty of restaurants and shops around (from here you can easily go to the popular stops on the Yamanote line) and there's even a nice temple nearby. If you're staying only for a while in Japan, this is an excellent choice!

Room was spacious by Tokyo standards.Wifi worked well.Location was close to Nishishinjuku metro, which was really convenient.English of the hotel staff could have been better, but they tried to be helpful.

I had a pleasant stay over 3 days, with a break over 1 day to travel to Hakone, and the concierge was very kind to store my luggage till I return to stay on the last day. It is less than 10min walk to Shinjuku station, with some restaurants and convenience stores along the way. My room booking did not come with breakfast but it is not an issue as I took my breakfast at the cafe located at the lobby. The room is well-sized, though it could be slightly stuffy with heater on during the time I travel.

Nicely located in close proximity to Shinjuku Station, shopping and restaurants.The location is perfect for Shinjuku and not at all difficult to find provided you exit from the West of the main station. Good sized room for Japan

I stayed here for 4 nights last month and really enjoyed it. The location is perfect for Shinjuku and not at all difficult to find provided you exit from the West of the main station. Nishishinjuku subway is just a hundred yards away as well and very convenient.My single room was clean and larger than I had been expecting and very well appointed. On the same floor there were laundry facilities and vending machines and a machine for buying access to pay movies - note there are no English language TV channels.At ground floor level there is a very nice café which cooks pastries and cakes on the premises through the day and is open from 7am - 10pm, very convenient.I want to thank the staff for their professionalism and friendliness, particularly the gentleman who helped me locate a particular store I couldn't otherwise find myself. The staff are a particular strong point of this hotel.If I have to make a minor criticism it would be to say that the WIFI was pretty weak in the room and often not usable although it was fine in the lobby and there was a wired connection for laptop users. Whilst not a problem for me the bed was also very firm and might not suit all.In summary - great location, facilities and staff and as good a value for money experience as I have had lately - thank you.

Nishitetsu Inn rates itself as a three star hotel. The rooms are small in size but big enough to accommodate 2 adult people comfortably. The bed is soft and gives a good night's rest. The room is equipped with all the amenities that one would need for a nice and comfortable stay. In room is a percolator that doubles as a humidifier. A small refrigerator is also available. Wi fi connection is strong,fast and free..The Bathroom is compact and the bath tub is really small but it has strong water pressure and doesn't run out of hot water.On the front desk are 2 boxes of Lipton Teas of different flavors for guest to take at their pleasure. Also on the lobby beside the elevators is an amenities counter where guest can get their needs for toiletries like body scrub, body sponge, razors and shaving cream and after shave lotions.Check in and out was a breeze. No bellHops to carry your bags though.Located on the hotel front is a St. Marcs Café, across the street from the hotel is a McDonalds. From the hotel door, immediately on your left hand side is a 100 yen store, then a 7-11, then a Lawson convenience store. a few steps further is a temple.On your right hand side is Family Mart, YOSHINOYA (Beef rice bowls among others), a subway station.If you are looking for a place to stay in Tokyo. I highly recommend Nishitetsu Inn shinjuku

Nicely located in close proximity to Shinjuku Station, shopping and restaurants. We were on the eight floor and wireless internet did not work but they did have a LAN cable out and hooked up. Hmmm I wonder why? Not good for smart phones though. Also this hotel has a 10:00 am check out, which I have never actually heard of anywhere in the world. So we asked for a late check out and they told us for 1600 Yen an hour, no problem. Good sized room for Japan.

General excellent service from the staff. Second time I stay in Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku, I would return there again for a next trip in Tokyo. I booked from Booking.com so I had a really good price compared to the usual one. Good location, close from Tokyo metro, and 10min walk maximum from Shinjuku station.Little lack, the wifi connexion was not strong enough for my room, so preferably avoid the end of the corridor.

I loved staying at this hotel. The location is excellent: close to Shinjuku station and Nishi-Shinjuku station, shopping district, and many restaurants. The staff were friendly and always ready to answer any request I had. They even kept my luggage after I had checked out. The room window has shutters which block out sunlight - comes in handy when you struggle with jet lag or want a lie in. The room I stayed in was fantastic and had everything I needed. From a kettle to mini fridge to a shower with excellent water pressure and a nice selection of body products, a robe and slippers.The wifi was excellent speed. If you're looking for good value for money, don't hesitate to stay here. Book it now!

The first night here wasn't great. The room was roasting and the air con didn't seem to be helping, so we had to have the windows open. Unfortunately because its next to a hospital there were sirens and loudhailers all through the night so it wasn't a good nights sleep. After that it cooled down a bit and the stay was generally pretty good. The beds were comfy, the room was pretty spacious and the bathroom was nice and well equipped. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is spitting distance from a subway station which links you to shinjuku station and beyond. You can walk to shinjuku station too, which takes probably 5-10 minutes. There is a 100 yen shop, family mart, and coffee shops near the hotel plus a pharmacy (I recommend you check the 100 yen shop first, as quite often you can get most things there for cheap).Free wifi but no breakfast. Not a problem as easy to find food nearby.Overall a good stay.

Great hotel, all the basics are there and more, and the staff is great, friendly and helpful. The room was small, but meant for just one person and big enough. The location close to restaurants, shops and Shinjuku station is near perfect.

The hotel was extremely easy to get to, only 5-10min walk from shinjuku train and bus stations. The rooms were warm and comfortable and offered all of the necessities. The service was friendly, but with limited English ability. The hotel was also located within walking distance of some great attractions!

Typical modern japanese hotel. Clean, functional and value for money. Room quite small but that is to be expected in Tokyo. Close to the subway and walking distance to major sights. I would stay again for the price.

I had a wonderful time at Tokyo. The hotel was clean, people very friendly and helpful. The room absolutely clean and comfortable. It is located right 1 block from the train station and just 5 minuts from Shinjuku, wich is an amazing place to visit.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Very average rooms and quite small. Bathrooms definitely need a renovation- they are quite dated. Rooms were cleaned each day but tea cups were never replaced and left dirty For the entire stay.Our room was located right outside a lift which created a lot of noise late at night.Close to Shinjuku station and main walking area.

Nice localization, very small rooM, no air conditioned,very clean,staff very polited, nice Coffee Shop in the hotel, Internet facilities, near Subway station, If you don't need a luxury hotel this is a good option in Tokyo.

Having read all the positive reviews, I had walked into this hotel with high hopes. And I was not disappointed one bit. In an expensive city like Tokyo, it's not easy to find a hotel that is high on quality and reasonable in pricing. The biggest advantage of this hotel of course is its location. It's less than 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku station, the heart of Tokyo city. The nearest Metro station, though, is Nishi-Shinjuku, which is just 2-3 minutes walk. Transport, food, shopping, nightlife -- the best of everything in Tokyo is at a walking distance from the hotel.I believe the real character of a hotel manifests through all the small things it has to offer. I was particularly impressed by the hotel for two reasons. First, though my check-in time was 3 pm, I landed up there an hour early. They allowed me to check-in immediately without any hassle. Second, I ran out of my phone battery in evening and realized that my charger was not working. I took a walk to the reception looking for a solution. One of the staff members immediately handed over a charger to me. I though he had given that for a few minutes of charging, but was told that I could keep the charger for the night, and for free.My single room was small, yet very cozy and functional. The bathroom too was small, yet quite smartly designed. Had absolutely no problem. And of course, they didn't seem to compromise one bit on cleanliness. Had difficulty in connecting to wifi in the bed, but it was stable and fast near the entrance of the room.Overall, very pleased with the stay. Will surely stay here if I return to Tokyo.

The areas of Shinjuku JR and metro stations are large and quite complicated. Initially, a bit difficult to find this hotel from Shinjuku JR, although it is within walking distance. After reaching there with Google map's help, I found it was actually very near to another metro station. There are convenient stores, McDonald and restaurants nearby but overall not so busy as the other side of Shinjuku. Speed and stability of Wifi in the room can be improved.

Great location, close to some of the main popular attractions, nice cheap rooms and excellent helpful kind staff members! Although, you must be prepared as the rooms aren't that spacious and not so luxurious but will be OK for the budgeting side of things. There is a cafe at entrance to hotel with awesome food and a 24 hour convenience shop just next door. Shinjuku Station is just around the corner with about 5-10 mins walking time to hotel.

People very kind at reception. Small but very clean rooms. Great location to visit shinjuku. Reasonable walking distance to shinjuku station. Wifi Connection in rooms improvement is a must. Good wifi in the lobby

I enjoyed this hotel: the room is clean, the shower is good, the location is excellent: a few steps from a metro station and an easy 10-15 minute walk to the main Shinjuku station. the lobby cafe is good for a quick snack, coffee and breakfast. Washing machines and dryers are available at several floor and they are cheap and (when I used them) always available. Good wifi in the room.

Very close to Nishi-shinjuku Metro Station and also Shinjuku Main Station so you can use both subway and JR Lines (outside of Tokyo and Narita Airport)Very helpfull staff.Yes, it is simple hotel but in Japan, almost all hotel room looks similar. So, it is good choice for it's price.

We stayed in a double room for two nights. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room itself was small, but very clean and had everything you needed. The shower and everything worked perfectly, and walls were soundproof as well. However air ventilation seemed to be a problem, turning on the heating even slightly made the room very stuffy, yet opening the windows made the room way too cold, to be honest neither of us slept well. I suggest the hotel improve the ventilation system or perhaps add on to the existing air conditoning system.

Close to train, metro and bus station; Many departments stores around; Restaurants and fast food options; Room is ok for a single user; Very clean and organized; Poor wifi depending on the room; Comfortable room; Information about the city available.

Nice hotel,very simple but good.Excellent location.Good business hotel,rooms not very big but with nice fornituresFor the category of the hotel.Easy booking online,prices very cheap compared to other hotels in the same area

I stayed for 4 nights. Hotel was very affordable. close to subway station, convenience stores (7 Eleven; Family Mart), restaurants. Staff was helpful and friendly - lots of maps and resources; room was larger than expected for a single and was quiet, comfortable, clean and I had a view. I would stay here again!

Location is good it's less than 10 mins walk to Shinjuku station. There are numerous restaurants in the vacinity, including a Lawson and Family Mart nearby. Room is clean and comfortable. The double room size is decent (as many hotel rooms in Tokyo with comparable size are small). Hotel staff is friendly.

The hotel is situated nicely in Shinjuku. A ten minute walk from the JR train station, Kabukicho night life, and sights such as the Tokyo Metropolitan Government building. An even bigger bonus is the metro station just a few blocks away, which is easier to navigate and less time consuming than using the JR Shinjuku station to move around Tokyo.Room was small, but clean. Staff was professional and helpful.

The hotel was clean, convenient, and centrally located. It's a short walk to Shinjuku station, and even closer to Nishishinjuku if you have all your bags with you. The hotel was also affordable for Tokyo.

Came here with a bunch of mates as part of a ski holiday and we stayed in twin rooms. The rooms aren't huge but they are not as small as some people on here would make them out to be. We certainly had no issues with the rooms as we didn't spend much time in them.The bathrooms were a decent size and having a reasonable sized bath was a nice surprise. The shower was excellent and the heated toilet seats were a nice touch. New towels were delivered daily.Yes the WIFI in the room was patchy and not super quick. It was great in the lobby though and fine for basic usage. There is a popular upmarket cafe in the lobby which is open long hours and serves a range of coffees, good desserts and pastries. The staff were excellent and very helpful. They don't all speak fluent English but they speak enough to get by and try very hard to assist as much as they can. I unfortunately misplaced my SIM card and after checking out of my room was allowed back in with a staff member who assisted me to find it. Even though it wasn't there he went the extra mile service wise and I really appreciated it.The location is pretty handy, plenty of shops, restaurants and small supermarkets nearby as well as a 7/11 and a McDonalds. The Nishi-Shinjuku line is 1 minutes walk away and that takes you directly to Shinjuku station. Otherwise Shinjuku station is an easy 15 minute walk down the main street.The easiest way to get to the hotel from the airport is to take the Airport Limousine Coach service and get off at the Tokyo Hilton Hotel. From there it's a very easy 5 minute walk to find the Nish itetsu Inn. Alternatively take the Narita Express train service and walk 15 minutes up the road which would be a bit quicker.Overall I was quite happy with my stay at Nish itetsu Inn. Definitely recommend it for the price.

Pros: Close to Shinjuku railway station, shops and restaurants especially north and east of station. Nice affordable restaurant for dinner in basement. Metro close-by.Cons: Dated rooms, firm mattress but you get used to it.

I loved this hotel! I stayed here for five nights during a trip to Tokyo with a friend and we had a great experience here. The staff don't speak a lot of English (Pro tip: NO one in Japan does...) but they were very helpful and sweet. The hotel is within walking distance of all Shinjuku subway stops - there are actually so many you can use and it is a very safe location. The room was very clean and more spacious than first anticipated. The bed was comfortable and beautifully made every day - the cleaning lady but she went above and beyond for us making our bed and also put our matching neck pillows from the plane next to each other on the bed too (SO adorable!). Lots of complimentary shampoos/cleansers etc and teas too. Great vending machine and laundry facilities - overall really great quality for the money spent and insanely rad location too. There is a McDonalds downstairs and a great dessert restaurant - along with about three 24/7 convenience stores which proved to be immensely handy! I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Tokyo!

The extra small size and viewsite of the bedroom were unpleasant but the worst was the bed which was so unconfortable and hard. I had thz impression to sleep on the floor. Very disappointed. On the contrary the dront desk was welcoming and helpful.

The staff was very helpful, polite and friendly. I lost my notebook on the train and the staff helped to find it. The room was very clean e functional. The location is very convenient, near of the Nishi-Shinjuku Station.

Nisthitetsu Inn is located within 100m of Nishi-Shinjuku station, which is extremely convenient. The service was of excellent standard, as usual, and the rooms we average sized, clean, and affordable.

This is a good cheap bolt hole for a day or two. If you're looking for beauty or design or inspiration this is not your hotel. But if you get a great cheap price then it's reasonable central and it's near the main railway station.

The rooms were clean and functional. They acceded to my request for a high room. There's even extra pillows included.Though if you have large luggages I would suggest to be a bit more strategic in how you place and pack your luggage. We did it on the area outside the toilet as the room space was a tad limited.

Placed at walking distance from metro station (just across the street) and Shinjuku train station (~10mn). All the usual great things you can expect from a Japanese hotel for the rest (bit of a small bed, extreme cleanliness, great service, etc.)

Good value hotel although the room was small with no space for luggage. Minimal drawer space and hanging room. We had to have our cases kept at reception. Room was kept very clean. Reception staff very helpful, replacing the router when the wifi did not work in the room. Ideally situated for the Shinjuku station for travel across Japan and Tokyo. The food hall and restaurants in Odakyu dept store above the stationgood value and great food.

This was the second time for me in Tokyo and this place was really good and reliable. Good location, not big rooms but quite tidy and nice. The service was great as well, we liked our stay in the hotel. Definitley recommed this for others!

It was really great to stay in the center of Tokyo near all necessary communications. The service was fine, though we couldn't use wi-fi in the room, but just after the door to the room it worked :))room was always clear

Tokyo is an expensive city and our expectation is not high for the price we paid. Unfortunately, we started sneezing the moment we stepped into the room as it was dusty. The room and bathroom are small. With our luggages, there is not much space left. The annoying thing is the aircon control and if we opened the window, the dust and noise level increased.The good point is the launderette on 2 floors (one of them is for women only). The information pamphlets at the lobby were very useful. I highly recommend to browse through these maps and information about airport transfer. There are 2 computers for guests to use at the lobby as well.There are convenience stores (7-Eleven & 100-yen store) and many restaurants nearby. A McDonald's (opens 24h) is located just across the street. On the side and back lanes of the hotel, there are many delightful restaurants. You can also walk past the Shinjuku Police Station, towards Keio Plaza Hotel (which is a very nice hotel but more expensive) and explore the shopping streets where Yodobashi is located.For travel around Tokyo, we use the Nishishinjuku Station directly to the destinations or to Shinjuku for a transfer.

We stayed here for two nights and were satisfied with this hotel. The room though small (normal in Tokyo) but quite clean with cozy bed and pillows. As to the staff, very friendly,helpful and capable of speaking English. Most important of all, the location was excellent just 2-3 minte walk to Metro station and between two convenient stores. The price and quality of this hotel is a good choice for visitor in Tokyo.

First of all the location is very good, nearby all what you need and just some 7-10 minutes walking to Shinjuku station west side or the centre. The room is a bit small but cosy and they clean it everyday. For some bigger guests I can imagine that the bathtub will feel like too small, but I do not experienced that being Asian-built myself. The bidet on the toilet is a plus point and so is the free of charge wifi! My room was a quiet located one, not so much of a view (office building and a parking place) but it will do for a good night sleep. The walls are a bit thin so prepare you can hear your neighbours and vice versa if you are a noisy type. All in all a great and relaxed hotel. They do not bug you with anything as long as you do not disturb things. I already know a good hotel by now for my next visit to Tokyo. Will surely be back again!

Situated in a very central location, (in the heart of Shinjuku), this is a very nice hotel with a good price/quality and a very helpful staff. we stayed 3 nights and we have been perfectly comfortable. Free wi fi in the room and 6-7 mins walking distance to Shinjuku station. We'll definitely come back in that hotel next time!

s a very nice, clean, quiet Hotel, with a very friendly and helpful staff. is extremely well situated, 5 mins walk from shinjuku JR station where most shopping and food are situated. St MArc cafe serve nice food.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 times. It means I really like it!) previously there was no wi-fi and it was a problem, but now even this point is fixed! Great location, friendly staff, good rooms (sometimes bigger, sometimes smaller, but good). As for cleanliness, it's never enough for me, but it's ok!

Hotel is located in front of Shinjyuku Police Station and hotel room was clean and quiet. I could sleep very well. You can enjoy breakfast in a coffee shop on ground floor at reasonable cost, too.Distance between tube station to the hotel is very short.

London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Huge fan of this chain. This is a great hotel for the price, and the location is perfect: super close to the Tokyo Metro, and a short walk to the Shinjuku Station with the JR line (and direct service to Narita). Be aware that this is in Nishishinjuku (West Shinjuku), which is where many of the skyscrapers are--the nightlife area is about a 15 minute walk from there.

Is a very nice, clean, quiet Hotel, with a very friendly and helpful staff. is extremely well situated, cosmopolitan center of tokyo, with several alternatives for entertainment and restaurants (European, Japanese and fast food). 50m subway, buses everywhere. For those who want to take breakfast has a very nice coffee serving a delicious chocolate croissants. Loved it!

Stayed here for 7 nights just around New Year's.Pros:+ very good location, about 1 min walk to the Tokyo Metro Marunouchi Line, Nishi-Shinjuku station; or a 10 to 15 min walk to the JR Shinjuku Station; there's a 7-11, Lawson, and Family Mart for convenience store needs around 100 meters in opposite directions, a McDonald's, Yoshinoya, Jonathan's and Matsuya for quick eats in the vicinity as well. A little bit off the main action of Shinjuku but very quiet neighborhood.+ clean hotel and rooms with a good, budget-friendly and tasty cafe at the ground level+ amenities are readily available+ staff was very friendly, though some could use just a little bit more EnglishCons:- stayed in what they called a single room, which is quite small, but it seems to be the standard in Tokyo. little room for movement, although the bed was a double or queen-size- bed is a little bit on the hard side- could use some English channels on the TV. Every channel was Japanese- i had booked the single room online as there was no other available room. when they found out that i was going to share it with my wife, they essentially gave me the same single room but with added charges. I added about 35,000 yen for the extra person charge for 7 nights. There was some confusion before one of the staff who spoke excellent English explained to me the rules and why they were charging me that amount. I just wish it had been made known to me earlier.All in all, a pleasant stay despite the initial miscommunication regarding the price. I would probably stay here again if given the chance to visit Tokyo in the future, but make the price/room type clear before booking.TIP: it is much easier to take the Airport Limo bus from Narita or Haneda and get off at the Hilton Tokyo. From there, it's about a two block walk to the hotel, past the hospital. Much, much easier than getting off at the very busy Shinjuku station and getting lost, especially if it is your first time.

2 mins walk to metro, 10mins from JR, convenience location, small room as expected, wifi okay, only bad thing can think of would be you cant adjust the temperature of the air-con...its okay for me as i went in winter...but im not so sure for those who go in hot summer...

Very easy to walk to everything- Shinjuku station, restaurants, Night life. Staff were pleasant, room was big in comparison to other rooms we've had in Japan.A very nice 'nest' if you're in the Shinjuku area.

Good localitation, a short walk to the central station of Shinjuku. In the financial centre of Tokio. Rooms cleaners and good distribution.Are a Family Mark and 7/11 outside the hotel, very good to take a coffee in the morning and a Dumpling of pork. Yummy ¡¡¡¡¡¡
