review_body: Definitely book this hotel when we visit Tokyo again.Friendly and helpfull hotel staff.Rooms are equipped with all the basic needs.Very good location, nearby metrostation, late night shops and nice priced localrestaurants.

My second stay here and found it even better this time around. Besides the convenience and great location, managed to explore around to discover many hidden gems like more variety of eating establishments and other worthy activities. Not forgetting its proximity to a couple of metro stations' entrance or exits. Anyway, would recommend this hotel to solo travellers and friends, but as for families, can be a bit tight though.

Thank you, it was a fine stay in clean rooms and a nice hotel. The location is good, the service was very good. I will come back. The service is very good.The price is fine, we felt comfortable. The view out of my window was fine.

Stayed there for 7 nights last july. Very well located, just minutes away from the main Shinjuku train station, and 1 block from Nishishinjuku metro station. There is a good and convenient coffee shop on the ground floor and a also a restaurant. Rooms are of standard japanese size (which means smaller then in US), but very clean and a very helpful front desk. There is automatic washing machine and dryer which are convenient. Lots of restaurants in the área, and also close to the Metropolitan Government Building, where you have a good view from the Tokyo Central área. Definitely recommended.

Good location (opposite Nishi-Shinjuku metro station). Clean rooms. Vending machines. Coffee shop on ground floor.For some reason, service is not up to standard in Japan. Staff will ask you to return items such as ironing board by yourself, instead of picking it up. Same for laundry; no pick-up, bring it yourself. For the cost of this hotel, service can be improved.

This hotel is in a convenient location for accessing train lines and food. The room is what you would expect, quite small but has everything you need (except much room!). My biggest problem was that the bed was rock hard and really hurt my back to sit or sleep on. I had read a review that said you can request a pillow top for the mattress and they will put it on for you, so I asked for that when booking but they didn't put it on. I asked reception about it but thy didn't understand what I was saying, so the problem was not resolved. Unfortunately I would not be able to stay there very long due to how uncomfy the mattress was, everything else was fine.

Staff and price are good. The location is closed to Shinjuku Station (JR), however if you carry with heavy luggage, it may not so good as it needs to cross the bridge.By the way, if you need to catch Narita Express to airport, please reserve more time as the ticket office and the platform is located opposite side of Shinjuku Station.

Everything was good convenient location, price is fair except internet rather slow. However, make good with additional device. Overall happy with stay. Near Shinjuku station 10 mins walk. Subway is even closer 1 to 2 mins walk. Cafe downstair has good coffee. Mcdonald is just opp. the hotel.

Staff, location and the price all good. Convenient as there are tons of shops around. However, if you carry a huge luggage, may not be so good to bring a luggage around for 15 mins trying to figure out where the hotel is... The staff is nice and helpful. Price is reasonable. Will recommend the hotel to friends if they like to explore Shinjuku at night.

From the outside, it's look like an average apartment. But when we entered the hotel, the interior decoration is very nice.The room is quite clean although a bit small. All the facilities work fine.Location is good with just 15-minutes-walk to Shinjuku station. There's a cafe at the ground floor. And a convinient store just 2 blocks away.

This was a great hotel for sightseeing close everything Hilton hotel was just a few minutes walk where a free shuttle to shinjuku station . Breakfast included. This is a business hotel. Washing machine and dryer in room Excellent stay

Staff, location, the price... everything's just so good for the priceYou have wifi inroom alsoshort walking to shinjuku area, alot of good restaurant, convinient store around. I could leave my luggage for 3 nights even I stayed there just one nite.

Very nice place, ambient and employes and very nice ubication.Thanks ThanThanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks Thanks ks

We found the location of this hotel really convenient, however the map to get there from the train station is very misleading. You need to go to the East exit, go under the underpass, cross at the huge crossing and keep going until you walk past the blue overpass bridge, there is a Dotours Coffee Shop and then you know that you're very close. The room was really small but clean. If you're a couple I recommend a twin single room (unless you don't move in your sleep). We tried to upgrade to a larger room, but they were booked out.

We are really appreciate the Management for letting us to put our luggage in their concierge for 2 days while we were checking out to Hakone for 2 days... its really really helpful . So we did not need to bring our big luggage to go around Hakone. We sure will recommend this Hotel to our friends.

We had an incident with a room that was very humid and you could not get it out by opening the windows. They were very kind and we could switch immediately. Recommend when staying close to Shinjuku, good Connection to anywhere even Mt fuji

I'm sure I would stay there again. All was fine, bed is good (slept very well), clean and all stuff like Wifi etc. works fine, staff very friendly and supportive. Finally great place and price value good!Thank you

A bit small as with most hotels in Tokyo. But it was comfortable and clean. Accessible and convenient to walk to Nishi-Shinjuku and Shinjuku Station. Cafe right at the doorstep of hotel and convenience stores nearby which made breakfast easy. Everything that we needed was provided for. Good variety of tea, toiletries and there was also a self-service laundry on 1 or 2 floors.Service provided by staff was good as well.

I stayed at this hotel for a short stay of 2 nights, in November 2014, the rooms are not so big, but not that small, all was ok, nothing special, staff at the reception very polite and professionnel, Wifi worked very well, good signal, various shops nearby to buy water and so on, 10 minutes walk from the train station, really very good value for money.

Good hotel with helpful staff. They tried their best to service. But I would add that some more training would help them to be more efficient. I asked for the Yamato service and the route of train for Disneyland & Airport. The staff helped me well but it took both of us too long time. This improvement on this front would make many guests happier.

My friend and I stayed at this hotel in October 2014 for 4 nights.The hotel is located in Shinjuku prefecture. It is within walking distance (15-20 minutes) to all the action in Shinjuku and tons of shopping/restaurants .The closest metro station is Nishi-Shinjuku which is a short 3 minute walk away (2 short blocks or so) and there is an elevator (this was great considering we had to catch the early morning airport express with our big luggage and was an easy one metro stop to Shinjuku station). For other days, it was also an easy 15 minute walk to the enormous Shinjuku station (for JR lines and airport express). In order to get there, one would walk on the elevated pedestrian walkway to access the station (we used Exit A18 as a point of reference – which was on the east side of Shinjuku station).The hotel is located on the quieter area of Shinjuku and had plenty of dining options. There is a McDonalds across the street, a 7-11 and Family Mart within a block radius. There is also a nice café right by the lobby of the hotel.We stayed in a double room as all the twin rooms were fully booked. The room was clean and on the tighter side, but with two people and luggage, we managed quite alright. The bed was on the firmer side and had a nice cozy down comforter. Slippers, robes, toothbrush/paste, shampoo/conditioner, body wash were provided and extras such as body sponge, makeup remover pads, cotton squares and tips were available by the elevator in the lobby. The bathroom was clean and a good size. The water pressure was excellent.The staff was very helpful and attentive. We asked for directions to several restaurants and maps were immediately printed out for us. We also borrowed an umbrella from the front desk on a rainy day.Overall this was a very pleasant stay.

It was our first time in Tokyo and we stayed here for 4 nights. Needless to say Tokyo can be overwhelming for first time visitors and to navigate the busiest transit station- Shinjuku. The hotel was quite simple to get too from the Narita Airport. We took the Narita Express into Shinjuku, took the Marunouchi Line to Nishi-Shinjuku station which was only one stop. Exited Gate 1 and walked left. Hotel was 2 minutes away. Many shops, cafes and restaurants were close by. Upon arrival, the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was not as small as we expected as it was well laid out. The room was clean and quiet but the bed was incredibly firm/hard. Water pressure was excellent. The room also has 2 robes and slippers for you to wear. There is an area by the elevators in the lobby for you take toiletries such as sponges, razors and q-tips. There is a self service laundry on the 7th floor which was extremely handy and cheap. 200 Yen for the washer and 100 Yen for the dryer. The location of this hotel is excellent. It's only a 10 minute walk to the heart of Shinjuku where all the flashing lights, crowds and shops are.

This was a nice hotel. My only issue was even though I booked a non-smoking room, every time I entered my room, it had a smoky smell. I'm pretty sure it didn't smell like that when I checked in, but when I returned later that evening after a bit of sight-seeing, it had that smell for the rest of my stay.Also, it was harder to walk to the hotel than I expected from Shinjuku station, the "8 minute walk" tag is a bit deceptive. I ended up taking the subway into Nishi-shinjuku station, and from there the walk is a breeze (2 minutes). Note that the English sign for the hotel is small, on the wall by the entrance doors, and easy to miss.Also, they are very strict about check-in and check-out times, but they will keep your bags for you if you arrive early or check-out late. The hotel staff was very courteous.Overall, my stay was fine, but if I return to Tokyo I probably wouldn't book this hotel again.

We spent few days in the Nishitetsu Inn Shinjuku before leaving Tokyo; our room was quite small, (this is the standard size you can find in Japan) however it was silent and confortable.The best feature of this hotel is definitely the postion, really close to Shinjuku, just few minutes walking and two minutes walking from the metro station Nishi Shinjuku.Nishi Shinjuku. A special big thank to the hotel staff that found my mobile phone, the two girls of the reception literally run for me under the rain to give me the mobile back, they made my day!

The hotel is perfectly located in Sinjuku, it takes a bit of walking from the Sinjuku station but was not bad at all. The front desk staff were very helpful and spoke very good English. The room size was a bit small for 2 people and the decoration was a little out dated. Given the perfect location, great staff and cleanliness of the hotel, I would have nothing to complain.

So convenient to Shinjuku Station providing great access to the metro and train. The rooms were a good size by Tokyo standards and very clean. Loved our time there and if I went back to Tokyo would stay again.

Front desk staff spoke good English. But the directions from the website weren't very good actually. It said to take the west exit from Shinjuku station but I got lost on my way there. I ended up going to the hotel from the east exit instead. Better shopping along that stretch anyway. But besides that, I have no complaints at all. Great service, great location, and great value.

A convenient location, relatively close to Shinjuku Station. A couple of cafes close by but worth going into Shinjuku or Shibuya. Clean, convenient, very friendly staff. Small rooms but big enough for a couple - reasonably priced.

The quality is very good for that price, quite clean and organised. The location of the hotel is very good. close to shopping centers, close to metro which can take you to Ginzo and Tokyo station and everywhere.

Hotel is located 8-10 minutes from JR Shinjuku Station and only 2 minutes from subway station on the skyscraper side of the station. Famous for its night life Kabukicho district is reachable in 5 minutes. You can also find plenty of bars and restaurants around hotel. Even 7eleven is just next door.Rooms are very small but I guess it is standard for Tokyo. Beds are hard but we had very good sleep in them. Wifi is excellent - we were able to watch HD streams from Internet.

Good value and very reasonably priced. Only 5 minutes walk into the centre of Shinjuku or to the government building viewing platform. Great for shopping, sightseeing or soaking up the atmosphere. Also convenient for the limousine bus to Narita. Definitely recommended for those on a budget.

The location was great - a very short walk to Shinjuku station and a host of bars and restaurants. It was also next to a 7-11 which was very convenient. The rooms were okay but very small and the beds were some of the hardest I've ever stayed in. Fine for us though as we spent most of our time in Tokyo out of the room. The staff could have been friendlier and more helpful at times but I think this was largely down to them not speaking fluent English (for example, when we asked for an iron we were given an area map!) Overall, it was fine for us and for the price but I might consider looking elsewhere if I was back in Shinjuku as I wasn't 100% sold.

This was the perfect place for our stay in Tokyo--it was in a really great location, was not too expensive, and everything went well with the staff. Some of these reviews suggest the rooms are small--but they didn't seem smaller than the rooms of other hotels we've visited in Japan. They were as expected. Would definitely stay here again--

I couldn't ask for better value for money.Great location, great staff, reasonable price. Room is a bit too small, but considering its price, location and that it was just me there it was just right.Definetely a great choice and whenever I go back to Kyoto I'll certainly stay there again.

My stay in this hotel was really nice. The location is perfect in front of Tokio metro and 10 m walking to Shinjuku Station. The room was really small but enough if you only want ir for sleeping. The worst was the bed that was a stone (relly really really hard)

A friend and I are staying at this hotel. We requested a non-smoking room (due to a medical condition) and were assured we were on a non-smoking floor. When we arrived to our floor, it smelled very strongly of tobacco. We went to the lobby to discuss our concern, and staff insisted that the floor was non-smoking, but refused our request to come to the floor to smell the smoke. Additionally, there was no available customer service from any other person, no other phone number to call, and our request to speak with a supervisor the following day was refused. If you're a non-smoker, I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Perfect base for discovering Tokyo, the hotel room is small (but you get used to this after travelling in Japan) and has everything you need. Although the street is noisy, the building is well-insulated and quiet. It's basically a modern, convenient hotel with a Japanese touch. It's close to Shinjuku station, but be aware you need to walk up a big over-pass to get there which can be a bit annoying if you have lots of luggage.

Great staying at this hotel in the very heart of Shinjuku (probably the best starting point for visiting Tokyo). 5 min walk from Shinjuku station. Very quiet and tidy; we chose a double room and the beds were comfortable and huge. The staff is friendly and helpful. Cute amenities always available at the elevator deck. Breakfast is not included but a café at the ground floor offers a meal at 400JPY. No doubt I'll be staying here again if re-visiting Tokyo.

The location is good, very close to Nishi-shinjuku metro station, and 10-15 mins walk to Shinjuku area. There are several convenience store nearby. The hotel area is nice when comparing with the heart of Shinjuku area. The hotel room is not really small, acceptable size. The facilities are adequate. The staff is absolutely polite, helpful and disciplined. I recommend this hotel and I will choose to stay again if I visit Tokyo next time.

Great location in Shinjuku area. Five minutes walking from the restaurants and nightlife streets, but far enough to sleep without noise.Wifi works quite well in the whole building.The room was small, but it's normal for the japaneses standard, very clean everyday. A metro station just 50 meters from the hotel connects you with all the city and train stations.The staff couldn't be more helpful and kind.

Close to subway station but quite pricy for this location. Staff are very helpful. They speak good English. Room is quite small but clean. Trip Advisor: requiring 200 words from someone who's making an effort to submit a comment is ridiculous!

I spent 7 nights here for the pure purpose of visiting and exploring the city.The staff is warm and thoughtful, reflects Japan's service industry with high quality。There was a small room (as in 99% of the hotels in Tokyo for this price), with quite a large bed (~140 cm in single room) and a number of in-room facilities. Pros: good WiFi signal; good refrigerator capacity for its size; friendly staff - they can keep your luggage before check-in/after check-out so you could go outside lightly; 1 minute to Nishishinjuku metro station

Friendly and efficient staff with good spoken english. Cleanliess of the rooms. Excellent location.Location is good provided that you know the way from Shinjuku station to the hotel, takes around 10 minute of walk. The rooms are small, but at least very clean. Wifi reception is not very good but acceptable cause it's free.

review_body: quiet for rest, located near Shinjuku station, 10 mins walk to shopping area, near convenience store, very clean room and useful equipment, Free Wifi in room, nice staff and English is well, reasonable price.

I have stayed in this hotel and other than not getting breakfast or just a cup of coffee before 7am i really was comfortable. There is a MacDonald next door where you can get breakfast and better food service then USA. Near main attractions. The room was not that large but it was nice and well organized.As soon as you walk in the room to your right there is a microwave top of counter on the bottom there is a washer / dryer, right next to it there a trouser press then there is a bathroom with a full size tub and comes with a full size bottles of shampoo, conditioner and a shower gel. Then there the sink with a full size bottle of hand and face wash. A toilet that let's you warm or wash you bottom. Large mirrorA good size bed with a heater and air conditioner and lamps switch by the bed, a mini fridge that you can turn on and off , a flashlight a large tv , 2 pair of slippers a robe and air freshner and a shoe horn and a cabinet with actual dishes and a coffee/Tea pot.Near the train station and metro, i hope my descriptions helps.

It is a good hotel. The employees are extremely polite and helpful. The localization is perfect, I just spent 12 minutes walking from Shinjuku station, very easy and safe. I recommend it. It was my first time but I intend to go back there.

The hotel was clean and central but he room size was too small and the employees at the desk not superfriendly. I would suggest it for a maximum of two nights for a business trip. It wasn't cozy enough for a couple trip discovering Japan.

The staff was very helpful and satisfied our initial requests. The room had enough space for one person and the bed was OK. Very near to all sort of restaurants. The location is ideal near Shinjuku area, I totally recommend it.

Excellent value, given the proximity to the Shinjuku office, (although rooms are small; typical size in Tokyo). 10-15min by foot to main Shinjuku train and station bus stations. There's 7-11, Lawson and ¥100 shop just meters away. Quick bite can be found at McDonald across the Main Street in front; the popular Japanese food outlet Yoshinoya also just right beside the hotel.

The cost was so affordable i didn't know what to expect. It was wonderful! Great location near the fun area and the Shinjuku train/subway station. The staff is so helpful and kind. I have NO complaints! Rooms in Japan are smaller than US, so I expected that. It was plenty of room for me. The beds are firmer than I'm accustomed, but my back never felt better. Thanks to all the young front desk young people who were so much help to me and my friend.

This hotel is ten minutes walking from Shinjuku station, and very easy to find. I had a ton of luggage (and I speak zero Japanese), but I still found the hotel very quickly and easily. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The check-in process took all of thee minutes, and the check-out process literally took two seconds (you drop your key in a box on the way out). The room was beautifully clean, and quite large for a Tokyo hotel. I will definitely stay here the next time I pass through Shinjuku.

I chose this hotel because it was in a nice location and all the other hotel options were booked. I spent 11 nights here for the pure purpose of visiting and exploring the city. The staff are very friendly. However I would not reccomend this hotel for a long stay like mine. This hotel is perhaps best suited for people on short business trips. The walls of the room are too thin causing my sleep to be disrupted on practically a daily basis. Because of this factor, I feel like this hotel is well suited for a shorter stay. If anyone is looking to stay here for more than 3-4 days I'd reccomend looking elsewhere especially if you want to sleep comfortably!

I happened to live in the hotel for just 2 days - actually, 2 nights, as the rest of the time I was out. There was a small room (as in 99% of the hotels in Tokyo for this price), with quite a large bed (~140 cm in single room) and a number of in-room facilities.Pros: good WiFi signal; good refrigerator capacity for its size; friendly staff - they can keep your luggage before check-in/after check-out so you could go outside lightly; 1 minute to Nishishinjuku metro station; nice croissant cafe in the lobbyCons: hard mattress - was quite difficult for me to have a good sleep; noise from corridor and other rooms can be heard easily - that's especially annoying in the morning.

I stayed for 10 nights and the best part was how close it was to the Tokyo metro station and the shinjuku party center! Absolutely loved it! Staff were very helpful and attentive. Will definitely stay here again!

Very good hotel but it is annoying that it does not lend plug adapter but only sell it - this is in fact the only Japanese hotel which refuses to lend plug adapter. It undermines my impression of this hotel.
