review_body: Small room /normal in Japan/ but very clean and has all expected extras. Very good value for money in Tokyo. Walking distance to Shinjuku station. Helpful staff. Good cafe in the lobby /pastry and breakfast items/. Many well known Tokyo shopping stores nearby. Hotel was a very good choice for our stay in Tokyo /5 days/.

Its the location of the hotel that we choose. We stayed for 6 days 5 nights. 3min walk to Metro station & about 8 minute walk to Shinjuku station. Room was small(expected), its very clean. Value for money. The thing we dislike is the bed, coz me & my wife plus my 3 year old daughter was sleeping on a double bed which barely fit both adult moreover fit another 3 years old. We ask for a change but it was fully booked. So we ended up sleeping cuddling each other.

the hotel is good, typical business hotel, I booked a double room, but mistook to book a double bed room instead of a two single bed room. But when i ordered, the staff soon brought us another quilt with nice mannar. the traffic is very convenient, and not far away there are many shopping points. i will recommand you to choose here!

Room was small, but clean. All necessary things like TV, WiFi, Refrigrator and so on were available. Personal was very helpful. The location is great, near to metro and the Shinjuku station. I can recommend this hotel.

Great place especially if you're planing to do sightseeing all over Tokyo. The subway is approx. 50 meters away and you can reach almost every location by foot, even Shinjuku Station. The service was great too and the personell very polite and helpful. Breakfast was very good too and I could choose between japanese style or western style breakfast. Both were very delicious and high quality. My room was a little small but smartly furnished and comfortable. Recommending this place big time!

My room was small, but comfortably furnished. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. Checking in and out was very efficient. I liked the free WiFi service.Lots of great shopping spots and restaurants in close proximity. Shinjuku Station is close by and it's easy to get a taxi outside the hotel. The area around the hotel is also very safe.

My stay at your hotel was pleasant. The hotel front desk staff was courteous and helpful. The housekeeping staff was excellent. I really appreciated the laundry as I was in Japan for approximatley 2 weeks and had to do laundry when I arrived in Tokyo. The things I wished were available was a place to workout and a shuttle bus. Over all the hotel was a great place located close to shopping, local train/metro station and entertainment. I would stay here again if in Shinjuku.

Room was small but perfect, and very modern. Using exit 2 at the subway station will take you kiddy corner to the hotel. Very near to the tokyo municipal government building. Staff very helpful, although they only provide 1 pillow for a double bed!

the hotel rooms are kinda small. but very clean. facilities are of satisfactory. There's a restaurant bar downstairs of the hotel. the staffs are very helpful. Sub stations are just a walk away (2mins) Nishi Shinjuku station. many fast food restaurants across the hotel open 24/7. family mart and 7-evelen just next to hotel making getting your late snacks or early coffee convenient. . Walking distance to the Metropolitan tower for an amazing view.. (suggest around 6pm) . overall i was more satisfied with the location than the hotel only cause it was a bit small.

Its clean, nice hotel near Shinjuku business center. Its very close to a police station, verys safe district. The bad thing was that you need to check out at 10.00 not as usually on 11 or 12. Good internet connection, if it ps bad you need to call reception desk and they will bring a new adapter wifi. Very small rooms. Regular price for doublle room is 11000 yens. 13th floor os only for women.

excellent reception, very comfortable room, good place (near the railway and the underground), clean, right temperature in a very clean room. a very good hotel, I suggest it for every kind of trip in tokyo

Great service and very comfortable rooms. Got a room with a loft and it took me back to childhood. Great maid service. Breakfast was also great and was much appreciated before exploring Tokyo. Location is also great. A bit of a walk to Shinjuku station 5min. Not too bad. which is one of d major stations in japan. But theres also a nearby subway station. Overall great stay. Would deff return if/when next i visit tokyo

Nice and clean hotel with helpful staff and convenient location in Shinjuku - about 10 min walk from Shinjuku station and 2 min from metro stop. Shinjuku is a very lively area with many bars, eateries and other options for entertainment.

Good hotel in a great location. Everything you need in one place. Coin laundry, vending machines with beer. Clean, tidy and comfortable and after you come home from dinner they have a cafe in the lobby with hot chocolate croissants to die for.

Excellent service. Rooms are quite small especially the toilet and the window.But the hotel is a few steps away from the Nishi-Shinjuku Station and a walking distance from the Shinjuku Station where big department stores and restaurants are located. The room was very clean and noise-free. There were also nearby fastfood restos near the hotel like Mcdo and Yoshinoya. -merwin from The Philippines

I stayed 3 nights at this hotel for business trip. The small is quite small but you get what you pay. You can smell cigarette even though you stay on non-smoking floor. It's about1 km from Shinjuku train station but very close to the another subway station. The staff are friendly and helpful. Japanese breakfast at the basement is nice but limited choices.

We stayed here for 4 nights in July and had a great stay. The room is small,yes, but it didnt matter for us as we didnt wanna hang around at the hotel. We wanted to explore Tokyo :)The staff was extremely friendly and the hotel has a nice little cafe next to the elevator where you should try the chocolate croissants!! Shinjuku Station is a 10 min walk from the hotel (please dont go there around 9am as it is sooo crowded).The wifi was really fast and free. I would stay here again!

1) Service is good, room is clean, have enough power sockets( five in single room). 2) I stay in this hotel for 4 days, among which 3 days in non-smoking room, I found the non-smoking is better than the smoking room. 3) It is not that close to train station.

The staff is very good, they really help you whatever you need. Location is nice, near Shinjuku station. There was only one problem: the room size. As usual in Tokyo city, the room is too small. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but there are a lot of good and cheap places to have breakfast pretty near the hotel.

I definitely recommend this hotel. We stayed 3 nights. The rooms are small but scrupulously clean and offer robes and slippers to wear if you want. There are loads of restaurants in the vicinity and the Kabukicho nightlife area is literally right up the street about 3 or 4 short blocks. Walking distance to Shinjuku Station, and there is a subway stop a block from the hotel. (Do yourself a favor and get the combo subway day pass for both subway operators.)Best of all about this hotel: it has an awesome yakitori bar/restaurant (called TeKe TeKe) right in its basement! You can sit right at the prep area and watch them cook it right in front of you. Really tasty. It was packed with people when we ate there.

Even though i was there for only one night but I would like to book it again and recommend it to you. The day I checked out, I forgot my quite important stuffs, i realized it while i was on the train to Osaka, i was so worried and i mailed them to keep it, after 5 mins they answer me and told me to not worried about it, enjoy my trip and they ll keep it for me. They re doing their best job, good takinv care of all customer and very very polite... This is why i love Japan. Other services are very good as well, my room was so clean but bathroom was quite small though. Location is easy to find and really in the heart of city. 7-11 and macdonald are just right next the door.

Arriving 1am during the night, we were greeted with prompt and friendly reception, which was very welcoming. We found the location handy to the train station and shops, being just a small walk. The rooms as you come to expect in Japan were small, but comfortable.

Good location and value for money but it's old decor needs updating. An example would be "AC - high, med or low" button.... hmmmm. The front desk staff were extremely friendly. They have parking in a kind of elevator at the back but there are cheaper car parks nearby.

location was fine, layout was fine, staff were very helpful when we turned up with a few issues. However in a standard double room, even though Tokyo is renowned for small rooms, this was tiny. Also the bed was as hard as a board.

This hotel is a 5 minute walk from the rows of hotels like Hilton and Keio Plaza so location is ok. There is a McDonalds across, a Yoshinoya beside, 7/11's, Family Mart and 100 yen shop close by. Hotel is in the financial district so restaurants nearby are closed on Sundays. It's a cheap hotel for its location. Rooms are small, no porters and amenities are right beside the elevator so grab them before you go up to your room. I did not like the bathrooms because they felt like pre-fabricated bathrooms and every move you make rattles the whole bathroom. We were going to be out most of the day so we did not bother booking in more expensive hotels.

The location was great for getting around Tokyo. We were right by the Shinjuku station. We could get everywhere pretty easily. The rooms are small by American standards, but normal for Japanese hotels. The room was quite and the beds were comfortable. A good place to sleep, but you wouldn't want to spend all day in your room. But then again, you are in Tokyo, what are you doing in you room anyway?Staff was reasonably helpful in giving some advice. English was very good. Certainly better than my Japanese. I wish they knew more about local restaurants and places to go. Thankfully, we had good internet access, so were able to figure things out ourselves. Breakfast options were reasonably priced and a good value. I would recommend it to a friend for a reasonably priced hotel in Tokyo. Obviously, there are higher end hotels with bigger rooms and more pampering, but you are going to pay for that if that sort of thing matters to you.

Close to Shinjuku Station and the east side of Shinjuku. The hotel is located in Nishi Shinjuku. It is more peaceful than the east side of Shinjuku. Staff are helpful. Some of them speak fluent English. Overall, it is an outstanding hotel among Shinjuku.

I stay here for 3 days in Jun 2014(typing my review here while I'm still waiting in Hotel lobby). Overall this hotel is good and clean but room just very small with the reasonable price stay in Tokyo. I was requested to stay in non-smoking room, upper floor, facing back and slightly far away from lift because I need a quiet room from Agoda and I got it. I guess location is the best choice for me. Within same row, you can find 7-Eleven, Family Mart, Lawson, few restaraunts and Mcdonald just opposite road. You can easyly walk about 3 minutes to reach Nishi-Shinjuku metro station and walk about 10 minutes to reach Shinjuku station.

The hotel staff were very friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable. We were able to store our luggage in the hotel while we visited other cities, which was really helpful! About 5-10 minutes walk from the station, and the hotel was easy to find.

The room too small but the location very convenience. 2 minute walk to subway station and 10 minute walk to shinjuku station.The room was very clean and all staff are kind and helpful. If I travel to japan next time I definitely stay in this hotel.

10 minute leisurely walk (less if you walk fast) to Shinjuku station so very convenient for transportation and close to many eating places and shopping. Reception staff very helpful. Rooms are clean and the hotel premises are well maintained. As can be expected for Tokyo, rooms are on the smaller size but adequate for 2 of us.For the convenience and price would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for 10 days during our honeymoon. This hotel is in a brilliant location. It is a short walk from Shinjuku station where you can get to anywhere in Tokyo with ease. There is a convenience store next door too and plenty of coffee shops on the same road. Staff are very helpful and pleasant. Rooms are small as expected for Tokyo but more than adequate. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Tokyo and would definitely stay here again.

Close to Shinjuku station and many restaurants. Rooms clean and comfortable, staff friendly and helpful. Reasonably priced for excellent location. Breakfast extra but we didnt purchase as there are loads of coffee shops and shops nearby.

We've booked our room on booking.com. maybe that was the reason why we get the smallest room i've ever seen and it was located right in front of elevators. Also it was the first hotel where the receptionist did not want to send postcard for me. He gave me directions for 20-30 min walk to post office instead. Now for positives.Room was super clean, personel friendly and the hotel wasnt very noisy.

Thought of comparing this hotel to other Tokyo hotels, but did not seem fair so decided to break down into categories:Room size: Adequate.TV: Only National channels. There is Video On Demand (VOD), but did not use it. Instructions indicated to buy a 1000 yen card (machine dispenser close to elevator, good for all day), there is a vast category selection (movies, kids, anime, hobby, adult entertainment, etc.)Bathroom: Deep bathtub, excellent water pressure and electronic toilet. Unfortunately the toilet paper was very thin.Bed: Hard but comfortable, would suggest to bring your own pillows.Windows: No curtains, there were sliding wood doors. Wish it was darker (as sunrise was around 4:45 AM).Extras: Used the water heater/humidifier only as water heater, Worked fine.There are soft drink/beer vending machines in some floors and a clothing press (rather than an iron).Lobby has (complimentary for guests) tea bags, disposable razors, toothbrush, etc. More options at night time than in the morning.WiFi: No issues. Might be slow, but only used it to check emails.Staff: Was told morning personnel did not speak English, so only talked to the night shift. They were courteous and helpful.Location: Walking distance from Nishi-Shinjuku (M07 in the Marunouchi Line, exit A1 and make a left). Almost in front of the McDonald’s. There are two convenience stores close by (Family Mart and 7-11).Restaurants: There is one pastry restaurant as you exit the hotel (a section of the lobby smells like butter), did not try it. The basement has the fabulous Teke Teke a yakitori izakaya gem. They had a promotion where if you liked them on Facebook you would receive a complimentary beer.There is an elevator for the handicapped, wonder if they have special rooms (as the deep bathtub would complicate things).

Stayed here for 4 nights from 23rd to 27th May 2014. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku Train Station, in a relatively quieter area. Positives: I would say the location is excellent as the area is quite quiet at night, as compared to the crazy crowded and noisy Shinjuku area. It is also 2 minutes walk from Nishi-Shinjuku (Marunouchi Line) Metro Station. It is also located right along the main road, so you definitely wont miss the entrance.There is a McDonald's directly opposite the road, and there are Japanese restaurants and a Yoshinoya within a minute's walking distance. Lawson and 7-Eleven are also really nearbyThe staff are able to communicate well in English and are helpful. The room we stayed in was a economy double room, which was clean and well maintained. There was a computer we could use at the lobby to print our travel itinerary with no extra charge.Negatives:The walls between rooms are quite thin, we could hear others' loud arguments through the walls. The housekeeping staff a little too on-the-ball. We were woken at 10AM when they were making their rounds as we didnt put the 'Do Not Disturb' sign outside.But on the whole, had a good experience staying here.

girl at the reception speaking very good english, they help a lot to create a good intinerary.the hotel is clean and in a very good position and good deal!10 minutes wolking to the centre of Shinjuku.

I booked at this hotel based on reviewers from booking.com, the hotel is fantastic. They will do anything you ask them to do or answer your questions. It's clean, the location is super and the most important thing is the price!! I couldn't believe the price. There is some thing to watch out though if you are a Muslim or have kids, they provide sexual channels and you can simply put on the channels then the charges begin. I recommend this hotel strongly.

The location is simply incredible. you are only 7 to 10 minutes away from Shinjuku Station which is amazing for this price range.The hotel it self is one of the cleanest i have ever visited in Japan, i had absolutely no bad remarks concerning rooms services or anything else.The staff was very helpful, always willing to help even though not all of them can speak English, but you will at least find one English speaking person available.

We took an economy double room. Although the room is small, which is normal in tokyo, it is clean and has all the facilities that a guest need. Location is within short walking distance to Shinjuku Train Station. Will stay there again.

I have been there for twice.In the first one everything was great.In the second time,I stayed in a different room,and the bathroom wasnt smelling good since I came in...Nevertheless, the hotel is good.There are restaurants,cafés,markets e the shinjuku station nearby.I think the should offer breakfast to the guests,because the pricewe pay for the stay isnt cheap.

We traveled a group of friends to Tokio. The hotel has a good relationship quality/Price. Good location, nice personal, WIFI. The main drawback was the size of the rooms, very small and the bed was a little bit hard. You can have good coffee and croissants downstairs...

This hotel is in a fantastic location if you're spending time in Shinjuku. The 24 hour reception means you don't need to worry about catching the last train home. The rood is spacious - especially the bathroom. The reception staff can speak English. There is a cafe downstairs which serves a nice breakfast. The only things I would like to see improved are more toiletries in the rooms rather than having to take them from a table in front of the elevator which is kind of embarrassing when its busy, and there were some hairs in the bathtub when I arrived that definitely did not belong to me. Also, it would be good if the information on the included walking directions from Shinjuku Station, not just Nishi-shinjuku, as it's less than 10 minutes walk from there.

Good and clean room. Very good service and location is great. Metro station just on the corner.Helpfull and very friendly staff. If and when I'll visit again in Tokyo this is my choice.Highly recommend Place to stay in Tokyo.
Good room size, specially in terms of Tokyo hotels.xcelent location!! Close to restaurants, stores (Bic Camera) and Shinjuku station!Room was clean and we could make a late check out. Friendly sfaff!

The Hotel is great for families, solo travellers or couples as it is very near an exit connecting to a train station. Location is excellent. near convenience stores and fastfood chain. I would definitely come back to this hotel when I visit Tokyo again.

The room is very clean and staff is very helpful. The hotel is located in the good area with convenience for travelling in Tokyo as it is near to the Shinjuku Station and Metro Station. There are also the convenience stores near the hotel where you can easily buy something you need. The only inconvenience we found during our stay is the inconsistency of the Wifi which provide only use in the room.

We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights in May. The hotel is in Shinjuku which has plenty to do at night time but is still located in a quieter Chrome (area) so you can get a good nights sleep. Nishi-Shinjuku underground station is a 1 min walk away and Shinjuku main about 10 mins. There is a Seven Eleven and Family Mart lierally minutes away where you can buy water, Bentos, sushi and delicious originis.The rooms in this hotel are small compared to European standards but rather large for Japan. The beds are very comfortable and we were happily surprised by their size. The bathroom is small but perfectly functionable with a great shower. The hotel provides body wash, shampoo and conditioner by Shiseido which was super. The rooms all have a/c which isn't too strong or noisy and a fridge and hairdryer. Trouser presses are available on each floor and you can pick up regular irons from the front desk. Free combs, razors, toothbrushes, makeup removing packs and cotton buds can also be found next to the elevators. The cleaning staff are amazing and very thorough so the whole hotel was very clean.The guys at the front desk speak English and are willing to help with directions and recommendations. There is a popular coffee shop on the Ground Floor where you can get get great tasting coffee, smoothies, juices and a selection of pastries and sandwiches. We breakfasted here each morning although there was the opportunity to have a traditional Japanese style breakfast in the restaurant in the basement. If you're on a tight budget, you'd be better off buying food at the Seven Eleven or McDonalds directly across the street.All in all, this is a great place and I highly recommend it!

Great Location! even if in Tokyo every place is nearby some subway or train station, this Hotel is a few steps from the Nishi-shinjuku metro stop, and 5 minutes walk form the huge central Shinjuku train and metro station, and 5 mins walking from the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building (go up to have a great view of the city for free). One plus of this hotel is that it is perfectly located close to everything but not in the heart of the crowdy and busy restaurant and clubbing area.Staff very friendly and even if they only speak a little english the they do their best to satisfy your requests.Rooms are very very small, but nothing new even for quality hotel in Tokyo. Rooms are clean and equipped with everything you'd need and even more. There is a very good coffe bar that you can get in directly from the lobby that makes very good croissants and cold beverages. i suppose the hotel gives you some breakfast coupon to spend there fore breakfast, because i had no breakfast included in the rate. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and stay in the Shinjuku area is a Must if you visit Tokyo.

Hotel was clean & comfortable although the room was on the small side. We appreciated the free toiletries & the subway just close by. Shinjuku is a good 10 minutes walk away. We soon learnt easier ways to get to the JR station without using the overhead walkways which required stairs. Location was great as trips to Hakone & Matsumoto leaves from Shinjuku. Have no trouble to recommend this hotel for your stay in Tokyo.

the rooms are small for 2 people. The rooms are clean and hotel location is very good. Close to shinjuku station. The people are very nice and helped us with useful information. There is no international channel available in TV, only japonese channels.

Really nice hotel. Clean. good staff, close to Shinjuku station, perfect location in Tokyo. We spent 5 night and we slept very well (the best pillows I ever slept on). Recommended for business travels but also for leisure purpose.

Great location, very easy to reach from airport with airport bus. Very near to train station for moving around.I am surprise to find the room so spacious, it is really out of my expectation for such a location !

Great location very close to Shinjuku station. The room is even fairly spacious for Japanese standards. (Queen size bed and a desk for work). Free internet.Tidy as usual but the sheets on my bed were not new when I arrived. The bed was too hard for me (and I assume for most Westerners)

Location is close to Tokyo Metro subway station (Nishi Shinjuku). Many 24-hour convenient stores are located within walking distance from the hotel. Room size is compact but its function is superb. Hotel staffs have outstanding service mind. I am able to leave my belongings at the hotel for a few days after checked out. This hotel is definitely in my mind for the next stay in Tokyo.

Really nice hotel. The hotel desk staff does speak English, so I don't understand some of the other reviews mentioning that. This was our first time in Japan and we stayed here for a week in April and found it to be clean and close to all major forms of transportation.There's no reason to spend a lot of money staying in a tourist area when this is close walking distance to Shinjuku Station and everything else that you need. The restaurant downstairs is definitely a welcome surprise! Great food and always busy.

I am very sorry to give this hotel such a bad review, but whilst it was a decent enough place in most respects, it simply failed to adequately deal with the damp problem I had in my bathroom. It was a blatant and extreme odour of damp (almost smelling like an open sewer) coming from the bathroom. I have believe I have come away from the trip with the beginnings of an illness. The staff did not offer me a new room but only dealt with the problem superificially (e.g. cleaning fluid). I had poor nights sleep for both days of this stay and I attribute entirely to the dam problem. Also, the base of the toilet was very scummy, as if there was a leak whose remenants had congealed onto the floor. I have asked the hotel for a refund.

I stayed in hotel for 1 night only, however I would like to book this hotel on my next trip. It has an excellent location in central downtown area. It’s in Shinjuku area of Tokyo. Which is one of the most crowded yet biggest for shopping, food, nightspots, gay district and style. The hotel has a big and open lobby. The staff is very polite and helpful. The rooms have big bed even in a single room (which was great deal).The hotel has well stacked bath. The Wi-Fi was quite fast and good in rooms. There is a good café (not owned by hotel though) at entrance side of hotel. Hotel is 2 min from Nishi-Shinjuku Subway line and less than 10 minutes from Shinjuku station (the largest of its kind in world ,it’s a sub-city in itself and you can surely get lost here).All shopping and night spots are walking distance. A good choice in heart of busy Tokyo city. The airport limousine service is available near hotel, which makes it very good location to reach NRT or Haneida airports.

Definitely l will stay again in this hotel if l'm back in Tokyo. Close to Shinjuku & easy access to transport. Restaurants are also nearby, seven eleven @ McDonalds are just few steps away. Coffee shop is just within the building. I left my purse by accident, l rang the reception to let them know & l am so glad l had it back. Cleanliness is also superb. Overall my stay was comfortable and within my budget. The receptionist are also helpful and they speak English well.

This hotel is a basic clean neat hotel. A one person room does fit the description. Shower and bath are clean, high tech toilet and the bed fits 2 people actually and is nice and hard!. I had a city view wich was nice. Airconditioning system is only warm air, not cool air. Everyday they come and change your sheets (wich doesn't even happen in star hotels to be honest.) and if you are on the "do not disturb" sign,... they will provide you with a packages of fresh towels and a new robe.tea. and toothbrush and leave it infront of your door.When checking in make sure you have enough cash or enough on ur creditcard. They won't accept bills paid 50%cash 50%c.card. so it's either one of them. wich was a problem in my case. And managed to solve in the end.amazing! No breakfast, though there is a cute little cafe in the lobby that serves "okay" coffee and have ice cream and sandwiches. A 7eleven is 2 buildings down and a Macdonald's across the street.
Nice hotel, good location near Shinjuku station, many restaurants and cafes around. Staff friendly and helpful.Walking distance from night center of Shinjuku and Tokyo Metropolitan Government towers.

We stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleased. Very clean hotel, nice lobby, well equipped rooms and helpful staff. Its less than 1/2 mile west from main Shinjuku station but right next to Nishi-Shinjuku station. We actually took Airport Limo Bus to Hilton and then one of their staff pointed us right direction, about 10 minute walk to hotel. For landmarks, it has a green sign and is nearby McDonalds and Shinjuku Police Station with Kinko's almost next door. Convenience stores, 100 yen shop and restaurants all around and great café in lobby with pastry, coffee. The rooms are small, like most on Japan, but well laid out and all amenities, shampoo, soap, body lotions, toothpaste, toothbrush, tea, coffee, etc. and even more amenities in lobby if you require. Mainly Japanese tv channels but they are pretty entertaining with game shows that are funny in any language. Nearby the Nomura Building has several restaurants including Balinese, Belgian Beer Garden, Japanese food and more. P*ss Alley just a little further and busy Kabuki-cho is little further under the freeway overpass. Walking distance to Metropolitan Government Towers and we even walked to Shinjuku Gyoen National Gardens which were beautiful in Cherry Blossom Season. Easy subway to almost anywhere in the city, Nishi-Shinjuku right next to hotel and much easier than the huge busy main Shinjuku station.We found the staff very helpful, always someone who could speak English and they had subway maps and helped us find easiest route to various sights. I think for the price, this hotel is a real bargain in Shinjuku. We would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to be close to the action in Shinjuku.

Very friendly & accommodating staff, they spared no effort to assist us no matter what we requested. Hotel location is very conveniently located nest to subway station. Hotel room is small but cozy. I will definitely stay there again and recommend the hotel.
user_name:
Manal B
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We stay 2 nights there, it is clean and convenient. Very near to Nishi Shinjuku station.Very convenient access the main spots in tokyo. you wont regret to choose this hotel.Room service is excellent.

Stayed here at the inn for 3 nights on 13th floor. It's located about 10-mins walk from Shinjuku station. Lots of restaurants and cafes close by. The St Marc Cafe at the lobby serves good coffee and snacks.

We have stayed 4 nights in this very convenient hotel near Shinjuku: very clean room (a bit small, but this is Japan), close to Shinjuku and very convenient location to access the main spots in Tokyo. I will definitely recommend this hotel.

It is a nice budget hotel. Clean, walking distance to Shinjuku station and shopping streets (5-6 minutes). As often in Tokyo, small rooms but I think this hotel is the perfect place to stay and</or to discover Tokyo since it is very central.

Great city , small but great room. Easy to go to shinjuku station . Lots of restaurants and convenience shops around. Service was good but poor English, but not different from any other hotel or place in Japan.

Very close to Tokyo government building and marvelous Shinjuku area, silent place, personal very kind. Very comfortable for the breackfast. Bed a bit hard and room small, but this is usual in Japan. We have been very well.

well, it's a budget hotel for Tokyo...it's a good choice if you don't have a good budget for hotel.It's very near with 7 11 and family mart and just cross the road you will see mrt station. you will heard so many ambulance as this hotel just opposite of the hostipal

Bad things first. Not perfectly quiet, and a very hard mattress. I dealt to the latter by folding my duvet in half and sleeping between it's softness.Just a couple more things in English would also have been helpful. There was a gadget that I had no idea what to do with, whereas most other things did have English instructions. Oh, and bottled water was a welcome addition for three of my four nights' stay, but I wonder why it was't provided for the first night.However, all of those were just minor irritations for a hotel well placed for Shinjuku's rail station, subway station, Goyen (gardens) innumerable eating and shopping establishments from a room that was perfectly well sized for a single traveller with a large suitcase and a couple of other travel bags. I wasn't impressed with the cafe, but that may have been because I was in a tearing hurry for something suited to my breakfast needs and they didn't have what I wanted, but I did dine in the restaurant one night, and that was good. As with proximity to all the big rail stations, actually sorting out the right exit, and the right way to go is an issue. That's not the hotel's fault, and once you discover the intricacies and secrets of Japan's subterranean world it's not such a biggie to overcome. First time will never, in a million years, equate to google's suggested "8 minutes* etc.! The nearby police stain gives a sense of security, but it was quite noisy, even with the double glazing, when sirens and or some street noise was exceptionally loud, but I don't believe that's really a major issue, except for exceptionally light sleepers.

Excellent location, within easy walking distance of key Shinjuku locations. Very comfortable and clean room. Room includes amenities such as free wifi, deep tub, working desk, and firm bed. Only negative is little room to hang and store clothing.

Its a Good Hotel with Good Location . Hour and half from Narita Airport by own Vehicle but you can also catch Airport Express as there is a nearby MRT Station 5 minutes walking . Rooms are good , but bed are as usual little hard . So if you are on a business and has to travel nearby its a good idea to put into this hotelIt has a Japanese Style Restaurant where they serve Japanese Cuisines . Have Stores nearby so you can buy something for daily use ,I stayed for over 4 days and found this as a good option. Enjoy Tokyo

excellent hospitality, good location, walk distance to shinjuku station, 2 mins walk to nishishinjuku station. Safe area to stay. mattress is not too soft. Room is quite clean. Nice hotel. the caffe in the ground floor is pretty good.

This hotel is in an amazing location. It's easy to get to from the station and makes a great base to explore Tokyo. Rooms are small (but this is the case for all of Japan). The only negative about this place is the beds are hard, very hard!!

Convenient hotel next to Shinjuku.Breakfast is a buffet with lot of people.The hotel receive groups which are very noisy.We had to call the reception staff to calm down the noise until late.Over all good hotel for his location and the price but not calm for resting after long days of visits.

Clean.easy acsess to go every where, near bus and subway stationVery friendly staff n nice to talk toClean room,good amenities and facilitiesMany stores around the hotel n that open and resto as wellVery nice place to stay

The hotel is typical of Japanese business hotels. It is spotless, has all of the amenities and is a good size for a deluxe twin. It has a wonderful location nearby two metro stops, and within walking distance of the huge Shinjuku station. The front desk receptionist spoke fluent English. There is a fabulous little self serve coffee/pastry shop on the first floor. There is a foot massager in the room and a laundry with coin operated washing machines and dryers on the 7th floor.The pillows are half beanbag, half soft pillow - actually may favorite kind! The wifi had an excellent, strong signal. It is nearby some excellent restaurants. Highly recommended for a Tokyo stay!

A very well located hotel, nearby the Shinjuku commercial district, near some of the best sightseeing spots in Tokyo (Tokyo Metropolitan Towers), not far away from two fantastic parks, specially during the cherry blossom ( Goyen and Meiji), near the University Hospital and very close to the Hilton Tokyo that has an airport bus service. Clean room but a bit small and crowded but still comfortable. Good value for the money.

The Inn gave me what I was really seaking for my stay in Tokyo. Clean, wounderful staff, room size was more than enouph and the most amazing thing is the location. One more thing adds a very attractive advantege to the Inn is the value for the rooms.

The rooms aren't very big but you can fit your suitcase in there and have a seat which is good by Tokyo standards. It has a good location about 10 minutes walk from the Shinjuku station (West entrance), and a bus stop right outside that will take you to the station. There is a Coffee shop at the entrance (cash only) and a 7-eleven just a few steps away. A small Mac Donalds across the street should you ever get tired of Japanese food. There is a water boiler, refrigerator, hair dryer, free wi-fi that works in the room even if you don't have a Japanese contract. There are bathrobes and there is free soap shampoo and conditioner. If you need more toiletries you will find razors, hairbrushes, cotton pads, tooth brushes and tooth paste etc. in the entrance hall by the elevators. Free tea bags in the reception. The tap water is drinkable. Very friendly and helpful English speaking staff. You can leave your luggage at the reception after checking out or while you are waiting for your room to be ready. It is a quiet hotel. If you like to sleep with an open window it can be a bit noisy at night. The room and hotel is clean and of good, above average standard. The hotel accepts payment by international cards. The air conditioner only had hot air but that was maybe because this was in April. The only negative is that the beds are hard, but I would still definitely stay there again and recommend it to my friends!

This hotel is located 10 minutes away from Shinjuku Station. Rooms are very clean and the decor is classic. Two convenient stores are located just round the corner ( Lawson and 7-11). There is a McDonald's opposite to the hotel that's also available 24 hours. There's a small subway station that's located right underneath the hotel, so it is extremely convenient. The plus point is that the hotel is located in the west of Shinjuku, away from the city street, so it's not that noisy, but it is perfectly safe to walk alone at night. Vending machines and ice machines are also available, so you can get most of your favorite drinks any time of the day without leaving the hotel. The staff are really helpful but you need Translate app to assist you in the process, so get yourself a sim card to work your way out smoothly in Japan.

Pros:1. Convenient. Within 5 minutes walk to Shinjuku Station - the main station for all trains, subways and buses. Within 2 minutes walk from nearest subway.2. Quiet. Near Hilton Tokyo for Narita Limo Bus3. Has coin operated laundry and vending machines4. Room size is bigger than those in HK5. The room amenities are freely available at the lobby, inclusive of Lipton tea bags

Good location, walking distance to shinjuku. Restaurants and convenience stores near by. Also the restaurant and cafe in the hotel was great. Very helpful English speaking staffs. iPhone charger is available and free of charge.

Wonderful hotel, conveniently located near Shinjuku Station (West Exit). Easy for friends to find, and a great coffee shop in the lobby where we could meet and plan the day. Staff were very helpful, too. The room and the bathroom were clean and fresh. The cost was reasonable, and I would say it is excellent value for money!

Upside:Clean, well maintained room. Friendly helpful staff. Great location.A few minutes walk to Nishi-Shinjuku station on the Tokyo Metro made getting around a breeze. The main Shinjuku station was only another 10 minutes away if I needed the JR line.Close walk to the heart of Shinjuku for some shopping and eating.Great hub location as I was able to go out in Shibya and Ginza and catch the metro back (as long as it was before midnight)Downside:The beds are quite firm (which didnt bother me as I like that)My view from the second floor window was the back of an office block (but I wasn't in the room much anyway)Both were not deal breakers and if I travel to Tokyo again I will most likely stay there again.

The hotel staff are very friendly and the location is great. But all you really want after a long day trecking around the city is a comfortable bed and a good nights sleep. This hotel doesn't even offer that. The beds are so firm you would probably get a better nights sleep on the floor.

Great position: just 3 minutes walk from Nishi Shinjuku subway (that it isn't the main Shinjuku station, but really convenient to the hotel). Anyway, if you need to go to Shinjuku main station, it's just 10 mins walk.Clean and well equipped rooms. Two laundry rooms in the hotel, one for women only. Many convenience stores and restaurants just around the corner.There are probably more typical areas in Tokyo, but this is definitely a perfect base to explore the city.

Loved our stay here, good attentive staff decent sized room and even had a foot massage machine in the room. Excellent location easy to find and close to all the Shinjuku sights. Beds a little hard but very comfortable stay!

Right next to nishi shinjuku subway line and a 10-15 minute wall from shinjuku southern terrace. Plenty of good places to eat and the Tokyo metropolitan government observatory is right by it. You're only a short ride from yoyogi or Harajuku and shibuya or the night life of kabukicho. It's worth it.

I have been to a lot of cheap hotels in Tokyo, and out of all of them this is the best I have stayed in. The location is the best you will ever find for a hotel of this price--- a 5-minute walk to Shinjuku (which literally has everything), a 10-minute walk to the JR lines, a 2-minute walk to the Tokyo Metro lines, and an 8-minute walk to the Toei lines. No matter where you want to go, you can start from here and never need to transfer stations. There is a Family Mart 3 minutes away and a 7-11 2 minutes away. As for the service, when I came in, it was raining, it was very cold outside and I was wet when I came inside. The front desk gave me a towel at the lobby to help me dry myself up as I checked in, it was a very nice gesture.Everything else is normal hotel fare. Fridge, basic tv (there are no english channels in the basic channels), vending machines, toiletries, wifi in all rooms, most of what you can expect is there. The staff is courteous and speaks English. Nice quiet coffee shop at the ground floor too.

In general, this is not a bad hotel and, in fact, the rooms were among the largest that I found in Tokyo so far. I have only seen three hotels, but the others had much more "useless" stuff (coffee table) cramped into the same room, probably as this is mandatory to reach a particular number of stars. The staff is helpful but sometimes, it is more trying than doing - in particular, English is a problem - but somehow, you will get it work. They have a small cafe where you can get breakfast in the morning. The location is quite convenient.The point why I rate my stay as "poor", is a somewhat unfortunate concatenation of events, plus one MAJOR defect of the hotel itself.The defect is simple to explain: They do not have an AC or heating. And with that I mean: The room is missing any switch where you control what temperature the room should be heated or cooled to. You can only use one dial for the "AC" to low, medium or high air flow. In winter time, they send very hot air down these pipes; I put the dial to "low", but woke up at 3 am with the room being at about 25 C. I was sweating like hell under my thick winter blanket. So, the "AC" better stays off at all times. What is nice is that you can open the windows; that is a clear plus.Now to the concatenation of events: We stayed in Tokyo over the beginning of spring. As Japan has a public holiday on the Friday following the beginning of spring (that is what I understood), Tokyo was packed. Although we booked rather early, we had to book smoking rooms. I smoke myself and I have stayed in two smoking rooms before, so I thought, "how bad can it be". I was wrong, very wrong...Second: Japanese people hardly every smoke outside, but rather in their homes or, well, their hotel rooms. Our smoking rooms were the worst I have ever smelled, it was soaked with stink. Even the mattress stank...Now third: No AC. Sleeping in the room without air exchange felt like sleeping with your head in an ashtray.So, I left the window open during the night, all nights. But fourth, Tokyo is a busy city that never sleeps. The traffic was really really loud. If you are lucky, you are on floor 10 and above, and maybe, it is less bad there. From the second night on, I therefore slept with an open window and earplugs (there is a 100 Yen shop very close, where they sell earplugs, hooray).In total: If you get non-smoking room, and you do not have a problem sleeping in a room at some random temperature (whatever comes out of the AC), then this hotel is totally ok. Nothing great, nothing particularly bad. But never ever book a smoker room, unless you are unable to smell anything! ;-)

Staff does not speak any language other than Japanese. The room is not very clean and the bed is super uncomfortable. Location is very good. The Cafeteria in the front door is very good. The 7-eleven close offers very good options for breakfast less expensive.

Stayed for 6 nights in March 2014. Walking distance (10 to 15 minutes) to Main JR Shinjuku Station West Entrance / Odakyu Line or less than 5 minutes to NishiShinjuku Metro Station, along the way you get to see 7-11, Natural Lawsons, Family Mart and Can Do (a 100yen shop). Totally convenient for quick bites. Level 14 is equipped with Ladies Only Laundry Room, which is only accessible via the hotel card key. For hotel guest, you could even replenish the basic toiletries (such as comb / shower cap / shaver) from a small table located at level 1 hotel lobby. Lipton Tea Bags are free to take from the reception table if you are not into green tea too! Love it!

If you're just in Tokyo for a few days and are looking for an affordable 'base', then this is perfectly adequate. I didn't try the in-house restaurant, but there are plenty of other places to eat nearby. It's 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku station, so easy for getting around. The rooms are quiet and clean, if a little on the small side. There is a work desk and a fridge in the room, and easy to connect to free WiFi which is very good. For my preference the beds are a little on the hard side. No English channels on the TV though... no CNN or BBC World :o/

Before I set off,I sent mails to the hotel about the breakfast、transportation、plug,they are so kind and patient to answer me.So the staff were very helpful and attentive.Room was clean and comfortable.Traffic there also convenient.That's really a nice trip!

Slightly west of the center of Shinjuku, this hotel is a budget traveler's dream - compact but comfortable, minimalist and practical, provides everything you need. Room was a pretty decent size for Tokyo on a budget, staff were helpful, the low price won't get you any frills, but you won't be lacking for basic toiletries, clean sheets, and a comfortable bed. Would definitely stay here again!

Nice little hotel in Nishishinjuku, clean and service perfect, we are in Japan no ;) ?But, I was disappointed about the size of the room, very small !Also, the bed was very hard, my back still remembers.And breakfast is not included, if I come back again I will prefer to eat something outside.As general note I would take a 4/5 to this hotel !

greed with all other reviews, great location, everything is close by. Good value.The hotel is only diagonally across the road from the NIshi Shinjuke Station. It's quiet but you can find everything you need, restaurants, 7/11 Stores (24 hours)We requested a doublebed room as I know in general the Japan hotel bedroom is small. The room is very clean. My husband particularly enjoyed the foot massage machine provided in the bedroom!! I found the laundry facility is most handy and convenient. Highly recommended!!

Excellent location to base your Tokyo experience from! Close to Shinjuku station for easy access to underground and train. Room was clean and tidy and provided everything you needed - the only negative was that the bed was firmer that what we were used to - others might have found it fine.... We used the laundry which was great and we also one night had a dinner in the inhouse restaurant which we really enjoyed!

Very good Location ,transportation and restaurant nearby this hotel.Shopping area near, walk or by rail. Room and toilet clean. Japaness buffer breakfast is simple but delicious.Good experience for me and my family.Nx time will stay here again.

The hotel is near the metro ( Nishi shinjuku ) , in a central position . The staff was friendly , the room was clean and quiet . It was a very good experience ! Surely when I'll return in Tokyo I'll still reserve a room in this hotel

Clean and comfortable. Small room as expected from a Japanese business hotel. The hotel is just 5 minutes walking from Shinjuku station and it easy to found. Staff spoke relatively good English and was very helpful.Acceptable price.

Impression front serviceSmall space of double room but clean, cozy and quiteGood Location, Near shopping area I love green grocery near the hotel and there are 7-11, lawson, family mart and 100 yen shop at the same block

The rooms are small but funcional, i lost a key and no extra charge, they keept my bags for a hole day when i cant get black to the hotel to pickthem up. Train station is a little bit far to carry out your bags and there are some stairs in the way. In a zone with lots of stuf to do, it was a little hard for de taxi driver to find the hotel so you cloud keep the hotel direction whit you there are cards in the reception desk

Good value for money. Location OK. One remark, as I stayed for five nights, the bed was way too hard for - as I may say so - my athletic body. Also (2nd remark) the room was a bit too small for big suitcases. But, as said, good value for money, friendly personnel, and Choco Cro in the lobby - not that fantastic, but good for starters after a long flight. So, an easy and efficient hotel with small rooms, more ideal for one or two nights in my view.

I stayed there for three days and was very happy with the cleanliness of the rooms, the friendliness of the staff, the cafe in the hotel, and its close proximity to Shinjuku Station. There was even free Wi-fi. The only thing that I was disappointed was that I had to walk about 10 minutes to Shjinjuku Station with my luggage to catch the limousine bus. But overall, this hotel was excellent.

Whilst we only stayed in this hotel for one night in Shinjuku, we found it to be quite pleasant. The staff spoke good English and were very accommodating. The room was clean and tidy, and a reasonable size by standards in Tokyo.Only a short walk from the Shinjuku station and close to many restaurants and bars.

Very clean and many facilities in a small room.You provide small bottle of water for me everyday, and it's very good for travelors.Bathroom is small however not so uncomfortable.Actually everything was optimised for travelors!

The rooms were very quiet however, the rooms themselves were small. Which is to be expected in Tokyo. The room provided you everything you needed. The T.V. did not have a lot of English channels. The shower was nice with good water pressure. They have a 24 hr. McDonald's across the street and they have a really nice coffee shop in the hotel lobby which sells very good pastries. The metro is a short walk from the hotel and there are shopping areas in walking distance from the hotel. The hotel staff is very helpful in providing directions to where ever you want to go. They provided us with maps of the metro and a area map to guide you to your destination. I would definitely stay there again.

The room is a little small but everything is fine. And its price is not expensive at all.THe location is near shinjuku station,we don't need to worry about food!There is a police office acorss the street,it's safe!

If you're looking for a nice hotel at a good price situated close to Shinjuku station, this is a fantastic option! The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and everything was clean. I would definitely stay here again!

There isn't much to say. The staff were very friendly when I checked in, and made sure to point out the free bathroom supplies (razors, tooth brush etc) that were available to take from the lobby. The room was small, however was the standard size I have come to expect in Japan. I had 1 large bag and a ski bag and still had room to walk around them on the floor. The room was very clean and presentable. The mattress was quite firm (which I like), but so was the pillow (a lot of Japanese hotels/ryokans seem to have hard pillows). I would happily recommend this hotel to others, and could see myself staying there again.

Close to the metro and train stations.Close to the restaurants and 24 hour open markets.close to the money exchange in Shinjuku main station. Good cleaning service. Silence rooms.From airport shinjuku one of the main arter with limousin buses and trains easy to come.

Conveniently located especially in regard to public transport and a clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Rooms were big enough and had very comfy beds! Pretty expensive but that's just Japan really.

Great place with a perfect location, so close to the train station and major shops. Reception staff spoke good English and were very helpful. The only downside was the fact that the hotel is near the medical centre/hospital and there were occasional sirens at night.

Despite good location, Checking in at 3pm and check out at 10 am is the most rapacious hotel I have ever seen. Apart from this, the room is so small that I hardly bring my luggage inside. However, the staff are very nice and the hotel is located not far away from Subway and JR station.

very good hotel with good location, kind staffs and clean room, will recommend to my friends and will still book this hotel on my next trip in Tokyo.Especially the location, in Shinjuku, very convenience to go to any place.

room is clean, staff is helpful. location is good for different major directions in Shinjuku! airport limousine could reach close by area. Short distance away from Kabukiza!! away from busy street but very convenient to different shinjuku landmarks!

This was our first visit to Japan so I can't compare the NI to anywhere else in Tokyo but compared to other places we've stayed on this trip, I'd rate it as excellent for amenities, staff and location given the price. Yes, the rooms are small, but that's not an issue for us, as it's literally only somewhere to sleep. The location is great, the rooms are whisper-quiet, spotlessly clean and really well-appointed, the staff very helpful and obliging, AND there's an in-house laundromat (what a treat!).

very clean and modern hotel. rooms were quite big for Japan standards. even have a foot massage machine in the room. if I had to name a con, then it was the location, about a 7-10 minute walk to Shinjuku station. but other than that it was a great hotel.

The staff were all very friendly and tried hard to be helpful with us, we spoke no Japanese. Rooms are small and beds very hard with even harder pillows, great free Internet service to all rooms. The breakfast were not to my liking compared to other hotels in Japan we stayed at

I initially planned to stay 3 nights, but I loved the location, friendly staff and value so much I stayed an extra 3 nights. At first it was a little hard to find (since I came out of the wrong subway entrance) but the Inn is very very close to Nishi Shinjuku metro station.Tip, keep an eye out for a GREEN vertical sign, it's opposite the McDonalds.Highly recommended!

This hotel is very conveniently located, a short walk from busy Shinjuku station on the quieter west side. That's the biggest advantage. You can get anywhere in Tokyo quickly from Shinjuku.The rooms are small, but that's Tokyo. Our room was clean. The desk staff was nice and helpful. The free wifi was fast enough.We liked the cafe in the lobby. We did not try the breakfast buffet, because there are so many restaurants in the area, including several great ramen shops and a few 24-hour fish restaurants.I would stay here again.

The hotel was well located, near the Shinjuku Station. It´s clean and the people are polite. The room was ok and had everything needed. There is a nice cafe inside. I reccomend this hotel for a first glance to Tokyo.

Stayed 6+2 nights here, with a overnite trip to Hakone. Good Clean but small room, and the mattress is hard. Theres wifi in room. Location is good, M07 train stops at hotel front. The concierge is very helpful, speak english and gives good direction, which train to take, how to move about. Its better to take a limosine bus fr Narita airport to Hilton Hotel then take a 5 mins walk to hotel then struggling with the masses of people in Shinjuku station with yr luggages. There's 711, family mart, Macdonald, coffee cafes around the hotel.No shortage of food even late in the night.Very comfortable and good stay .

The Room is decent, nice size, still not possible for us to lay our suitcase out, but good enough at least we have space to walk to the bed. However there are a lot of noise from the police cars that keeps me up all night.

Nice hotel. Overall good experience. Room was clean, quiet and not too small. I think the price is ok, certainly considering the hotel location being close to Shinjuku station (appr 8-10min walk). I would certainly advice this hotel.

Stayed 2 nights, used GPS to find the hotel on the first night and was a little further than expected from JR Shinjuku but next day realised it's close to A18 exit... Very big station! Also very close to Nishi-shinjuku metro which is handy. Concierge were very helpful providing directions to bureau de change and restaurant recommendations and the little coffee shop was very convenient with an amazing little choco-croissant. Also McD's across the road if you need a midnight snack and a 24hr pharmacy and convenience store next door. Was out exploring most of the time but had an enjoyable stay and a comfy nights sleep! Would definitely recommend!

The hotel is on the west side of Shingjuku station, and you have to walk about 8 minutes with an overpass on the way to reach it. Good price, clean, nice staff, no problem communicating. Pretty much has every amenities you'll need, including in-room wifi and a foot massager. The room is standard small size, small bathroom, bed can be a little hard, only 1 pillow. There is a 7-11 two doors down and McD across street. However, there are a lot of homeless people sleeping in Shinjuku station at night, I would not recommend walking from JR station to hotel at late night. Take Metro and use Nishishinjuku station to avoid them, plus it's a much shorter walk. It's a pretty good budget hotel, most of the guests seems to be foreign travelers. Overall pretty satisfied.

The room had a much bigger bed than most other Japanese hotels I've stayed in. The room was a nice size, small, but cozy, and had everything I needed. Amenities were located downstairs and wifi was available and was always in working condition. There's also a little "San Maruku" Cafe inside of the hotel which was very cute and convenient.The attendants at the front desk spoke very good English, and I always felt taken care of. The location is great, Right next to a 7-11 and across the street from McDonalds if you're into that type of thing. Close to Shinjuku Station, and right next to where all the action happens in Shinjuku. And it's just down the street from the Shinjuku "LOVE" statue, which is a great photo op for all you couples out there.

The single room that I stayed in was small, but clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful for my whole stay. In terms of location, the Shinjuku station is around 7 minutes away on foot (from the West exit). Free wi-fi was provided in the room.

The room is small, like other hotelrooms in Japan, but efficient and clean. Amenties are available downstairs. Wifi and airconditioning worked very well in our room.It’s a short walk from Shinjuku station (about 10 minutes). Around the station there are a lot of shops and restaurants.We had breakfast at the cafe at the ground floor: croissants with chocolate is their specialty.Staff is friendly and helpfull. Some speak English but not all.

located very close to the busy Shinjuku station. Just make sure you follow the west exit when arriving from Narita airport on the Narita Express! Like all stations in Tokyo, Shinjuku too is massive and has different exits and access points and if you miss the right one, you'll end up in a totally different area from the one you are after! This said, you can easily walk to the hotel in 5 minutes really! It depends on the road you choose! I' d suggest the one in front of you as you leave the JR station, just face the Cocoon building and go towards it by walking past the bus station and proceed straight on, turn right until you come to the LOVE sculpture, turn right again and you'll come to the Police Station. Now all you need to do is to cross the road to find yourself in front of the hotel! Or there is another option but it'll take you a little longer. As you exit the Station, keep walking on the right as far as the traffic lights, cross the road on your left and cross again on the right then keep your left, walk past the pedestrian bridge and walk until you get to the hotel which is on your right. The hotel met all my expectations: very clean, high tech bathroom with all the toiletries you can think of, right sized room and a comfy queen bed. A kimono and slippers are provided and the free wifi and air conditioning worked perfectly! There is also a mini fridge , a flat screen TV and a boiler if you wish to enjoy typical Japanese green tea! The staff was very kind and helpful as all Japanese people are! Breakfast was not included but in the lobby there is a cafe where you can enjoy a croissant and coffee or cappuccino for about 440¥! Needless to say that Shinjuku is a busy financial and shopping district so there are so many options for food out there not to mention things to see and do! So, next time you want to go to Tokyo, stay at Nishinietsu Inn! You won't be disappointed!

Some information about services are only avalible in japaneese or just partially in english, also you can usually hear whats happening in the hallway. But except that, the personel have been really nice and so is the wi-fi, overall i think you get your moneys worth.

Spacious single room in comparison with Japanese standard. Clean and well equipped with a fast wifi connection. 10 minutes far from Shinjuku station and also close to the limousine station to narita airport. Be careful about chek-in/check-out time: check-in is at 15.00 and if you want to check-in before you have to pay something like 15$ per hour before. Check-out is at 10.00.

We chose this as it looked easy to find, with sleepy eyes, after a long flight. It was easy to get direct to Shinjuku Station from the airport and a much less overwhelming arrival point than Tokyo station. Hotel 10 mins walk and easy to find. Good area of Tokyo in its own right and great starting point for exploring the rest, esp. if you have a japan rail pass to jump on the JR trains around the city. Room a bit small for us, but spotless, quiet and comfortable. No frills, no fuss, no complaints. Jet-lag soon overcome.

great place! very clean and cozy, and nice staff.... great location too... this will be my first option when i get back to Tokyo.. i will surely recommend this place to my friends who are planning to have a trip to Tokyo..

My brother and I only stayed one night here, but it was fantastic. The service was nice and helpful. We had to check out of our previous hotel before 10am and then we headed to this one. We were too early to check in here, but they took care of our bags so that we could go and explore.The hotel was really easy to find. And it is really well located in Shinjuku.The room was fantastic. A good size and comfy beds.We really enjoyed our stay here.

Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Exceptionally convenient location in West Shinjuku, close to the convenient stores, restaurants and the shopping malls. Hotel is about about 10 min walk from the Shinjuku station (west exiton the Odakyuu / Keio line side).

Very good hotel. 5 minutes away from a public transport hub, in a neighbourhood filled with restaurants. Compact room with everything you could need, very polite staff, good wifi connectivity throughout the property. Bed was a little hard, but I like it that way. Would stay again.

Very conveniently located close to public transport. Rooms were small but well appointed and very clean. The staff were friendly and we had no trouble understanding their English. It was great to have wifi in the rooms and coin operated laundry facilities available. We were given a room on the non-smoking floor but did find that some people smoked anyway and the smell got into our room, but this just seemed to be a hazard of travelling in Japan. Overall we were happy with our stay, and would come back again.

- Really strong wifi signal in the room, close to the convenient stores, restaurants and the shopping malls. Location is about 7-10 min walk from the JR Shinjuku station (make sure you get out at the central west exit). There are several loundry rooms in some floors (I didn't use it though).- Room was quite warm in December, and a bit small (as any other hotel room in japan).

We were very happy with the hotel. Good location near Shinjuku train station, very helpful English speaking stuff, rooms small but adequate. It has everything needed for comfortable stay. And very good price/quality ratio. Proximity to the Shinjuku train station is very convenient for people who want to make trips to other places.
